loans.name: Amriddin

texts.ru:
Мирзоев Амриддин молодой, но уже преуспевающий предприниматель. Ему  20 лет и он  холост. Амриддин торгует мужской одеждой на рынке "Панджшер"  г. Душанбе. У него 5 лет опыта в этой деятельности и начал бизнес со своим другом.  В его ассортименте большой выбор одежды для молодого поколения.  Строгие, деловые сорочки и стильные, спортивные одежды для мужчин. Этим делом он помогает своим родителям, внося свой вклад в семейный бюджет.  
Файзулло нужны средства для приобретения межсезонных мужских одежд и он хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Amriddin M. is young, but is already a successful entrepreneur. He is 20 years old and is a bachelor. Amriddin sells men’s clothing at the “Pandzhsher” market in Dushanbe. He has 5 years of experience in this area and started the business with his friend. He has a large selection of products targeted at the young generation. He sells conservative, business shirts and stylish sportswear for men.

Amriddin’s business allows him to help his parents and to contribute to the family budget. He needs a loan in order to purchase mid-season men’s clothing; he would like to take out a loan for 2000 somoni for a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Nermina

texts.en:
Nermina is 30 years old woman from village of Vitkovići, near the town of Gorazde. Together with her husband she does the agriculture and she will use this loan to buy compost and to prepare land for the winter. They intend to sow all kinds of Fall vegetables to sell and then to make purchases for her household.

Nermina has two children, one and nine years old. She has asked for a loan in the amount of 600 KM ($US450).

loans.use: To buy compost.

loans.name: Narindj

texts.en: Narindj is the mother of 6 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli town, settled in Fizuli region in Alkhanli village. She was born in 1950. She has run this business for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of US$ 625 to buy a calf to expand her cattle-breeding business.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi M. sells foodstuffs and cooked foods. She cooks foods like eba, amala and fufu. She has been in this business for a long time. M. is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Iran, Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. She is requesting the loan of $1200 to enable her to buy more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Todjidin

texts.ru: Предпринимателю Тоджидину 24 года.  Он торгует мужской одеждой  5 лет. Местом его деятельности является оптовый рынок «Корвон» города Душанбе. Он продает исключительно строгие одежды для деловой встречи. Его девиз «Строгое – всегда в  моде». В его ассортименте большой выбор летних и осенних, хлопчатобумажных, шелковых и лавсановых сорочек и брюк.  Он закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая. У него постоянные клиенты, которые, покупая какой ни будь товар, заказывают товары с другими фасонами и расцветками. В межсезонный период всегда наблюдается нехватка ассортимента. Именно в этот период клиент стает перед выбором одежды. И чтоб клиент уходил с покупкой, Тоджидин хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
The entrepreneur Todjidin is 24 years old. He has been selling menswear for five years. His business is located in the wholesale market Korvon in Dushanbe. He exclusively sells business clothes. The shop’s motto is “Strict Ð is always in fashion.” His inventory includes a wide assortment for summer and autumn: cotton, silk and synthetic shirts and trousers. He buys the goods from suppliers in China. He has regular clients who, when buying goods, order various styles and colors. Between seasons, there is always a shortage of variety. This is the exact time that the clients need new clothes. So that the clients will leave his shop with purchases, Todjidin wants to take out a loan for 2000 somoni for six months to increase his inventory.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Magui

texts.fr: Magui K. est âgé de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. EIle habite à  Danyi, un village à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame  Magui tient depuis 2 ans une boutique. Avec ce second crédit, elle souhaite acheter des sacs de riz, des cartons de laits, de sucres, des boissons et des huiles alimentaires en vue de les revendre et augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les gains issus de l’activité permettront à madame Magui de faire face aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Magui K. is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children, who are all in school. She lives in Danyi, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Ms. Magui has had a shop for two years. With this second loan, she would like to buy sacks of rice, boxes of milk, sugar, beverages, and cooking oil with the goal of reselling them and increasing the capacity of her business. The gains from the business will enable Ms. Magui to address the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, boxes of milk, sugar , beverages, and cooking oils

loans.name: Behka

texts.en:
Behka was born in 1966, and she is from the village of Filipovići, near the town of Foča. She is married and she has three children. Her husband is unemployed, but sometimes he finds something to do for someone in order to earn some money for his family.

They are doing agricultural work and that is their only secure source of income. They are also have one cow and they sell milk and milk products in the village.

They want to use this loan to expand their agricultural business and to buy seeds for their greenhouse. They want to make reserves of vegetables for the winter.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola I. is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ilaje, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells frozen foods and foodstuffs.  Bola is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more frozen food and foodstuffs for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en: Yemi A. sells drinks in her shop. She sells both wholesale and retail.  Yemi is 43 years old and married with a child. She is a LAPO client. Yemi lives in Iba, Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of $1025 to buy more drinks for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Emerance

texts.en:
Greetings from Emerance in Gisenyi, Rwanda! Emerance is a 35-year-old, hard-working entrepreneur, married with 6 children and one adopted orphan.

Emerance sells tomatoes and maize flour as a wholesaler in Gisenyi town. This client travels by bus to go to the south of Rwanda to Cyangungu and Kibuye to buy the tomatoes and cassava flour and transports her goods to Gisenyi to be re-sold retail in local markets. 

She is requesting a loan worth 360,000 frws to buy more products for her growing business.

loans.use: buying tomatoes and maize flour to re-sell wholesale

loans.name: Modzinou

texts.fr: Modzinou A. est âgé de 26 ans, marié et mère d’un enfant. Modzinou réside à Danyi, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il cultive le jardin des choux qu’elle revend après la récolte. Le revenu généré par son activité étant toujours maigre, Il désire, par cette chance de kiva, accroître la taille de son activité pour une production en quantité plus importante permettant d’avoir un rendement meilleur. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer.
texts.en:
Modzinou A. is 26 years old, married, and the father of one child. Modzinou resides in Danyi, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He cultivates a garden of cabbages, which he resells after harvesting them. Since the income generated by his work is always meager, he would like to use this opportunity from Kiva to increase the size of his business in terms of more significant production, allowing for a better return. The profits derived from his business will enable him to take on part of his household needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his arable land

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke O. sells palm oil in her house. She buys the palm oil  wholesale and she sells to palm oil vendors. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. Ronke is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is a LAPO client.
The little capital that she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance has helped her business. But she needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more palm oil in large quantities for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther M. is 43 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Iba, Lagos state, Nigeria. Esther sells foodstuffs. She has been in this business for long time. Esther is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more frozen foods and foodstuffs for sale. She says thank you to all that have made this loan.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina U. sells foodstuffs like garri, a tapioca like food made from cassava, cocoa yams and vegetables. She has been in this business for a long time. Regina is 41 years old and married with 5 children. She is a LAPO client. Regina is requesting a loan of $850 to buy more foodstuffs for sale  for business expansion and for profit maximization.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Izon-Eve

texts.en: Izon-Eve T. is popularly known as Iya Elemun. She sells pepper soup, palm wine and drinks in her shop located on Oniyore Road, Ajegunle, Lagos State, Nigeria. At 50 years of age, Izon-eve has shown no sign of getting tired of her determination to pull her family out of poverty and improve the prosperity of her business. Izon-Eve has 4 children. She has been in this business since 1988. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more palm wine and drinks for sale. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more palm wine and drinks for sale

loans.name: Mawunyo

texts.fr: Mawunyo  D. est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois sont à l’école.   L’infatigable Mawunyo  aime beaucoup l’agriculture notamment le jardinage qu’elle pratique depuis des années avec plus de passion à Apéyémé, une Zone semi urbaine située à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle  souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son activité pour une production en quantité plus importante permettant d’avoir un rendement meilleur. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer
texts.en:
Mawunyo D. is thirty-five years old. She is married and the mother of five children, of which three are in school. A tireless woman, she loves agriculture and especially gardening, which she has done passionately for years. She lives in Apéyémé, a semi-urban area about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. With this, her first loan from FECECAV, she hopes to increase the size of her garden to grow more crops and have a better overall yield. The profits earned in this occupation will allow her to share the financial burden of her household.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase amount of farmable land

loans.name: Semka

texts.en:
Semka lives with her family at the village Doborovci, near the town Gračanica. Her husband has a full-time job working in Croatia. He can earn about 1500 KM. Semka has one cow and she sells milk and milk products. She can earn about 300 KM doing this. She has two children, 14 and 19 years old, and both of them are going to school.

This is Semka's first loan in the amount of 1200 KM and her intent is to buy one more cow in order to increase milk production. With bigger milk production she will increase the monthly income for her household.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Claver

texts.en:
Greetings from Claver in Gisenyi, in the Northern province of Rwanda! Claver is 42 years old, married with 7 children and 2 adopted orphans.

Claver owns a truck and uses it for the transportation of different goods to local markets. He is hired by business entrepreneurs to transport potatoes, cassava flour, and sorghum. Cabbage from Gisenyi's rural areas goes to Kigali (the capital of Rwanda) and other urban areas for re-sale. Besides the transportation business activity he does, Claver himself grows potatoes, which he sells to nearby secondary schools. He employs 5 people who help him to load and off-load the truck.

Clever is looking for a loan worth 502,265 frws to buy new tyres for his truck because the ones his truck has are old and it's hard to drive on them in such hilly areas with this rainy season.

loans.use: To buy new tyres for his truck

loans.name: Paulet

texts.en:
Paulet O. sells drinks in her shop located in the Agdede area of Lagos State, Nigeria. Paulet sells drinks like malt, soft drinks, juice, and alcoholic beverages. Paulet is 36 years old and married with one child. She is a LAPO client.

Paulet needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more drinks for sale. She says that this will increase her profit growth. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Senada

texts.en:
Senada was born in 1977 and she is married. She lives with her family in Gračanica. She does the weave of sheets and small carpets, selling to her constant stream of customers.

With this loan in the amount of 1200 KM ($US900) she intends to buy new wool and cotton for her business. She wants to make new weave products and to expand her offerings in order to help her household with the money.

loans.use: To buy wool and cotton.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel A. is 50 years old and she is married with 5 children. She sells cooked foods in her shop located in Uduafa town in Ikorodu, Lagos state, Nigeria. Rachel has been in this business for a long time. Rachel needs the loan amount of $425 her buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina C. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has never received schooling. Faustina sells foodstuffs in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2008. Faustina uses her income to pay for her children's education. Faustina will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to acquire a piece of land to gradually build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha A. is married and has 4 children. She has never received any schooling. Martha has been selling maize, groundnuts, beans and other food items in Cape Coast since 2008. Martha uses her income to help her husband pay for their children's education. 

Martha will use the loan to increase her stock for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Martha plans to help her husband acquire a piece of land for a family house.

loans.use: To increase her stock for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is married and has 5 children. She has never received schooling. Elizabeth sells groceries, sauce pans, and ladies' wear in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a librarian.

Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband pay for their children's education. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more stock for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to help her husband in putting up a family house.

loans.use: to purchase more sauce pans and ladies' wear for re-sale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Greetings from Irene, in Gisenyi town, Rwanda! Irene is 46 years old, married with 5 children and three adopted children.

Irene is running a restaurant near a secondary school in Gisenyi town. Besides owning a restaurant, she also owns a hostel were students rent rooms. She employs 4 people in the business and makes about US$ 155. 

She is requesting a loan worth 502,265 frws to buy more utensils for the restaurant such as cooking dishes, cups, spoons, plates, etc.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for the restaurant

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. sells clothing, fabric and groceries on the Cape Coast. Paulina has received polytechnic education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher. Paulina has been selling clothing, fabric and groceries since early 2008. She is responsible for providing, along with her husband, for their children's education. Her loan will be used to buy more goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.en:
The Las Margaritas group is comprised of 13 women and one man who live in the La Ramada area of Santa Cruz de la Sierra in tropical eastern Bolivia. Three of the group members (Juan Carlos, Rossy and Esperanza) are siblings. 

The group members are involved in different businesses, mostly in sales: Marcelina, Lucia, Magda and Isabel sell cosmetics, Kelly has a bakery, Fabiola and Esperanza sell clothing, Rosa sells artifacts, Paola sells toys, Juan Carlos is in construction, Gloria has an Internet café, Vanessa is a stylist, and Roxana sells crafts. The members have different levels of experience in their lines of work. Most of them have had their businesses from one to three years, although Susana has been selling her merchandise for 12 years. 

The group is taking out this loan with the hope of growing their respective businesses, and most of them will use the money to buy more merchandise to sell. 

Most of the members have had previous experience with loans at other Bolivian microfinance institutions, such as Pro Mujer and Crecer.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Seblatou

texts.fr: Seblatou A. est âgé de 25 ans. Marié et sans enfant, dynamique Seblatou aime beaucoup l’agriculture notamment le jardinage qu’il pratique depuis des années avec plus de passion à Apéyémé, une Zone semi urbaine située à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son activité pour une production en quantité plus importante permettant d’avoir un rendement meilleur. Ce faisant elle contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Seblatou A. is twenty-five years old. Married and childless, Seblatou is an energetic man who loves agriculture and especially gardening, which he has done passionately for years. He lives in Apéyémé, a semi-urban area about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. With this, his first loan from FECECAV, he hopes to increase the size of her garden to grow more crops and have a better overall yield. In so doing, he will contribute to the betterment of his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase area of farmable land

loans.name: Naciones Unidas Group

texts.en:
The Naciones Unidas (United Nations) group bank consists of 12 women and 2 men from the Munaypata zone of El Alto, Bolivia. The group members are involved in various businesses, some selling athletic wear, sweets, or clothing, others sewing and embroidering clothing or operating neighborhood stores. Most plan to use their Kiva loan to purchase more materials for their businesses.

The group is in its third loan cycle and is incorporating a few new members, all with the same commitment to work evident in those who founded the group. In Naciones Unidas' first meeting of this loan cycle, president Eva C. S. emphasized certain group qualities that should be taken very seriously, including punctuality, responsibility, and above all, the camaraderie that must exist within the group, which meets at Sra. C.'s house.

loans.use: To purchase materials for their businesses

loans.name: Nueva Semilla Group

texts.en:
The Nueva Semilla (New Seed) group bank consists of 14 women and one man who live in Villa Adela, Sensata, Cruz del Sur, Huayna Potosi, and other neighborhoods close to the Viacha Highway in the city of El Alto. The group's leadership board is headed by Maxima T. A., Clara Elena M. D. A. and Irene Q. Y..  

The women in the group work in a variety of businesses, including selling maca (Bolivian root vegetable) juice, clothing, food, sweets, pickled vegetables and other foods. 

This is the group’s first loan cycle and its members are very excited to work with AgroCapital because of the collaboration's potential benefits, especially the opportunity to expand their businesses. Since the women already know each other from having worked together in group banks at other financial institutions, they know how to support one another. According to the group evaluation done by their loan officer, they are very united and hardworking, so good results are to be expected.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Wotsa

texts.fr: Wotsa S. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle habite à Danyi Apéyémé, un village situé sur les plateaux de Danyi à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame  est revendeuse de l’huile rouge qu’elle prépare elle-même et revend aussitôt ou après stockage. Elle exerce cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. Avec ce second crédit, elle souhaite avoir un véritable fonds de roulement lui permettant d’acheter des noix de palme pour la préparation. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
At thirty-eight years old, Wotsa S. is married with four children. She lives in Danyi Apéyémé, a village on the Danyi Plateau, about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. Mrs. S. trades in palm oil, which she prepares herself and sells immediately, or after a period of storage. She has been in this business for more than five years. With this, her second loan, she hopes to acquire some real working capital, which will allow her to buy palm nuts for making oil. The resulting profits will allow her to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Claude in Gisenyi, Rwanda! Jean Claude is 34 years old, married with five children and has adopted one orphan.
 
Jean Claude grows flowers and sells them in the markets and to people for wedding decorations, to churches, and for burial ceremonies. He has two flower gardens. Besides growing flowers, he also buys goats and sells them to restaurants for meat in Gisenyi town.  He earns about US$ 92 per month.

He is requesting the loan amount of 300,000 frws to be able to grow more flowers because of the increased demand of his growing clientele. He will be repaying this loan in monthly installments for 8 months.

loans.use: Increase his working capital to grow more flowers

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.en:
The Primavera ("Spring") group bank, from Portachuelo in the tropical Santa Cruz region of Bolivia, has been working with AgroCapital for three loan cycles now under the presidency of Sra. Juanita B.; this will be the group's fourth loan.

Eleven of the fourteen group members work selling food: Yobana, Maria Teresa and Maria Esther sell prepared meals; Maria Lourdes owns a liquor store; Teresa, Olga, Argentina and Angela sell bread, and Dory and Alina are cooks. Of the remaining group members, Ramiro and Castulo work in construction, while Marlene is an Avon saleswoman. Most of the group members plan to use their Kiva loan to buy cooking supplies and construction materials.

Sra. B. has led the group well, teaching them about the central communal guarantee they offer one another, and the group has paid off all of its previous loans without any problems. Therefore, they have been approved for a new loan so that they can continue to work and keep investing to develop and expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase cooking supplies and construction materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama S. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite à  Apéyémé un village commercial des plateaux de Danyi à 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle achète à chaque saison des produits tropicaux tels le café et le cacao qu’elle revend aux exportateurs. Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle désire faire beaucoup plus de stocks. Le bénéfice étant lié directement à la quantité vendue, elle compte vraiment gagner avec cette opportunité de kiva ce qui lui permettra de rembourser promptement et améliorer la qualité de la vie.
texts.en:
Ama S. is 38 years old. She is married with five children. She lives in Apéyémé, a village on the Danyi plateau, about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. Each season, she buys tropical products like coffee and cacao, which she sells to exporters. With this new loan, she wishes to greatly increase her stocks. Her profits being directly linked to the volume of her sales, she expects to benefit greatly from this opportunity Kiva has given her. This will allow her to pay off her debt promptly and improve her quality of life.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cacao and coffee for resale

loans.name: Lourdes Maria

texts.en:
Sra. Lourdes Maria M. B., 36 years old, lives with her parents and 30-year-old sister (who is co-signing for this loan) in Warnes, in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. Sra. M., a domestic employee in the city of Santa Cruz, and her sister, an elementary school teacher, have many years of experience in their respective jobs.

Sra. M. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to invest in opening up a tileworks shop, which she expects will increase her income.

This is Sra. M.'s third loan from AgroCapital. Her two previous loans were both repaid in full more than two years ago. She has no other debts in other financial institutions.

loans.use: To open a tileworks shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Risa is 59 years old, a widow and has 5 grown children. Currently two of her unmarried sons live with her as well as one of her daughters, who is a single mother.

She owns a motorcycle which is taken care of and driven by her sons while she takes care of the management of the business. In addition she sells second-hand clothing, which she sells or trades for animals in the small towns around Yarinacocha (in the Pucallpa district). She has been doing this work for the past 4 years and it takes up her entire day. She likes her work very much because she gets to know other places and to meet people.

Rosa works to take care of her expenses and to keep her business going.

She would like to buy replacement parts to fix her motorcycle so her sons can continue to work without worries.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa tiene 59 años, es viuda, tiene 5 hijos que son independientes, en la actualidad vive con dos de sus hijos que son solteros y con una de sus hijas que es madre soltera.

Es propietaria de un motocarro, el cual es cuidado y manejado por sus hijos, mientras ella se encarga de la administración. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, la vende o hace intercambio por animales en distintos caseríos de Yarinacocha (Distrito de Pucallpa), viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 4 años y le toma casi todo el día. Le gusta mucho su trabajo por que conoce muchos lugares y se socializa.

Rosa trabaja para solventar sus propios gastos propios y para mantener activo su negocio.

Desea comprar repuestos para la reparación de su motocarro, para que sus hijos trabajen tranquilos, sin preocupaciones.

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Tanith

texts.es:
Tanith, 39 years old, is the mother of 4 children. Three of them are adults and have families. The youngest of her children lives at home and is a student. She lives with her husband, Juan, who is a worker.

She sells womens´ shoes, which she sells just outside her home located is a high-traffic area. She has been doing this for 2 years and it has gone very well for her. What she likes about her work is that she deals with and meets many people. What is difficult for her is that she does not have a suitable selling space for her business and she has to display her shoes on a plastic tarp.

Tanith works to help out her husband with daily expenses and with her children´s education.

She would like to have a display stand built and use it for her customers´ convenience.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Tanith, de 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos, tres de ellos ya independientes y con familia, quedando el último de sus hijos en su casa, quien está estudiando. Ella vive junto a su esposo Juan, trabajador dependiente.

Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos para damas, los vende en las afueras de su vivienda, ya que es una zona muy concurrida y transitable, en este negocio, ya lleva 2 años y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que trata con muchas personas y se socializa más. Lo difícil para ella, es no contar con un local adecuado para su negocio y tiene que mostrar sus zapatos sobre un plástico extendido.

Tanith trabaja para apoyar con los gastos diarios a su esposo y para la educación de sus hijos.

Quiere mandar a construir un kiosco e implementarlo debidamente para la comodidad de sus clientes.

loans.use: Build a stand for selling shoes.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda, 31 years old, has 3 children. Two of them are students and the youngest is a baby. She lives with her husband who sells groceries wholesale and who helps her out whenever possible.

She is a determined and visionary woman. She sells beer wholesale (50 cases daily), a business which she runs from her home, working 24 hours a day. She has a select clientele (warehouses and bars) and she sells the product for cash or credit. What she likes about her work is selling and meeting many people. What is difficult for Esmeralda is that she does not have a secure area for storing her products.

She works to take care of daily expenses and for her children´s education.

She would like to build an adequate space in her home where she can store the beer. Later on she would like to have a distributorship, not only for beer but also for soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Esmeralda, de 31 años, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudiantes y el último un bebe, ella vive junto a su esposo, quien es comerciante (vende abarrotes al por mayor) y la apoya en lo posible.

Ella es una mujer decidida y visionaria, se dedica a la venta de cerveza al por mayor (50 cajas diarias), negocio que instaló dentro de su vivienda, trabaja las 24 horas del día. Su clientela es selecta (bodegas y bares) y les deja su producto al crédito o al contado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y socializa con mucha gente. Lo difícil para Esmeralda es no contar con un local seguro para almacenar sus productos.

Esta madre trabaja para solventar los gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.

Quiere mandar a construir un local adecuado en el interior de su vivienda, donde almacenará sus cervezas. Posteriormente quiere llegar a tener una distribuidora, no solo de cerveza, sino también de bebidas gasificadas.

loans.use: Build a space to store cases of beer, which she sells wholesale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is single, 33, and a mother of a 14 year old daughter who is a high school student and her reason to advance. For four years, she has worked hard to sell and serve food at her home. She works the entire day, selling breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She depends on her daughter, who helps and supports her very much. What she likes about her work is that she knows many people and they like to eat good food. She doesn't have difficulties, for her business is doing well. Norma works to meet her daily needs and to fund her daughter's education. She would like to buy more tables and chairs for her customers. Later on, she would like to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Norma es soltera, tiene 33 años y es madre de una hija de 14 años que estudia en la secuandaria y es su razón de ser y salir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de comida dentro de su vivienda desde hace 4 años, esta actividad la realiza todo el día, ya que vende desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, quien la ayuda mucho. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente y que las personas degusten de su buena sazón. No tiene dificultades, ya que su negocio marcha bien. Norma trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios y la educación de su hija. Ella quiere comprar más mesas y sillas, porque las que tiene no alcanzan para todos los clientes. Posteriormente quiere poner un restaurante.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for her food business

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde A. is 42 years old and is married with three children. She sells hair extensions and she also weaves and braids hair for her customers. Kehinde was weaving her customer's hair when our team came to snap her picture. Kehinde also sells kerosene. Beside her is a drum of kerosene and on top are containers for measuring it out to customers. Kehinde has been in this business since the year 2000. She needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more hair extensions and kerosene for sale. Kehinde says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions and kerosene for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha, 52 years old, and her husband Martín have three children. Their children work, are single and live with them.

She sells meals in the evenings, and has her business outsiD. her home, where she had a small stand built so she could proviD. better service to her customers. This is an activity she has done for the past 2 years, and it is going very well for her. She has a special touch in the kitchen and is a very good cook.

What she likes about her work is to give good service so that the same customers will return again. Bertha works to take care of daily expenses and to keep her business going.

She would like to expand her business location and later to fix it up so her customers are more comfortable. This is the reason she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Bertha, D. 52 años y su esposo Martín, tienen tres hijos que ya trabajan, son solteros, pero viven con ellos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, solo lo hace por las noches, tiene este negocio en las afueras D. su domicilio, donD. mandó a construir un kiosco para dar una mejor atención a su clientes, esta actividad la realiza hace ya 2 años, y le va muy bien, ya que tiene unas manos especiales para la cocina, tiene muy buena sazón.

Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, para que los mismos regresen en otra oportunidad. Bertha trabaja para solventar los gastos diarios y mantener activo su negocio.

Desea ampliar su negocio y posteriormente ambientarlo como es debido para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes, este es el motivo por el que solicita el préstamo.

loans.use: Expand her business location so she can offer greater convenience and attention to her customers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, 56 years old, is the mother of 4 children who work and study. She lives with her husband, Jorge, who is a mechanic and who supports her a lot.

She owns 3 motocycles, which are driven by her sons who take care of transporting passengers. She bought these vehicles a year ago, and she is the one in charge of managing family expenses and the earnings from the motocycles. Her husband is in charge of repairing them and maintaining them in good condition.

What she likes about her work is that it generates good income and things are going well now.

With a loan, Carmen would like to buy replacements parts and repair her motorcycles so they are in good condition and continue to generate income. Later on she would like to have some rooms built onto her house and rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen, de 56 años, es madre de 4 hijos que estudian y trabajan, vive junto a su esposo Jorge, quien es mecánico y la apoya mucho.

Ella es propietaria de 3 motocarros, los mismos que manejan sus hijos, quienes se dedican al transporte de pasajeros, hace ya un año que compró estos vehículos y es la que se encargada de administrar los gastos familiares y las ganancias de los motocarros, su esposo es el encargado de reparar cualquier falla y mantenerlos en buen estado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera muchos ingresos y por ahora le va muy bien.

Con el dinero del préstamo, Carmen, quiere comprar repuestos y reparar sus motos para que estén en buen estado y sigan generando ingresos, ya que posteriormente quiere mandar a construir habitaciones en su vivienda para arrendarlos.

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to repair her motorcycles.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is 32 years old and separated from her husband. She lives with her little 6-year-old daughter Maria. She has a small metalworking shop which she installed in her parent´s house, where she lives. The work is rough. Lourdes has workers who help her but she manages everything. She has been doing this job for the past five years, during which time she has been very productive and happy doing the work.

She wants her daughter Maria to have a respectable life and to give her what she needs to have that, like an education. With a loan, she would like to buy more metal and increase production so she can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes tiene 32 años, está separada de su esposo, vive con su pequeña hija de 6 años llamada Maria. Se dedica a trabajar en el pequeño taller de metal que puso en la casa de sus padres que es donde vive, el trabajo es rudo, Lourdes tiene trabajadores que la ayudan, pero ella es la que maneja todo.Ella realiza este trabajo desde hace cinco años atrás, tiempo que ha venido siendo muy productivo, por lo que está contenta de realizarlo.

Quiere que su pequeña María tenga una vida digna, darle armas, como la educación, para que se defienda en la vida. Con el dinero obtenido quiere comprar más metal y aumentar su producción para expandir su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase metal for her workshop.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is 41 years old, married, and lives with her husband Claudio and her sons Wilfredo, 18, years old, Yda, 14 years old, and Juan Carlos, 10. She sells meat as a traveling saleswoman, bringing the meat every day from her hometown, Caracoto, where she currently lives. She has been doing this work for the past 10 years. Paulina travels early in the day to the city of Juliaca, bringing with her the meat she will sell during the day. The best sales happen in the morning, but she stays until the afternoon, which is when she finishes selling all her merchandise. The most difficult part of her work is the travel and transporting the meat from city to city, but Paulina is used to this and likes being able to be independent through this job.

With the money from this loan, she will buy more meat to sell and in this way improve her business. In time, she wants to have a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Paulina tiene 41 años, es casada, vive con su esposo Claudio y sus hijos Wilfredo D. 18, Yda D. 14 y Juan Carlos D. 10. Se dedica a la venta D. carne D. forma ambulatoria, la carne la trae todos los días desD. su pueblo natal, Caracoto, que es donD. ella vive, esta actividad la viene realizando desD. hace ya diez años atrás.Paulina viaja desD. muy temprano a la ciudad D. Juliaca trayendo la carne que venderá durante el día, usualmente las horas D. mayor venta son en las mañanas, pero ella se queda hasta la tarD., que es cuando acaba la venta D. su mercadería.Lo más difícil D. su trabajo, es viajar trasladando la carne D. ciudad en ciudad, pero Paulina ya está acostumbrada y le gusta poder valerse por ella misma realizando su trabajo.

Con el dinero del préstamo, comprará más carne para vender, así mejorar su negocio y con el tiempo tener una pequeña tienda D. comestibles.

loans.use: Increase her working capital in order to buy more meat.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is 27 years old and separated. She lives with her two children; Jhon, 2 years old and Lizbeth, 9 months old. As a child, she learned to knit from her mother, who taught her this art. Thanks to this, today Ana can support her family and provide for their economic needs. Ana is constantly knitting; whatever she is doing, she always has knitting needles in her hands. She has been knitting since she was nine years old to help support the family. Ana likes to knit and it also allows her to take care of her small baby. She can knit while she watches the baby sleep.

This mother wants to help her two young children get ahead and to become professionals.

With the loan she is requesting, she will buy more wool and produce more clothing. If possible, she will buy a knitting machine and in the future she will have a workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ana tiene 27 años se separó de su pareja y ahora vive con sus dos hijos; Jhon de 2 y Lizbeth de 9 meses de nacida. Desde muy niña aprendió a tejer de su madre, la cual le enseñó ese arte, gracias a ella hoy en día Ana puede mantener a su familia y brindarle el sustento económico que tanto necesitan.No hay momento en el cual Ana se separe de su tejido, ya que haga lo que haga, siempre está con las agujas de tejer en las manos, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace nueve años, como sustento principal de su familia.A Ana le gusta tejer, ya que además le permite atender a su pequeña bebe que requiere cuidados, ella puede tejer mientras vela su sueño, es por eso que no encuentra dificultad en hacerlo.

Esta madre, quiere sacar adelante a sus dos hijos pequeños, a los cuales quiere ver profesionales.

Con el dinero que solicita comprará más lana y producirá más prendas, y si es posible, comprar una maquina de tejer, para que en el futuro pueda tener un taller.

loans.use: Buy wool for making clothing and a machine for knitting.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria is 28 years old and divorced. She lives with her four children; Abraham who is 14, Edwin who is 8, Yudith who is 3 and Jose Manuel who is 1.

She handknits clothing, which she does at home and sells in the Laguna Temporal market in the city of Juliaca. She has been doing this work for the past two years. Prior to this she sold seasonal products, but decided to change her activity to do what she like best: knitting. Knitting clothing by hand takes time, so she has to work all day long in order to finish the clothing on time. This is the hardest part of her work, but over the years she has learned to be patient and to trust her skills, and things have gone well for her business.

Hilaria worries about her four children´s futures and wants them to have a promising and prosperous future.

With money from a loan she will buy more wool in order to produce more clothing and someday would like to have a small workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Hilaria tiene 28 años, es divorciada, vive con sus cuatro hijos; Abraham de 14, Edwin de 8, Yudith de 3 y Jose Manuel de 1 año.

Se dedica a tejer prendas de vestir a mano, las cuales elabora en su casa y comercializa en el mercado Laguna Temporal de la ciudad de Juliaca, ha venido desarrollando este trabajo hace dos años, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de productos por temporada, pero decidió cambiar a la actividad que más le gusta realizar, el tejido.El tejer una prenda a mano le demora bastante tiempo, es así que tiene que trabajar durante todo el día para poder terminar las prendas puntualmente, siendo esto lo más difícil de su trabajo, pero los años le enseñaron a ser paciente y confiar en su destreza haciendo que le vaya bien en su negocio.

Hilaria se preocupa por el futuro de sus cuatro hijos, a los cuales quiere ver con un futuro próspero y prometedor.

Con el dinero del préstamo podrá comprar más lana, para producir más prendas y en el futuro tener su pequeño taller.

loans.use: Buy wool to product more clothing.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime is 28 years old and lives with Rolina and his small 6 year old daughter Mirian, who started primary school. Jaime was born and lives in Juliaca, and for 8 years he has been machine knitting clothing, which he learned from his mother who taught him all the secrets to making beautify and attractive items of clothing. Today, with his wife Rolina, they both work on creating clothing with the knitting machine. Their knitting machine is in their house, and they work all day Monday through Friday, then on Saturday and Sunday they go out and sell the items they made at various markets throughout the city. The business is good because Jaime and Rolina work well together, being able to work together all day and take care of their small daughter Mirian. What is difficult is only having one knitting machine, they aren’t able to produce the quantities that they would hope to and be able to generate more income. Their daughter Mirian is the focus of these parents, on her behalf they work day after day in order to give her a promising future. With the money from the loan, Jaime will be able to buy a knitting machine for his wife, increase production, and in the future establish a small shop where he can employ more knitters.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Jaime tiene 28 años, convive con Rolina y con su pequeña hija Mirian de 6 años, quien ya empezó la escuela primaria. Jaime es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde hace ocho años ha venido dedicándose al negocio del tejido a máquina, que aprendió de su madre, la cual le ha enseñado todos los secretos para realizar prendas bonitas y atractivas.Actualmente, con su pareja Rolina, se dedican íntegramente a la elaboración de prendas tejidas a máquina, en su casa donde cuentan con una máquina de tejer, trabajando durante todo el día de lunes a viernes, ya que los días sábados y domingos salen a vender las prendas confeccionadas en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. El negocio es bueno porque existe cooperación entre Jaime y Rolina, pudiendo trabajar juntos todo el día y cuidar a su pequeña hija Mirian, lo dificultoso es contar con una sola máquina de tejer, no se abastecen para producir las cantidades que ellos esperan y generar más ingresos económicos. Su hija Mirian es la razón de ser de estos padres, por la cual trabajan día a día a favor de darle un futuro prometedor. Con el dinero del préstamo, Jaime podrá comprar una máquina de tejer para su esposa, aumentar la producción y en el futuro contar con un pequeño taller donde emplear a más tejedores.

loans.use: Buy a knitting machine to make a greater quantity of items

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima B. is 37 years old and has three children. She lives in Lagos state with her family. Fatima sells provisions in her grocery store.  She started this business seven years ago. Fatima is LAPO client. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is 49 years old, incapacitated in his left hand, and he does not view this handicap as an obstacle in his fight to be successful. He has a little store called “Abarrotes La Comadre” which his wife supports him in tending to his store as in the evenings she also works in the business. He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to stock his business and thereby attract more customers, have more sales, and therefore a better quality of life. You have the power to help in you hands, let’s support him!

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Antonio tiene 49 años, es discapacitado de su mano izquierda, y esto el no lo mira como un obstaculo para luchar en salir adelante, el tiene una tiendita llamada "ABARROTES LA COMADRE" la cual su esposa lo apoya atendiendola ya que el por las noches tambien trabaja de velador en una empresa. El esta solicitando este prestamo para comprar mas mercancia para surtir su negocio y asi lograr atraer mas clientes, tener mas ventas, y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida. TU TIENES EL PODER DE AYUDAR EN TUS MANOS, APOYEMOSLO!!

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock his store

loans.name: Palo Rosa Uno Group

texts.en:
The group bank Palo Rosa Uno ("Rose Stick I") consists of 14 partners who dedicate themselves to working hard and strengthening their small businesses with the help of credit given by AgroCapital. The group is located in the Pampa La Madre zone of Montero, in the tropical Santa C. region of eastern Bolivia.

Most of the group members have businesses in the German Moreno market selling animals, animal feed, food (sweets, salteña pastries, dry goods, and vegetables), and cosmetics. Most plan to invest their loan in additional livestock or supplies for their respective businesses.

The group's president, Elena M., has bought and sold livestock in this market for more than 15 years. She says that she is very happy to be working with the institution, having been a client now for more than a year. Newly reorganized, the group is quite excited to begin working toward common goals.

loans.use: To buy livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat S. is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells frozen foods both  wholesale and retail. Apart from this shop where she sells frozen items, she also has a shop in the market where she sells smoked and frozen fish. Kudirat has been in this business for the past 26 years. She needs a loan of $ 425 to buy more cartons of frozen foods for sale. Kudirat says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 41 years old and the single mother of three children, who are all students.

She is a strong and hardworking woman, who has always looked after the well-being of her three children. She works at home, making clothing, clay decorations, wallets, etc. or whatever she sees and has the creativity to make. She currently makes clay decorations which she sells at her shop named "Modas Hary´s" in the city of Juliaca. The production is steady and she has support from her three children, which in their free time help to make and finish the pieces. Maria likes to create and decorate new models, but the production and purchase of supplies takes time and effort.

She would like to consolidate her business, making it a source of income and economic support for her three children.

With money from a loan, Maria will be able to buy supplies for making her crafts, improve her production and grow the business. In the future, she would like to have branches of "Modas Hary´s" throughout the city of Juliaca.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Maria tiene 41 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos, los cuales son estudiantes.

Es una mujer, fuerte y trabajadora, siempre ha velado por el bienestar de sus tres hijos, trabaja en su casa confeccionando prendas de vestir, adornos de barro, carteras, etc. o lo que vea y tenga la creatividad de fabricar, en la actualidad confecciona adornos de barro que vende en su local llamado “Modas Hary’s” en la ciudad de Juliaca, usualmente la producción es buena, ella recibe el apoyo de sus tres hijos, que en sus horas libres la ayudan en la confección y acabado de las piezas.A Maria le gusta crear y confeccionar nuevos modelos, pero la producción y adquisición de material toma tiempo y esfuerzo.

Quiere consolidar su negocio, para hacer de él, la fuente de ingresos de sus tres hijos y donde puedan apoyarse económicamente

Con el dinero del préstamo Maria podrá comprar material para la elaboración de las artesanías que realiza, mejorar la producción para crecer como negocio y en el futuro tener sucursales de Modas Hary’s por toda la ciudad de Juliaca.

loans.use: Buy supplies for making crafts.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary is 30 years old and the single mother of a 3-year-old child named Chirle.

She is a native of the city of Puno and went to live in Juliaca ten years ago. She has been working hard to support her 3-year-old daughter after she was abandoned by her partner. She worked for two years in a grocery store, where she learned about the business and later on started up her own store eight years ago. Mary currently works full-time in her store, where she offers a variety of products during the week, from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. She likes all aspects of her work and does not find it difficult.

Because of her young daugher, Mary wants to look out for her and make sure history does not repeat itself in her child and that she has a promising future. With money from a loan she will buy more goods. She would like to turn her store into a general store where she can offer all kind of things.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Mary tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de una pequeña de 3 añitos llamada Chirle.

Es natural de la ciudad de Puno, se fue a vivir a la ciudad de Juliaca hace diez años, tiempo en el cual a trabajado duro por mantener a su pequeña de 3 años, después del abandono de su pareja, trabajó durante dos años en una tienda de comestibles, donde aprendió como era el negocio y más tarde poner su propia tienda de comestibles, de esto ya ocho años, ahora en la actualidad Mary se dedica íntegramente a atender su tiendita, en la cual ofrece diversos productos durante toda la semana, en un horario de 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, gustándole su trabajo en todo aspecto y no encontrando dificultad en realizarlo.

Mary, al tener una hija tan pequeña, quiere velar por su futuro, para que su historia no se repita en ella y pueda tener un futuro prometedor.

Con el dinero del préstamo comprara más productos, ella quiere que su tienda se convierta en un bazar, donde se ofrezcan variedad de cosas.

loans.use: Increase the number of products in her store, including novelties.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol is 32 years old, single, and has a 12 year old son named José who is a student in secondary school. She sells food from a tricycle. For more than 10 years this young woman from Juliaca has been working in this business, but one year ago she decided to launch her own food business, which today, can provide income for her son’s food and education. Marisol works in the mornings, offering delicious dishes. She has always enjoyed cooking, but at times it is difficult to acquire the ingredients as prices are rising. This mother wants to offer the best for her son José, so that he can study and have a professional career and a good future. With the money she will be able to buy kitchen accessories, benches to make her small business more inviting and help grown the clientele, so that in the future she can have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Marisol tiene 32 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo llamado José de 12 años de edad, quien estudia en la escuela secundaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulante, en un triciclo. Desde hace diez años esta joven juliaqueña se ha desempeñado en este negocio, apoyando a su madre ganando un poco de dinero para su manutención, pero desde hace un año decidió poner su propio negocio de comida, con el cual, en la actualidad, puede brindarle educación y alimentación a su hijo.Marisol trabaja por las mañanas, ofreciendo los ricos potajes que prepara, a ella siempre le ha gustado cocinar, pero a veces es difícil adquirir los ingredientes ya que los precios se están elevando. Esta madre, quiere brindarle lo mejor a su hijo José, para que estudie una carrera profesional y tenga un buen futuro. Con el dinero que se le facilite comprará más accesorios de cocina, bancas para hacer de su pequeño negocio un lugar más acogedor y tener mayor clientela, para que en el futuro pueda tener un restaurante.

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils and some benches for her customer's comfort

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 50 años, es soltera y vive con su hijo Rider de 16 años.  
Se dedica a tiempo completo a su restaurante, llamado, “Flor de Amancaes” que instaló en su casa para mantenerse económicamente, usualmente trabaja desde las mañanas, ofreciendo el desayuno; al medio día, almuerzos variados y por las noches la cena, el trabajo es duro, casi todo el tiempo está cocinando y atiende durante todo el día. Una jornada diaria empieza a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 9 de la noche, felizmente cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo.La sazón de Angélica es muy apreciada por los clientes de su zona, desde muy pequeña le ha gustado cocinar, la dificultad está en abastecerse para atender a todos los clientes que frecuentan su restaurante.
Angélica quiere que su único hijo sea un gran profesional, para que en el futuro forme una familia provechosa a la sociedad.
Con el dinero del préstamo arreglará su local, para que sea más cómodo, comprar más mesas,  ampliar su negocio y si es posible contratar a un ayudante, para que en un futuro cercano su restaurante sea mucho más grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Angelica is 50 years old, single, and lives with her 16 year old son Rider. She works full time in her restaurant called "Flor de Amancaes" (Lily Flower) that she put in her house in order to support herself economically. She usually starts work serving breakfast in the morning, various lunches at midday, and dinner in the evening. The work is hard, she is cooking almost all the time and serving all day long. On a typical day she starts at 6 in the morning and ends at 9 at night. Happily she can rely on the help of her son. Angelica's recipes are much appreciated by the clients in her area, although she has just recently begun to enjoy cooking. The hard part is stocking up in order to serve all the clients who frequent her restaurant.

Angelica wants her only son to be a professional, so that in the future he can build a family beneficial to society.

With the money from the loan, she will remodel her premises, making them more comfortable. She will buy more tables, increase the size of her business, and if possible, hire a helper, so that in the near future her restaurant will be much larger and more productive.


Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge and remodel her restaurant to make it cozier, as well as to hire a helper to help with serving.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 48 years old, separated from her husband, she lives with her two children Ruth and Jhon. With great effort and many years Hilda opened a shoe shop and she has had this business for 12 years, and in that time she has learned the tricks of the trade, so to speak. The shoes that Hilda produces are sold in different markets throughout the city of Juliaca. The work is tiring, she works all day to produce the quantities that are needed, and thank God, she tells us, she can count on the support of her children and an assistant, to provide the help in making and distributing the shoes. What Hilda enjoys the most is creating new models, the most difficult is finishing the shoes on time for the orders that she has. Ruth and Jhon, her children, are the most important people in her life, the reason she gets up every day and works so hard to provide them a better life. With the money from the loan she will buy material that she is missing to produce greater quantities of shoe and in this way, with time she hopes to have a great shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Hilda tiene 48 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con sus dos hijos Ruth y Jhon. Con mucho esfuerzo y varios años de trabajo Hilda puso un taller de producción de calzado y se ha venido dedicando a este negocio desde hace 12 años, tiempo en el cual ha aprendido los gajes del oficio.Los zapatos que produce Hilda son vendidos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca, el trabajo es cansado, trabaja durante todo el día para producir las cantidades que son requeridas, gracias a Dios, nos dice, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y con un ayudante, el cual la ayuda en la elaboración y distribución de los zapatos.Lo que más le gusta a Hilda, es crear nuevos modelos, lo más difícil es terminar los zapatos a tiempo para los pedidos que le realizan. Ruth y Jhon, sus hijos, son la razón más importante, por la cual se levanta todos los días y trabaja a favor de darles una vida mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará el material que le está faltando para producir más cantidades de zapatos y así, con el tiempo tener una gran tienda de calzado.

loans.use: Buy materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Odunola

texts.en: I. Odunola is 46 years old, married and has three children. She sells foodstuffs. She also sells kerosene. She has been in this business for a long time. I. is a LAPO client. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more foodstuffs in order to meet the demands of her customers.  She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 37 años, convive con Jorge, de 36, que se dedica a la confección de prendas; y con sus tres hijos: 11, 10 y  7  años, quienes están estudiando en la escuela.
Con el apoyo de su pareja, ha logrado poner un pequeño taller de confección de poleras, con el cual les va muy bien, el negocio viene prosperando y abastece a esta familia para mantener a sus tres hijos, ellos se dedican a la producción durante las tardes y noches, ya que en el día atienden otras labores, como la de cuidar a sus hijos.Lo que más le gusta a Nilda de su trabajo es poder tener a su pareja trabajando dentro de la casa y apoyándola en el cuidado de sus tres hijos, lo difícil es confeccionar las cantidades necesarias para abastecer los pedidos que les hacen.  
Nilda  trabaja para prosperar en su negocio y brindarles a sus hijos un futuro más estable.
Con el dinero del préstamo comprará una máquina de coser, para lograr abastecerse en los pedidos de los clientes y con el tiempo, hacer que su negocio sea mucho más grande y tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Nilda is 37 years old, lives with Jorge, 36, who makes clothing, and with their three children; 11, 10 and 7 years old, who are in school. With the support of her partner, she has been able to put a small workshop in her house, which has gone very well for them. The business is coming along prospering and restocking, allowing this family to support their three children, who work on production during the afternoons and nights, since during the day they attend to other work, like raising their children. What Nilda likes most about his work is that she can have her partner working inside the house and supporting her in the care of their three children, the difficult part is making the quantities necesary to restock the orders that they have. Nilda works to succeed in her business and give her children a more stable future. With the money from the loan, she will buy a sewing machine, to be able to restock for her customer's orders, and with time, make her business much larger and have a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine to make the clothing in much greater quantity and faster.

loans.name: Akofa

texts.fr: Akofa A. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. EIle habite à  Apéyémé un village commercial des plateaux de Danyi à 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle achète à chaque saison des produits tropicaux tels le café et le cacao qu’elle revend à aux exportateurs. Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle désire acheter beaucoup plus du café e du cacao pour la revente. Akofa compte vraiment gagner avec cette opportunité de kiva ce qui lui permettra de rembourser promptement et améliorer la qualité de la vie.
texts.en:
At 38, Akofa A. is married and the mother of five children. She lives in Apéyémé, a village on the Danyi plateau, about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. Each season, she buys tropical products like coffee and cacao, which she sells to exporters. With this loan, she wishes to buy large quantities of coffee and cacao for resale. Akofa expects to profit greatly from this opportunity Kiva has given her, which will allow her to repay her loan promptly and improve her quality of life.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee and cacao for resale

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Obdulia tiene 47 años, es divorciada, vive con sus hijos Rudy D. 14 años, quien estudia en la escuela secundaria y Ronal D. 25, el cual trabaja.
Obdulia trabaja confeccionando prendas D. vestir en colaboración D. sus dos hijos, en el pequeño taller que tiene en su casa desD. hace 15 años, tiempo en el cual ha logrado consolidarse económicamente en esta actividad.Ella es natural del distrito D. Moho, trabajando durante 20 años en la confección D. prendas D. vestir, siempre le ha gustado, pero ahora teniendo su propio taller es mejor, hay pequeños problemas tanto en la adquisición del material, como en el acabado final.Se dedica la mayor parte del día a confeccionar estas prendas, las cuales significan su sustento económico.
Obdulia trabaja a favor D. su hijo pequeño, ya que el mayor ya está independizado económicamente.
Con el dinero prestado comprará al por mayor, mejor material para la confección D. sus prendas D. vestir, para su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Obdulia is 47 years old, is divorced, and lives with her sons Rudy (14), who is in high school and Ronal (25), who works. Obdulia works making clothing with her children, in the small shop that she has in her house for 15 years, the time in which she has been able to assure herself economically in this activity. She is native to the district of Moho, working for twenty years making clothing, and she has always liked it, but now having her own shop is better, even though there are small problems as much with acquiring the material as with the final product. She dedicates the majority of her day to making this neck wear, which signify her economic substenence. Obdulia works because of her young son, now that the older one is economically independent. With the money loaned, she will buy better material to make clothing so that her business can continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquiring materials to make clothing

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora is 42, is single, and lives alone. She has worked different jobs all of her life since she was very young since her family had scarce economic resources. Flora currently works selling candy and all types of sweets as a traveling street vendor on the main streets of her town. Since she has always worked, it's not difficult for her now. What is difficult is feeling lonely sometimes, such as when she arrives home and there is no one to talk to. Flora strives to have a decent life and to secure her old age.

With the money from this loan, she wants to purchase merchandise and a stand. With time, she would like to have a little store where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Flora tiene 42 años, es soltera y vive sola. Ha trabajado durante toda su vida en diferentes labores, desde muy niña, ya que su familia era de bajos recursos económicos.Flora se dedica actualmente a vender golosinas y todo tipo de dulces de forma ambulatoria en las principales calles de su localidad, ya que ella siempre trabajó duro durante toda su vida, hoy no se le hace difícil, lo difícil es sentirse sola, algunas veces, cuando llega a casa y no hay con quien hablar. Flora se esfuerza para tener una vida digna y asegurar su vejes.

Con el dinero del préstamo quiere comprar mercadería, tener un puesto y con el tiempo una tiendita, donde poder ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and purchase a stand so she can stop selling as a traveling street vendor

loans.name: Olasubon

texts.en: Olasubon O. sells foodstuffs like garri, rice, beans, plantains and yams. She started this business in the year 2000. She sells foodstuffs retail and wholesale to her customers. She is 47 years old and married with five children. She lives with her family in Lagos state. Olasubon needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 36 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos; Maribel de 18 y Yubiley de 7, quienes aún son estudiantes.
Se viene dedicando a tiempo completo a atender su tienda de comestibles, desde que migró desde su pueblo natal, hacia la ciudad, decidió abrir este negocio para mantener a sus dos hijos, los cuales demandaban gastos de estudio, alimentación y salud. Ya son siete años en el negocio, tiempo en el cual, Lucia ha ganado experiencia y viene desarrollando su trabajo con mucha alegría, ya que a ella le gusta todo sobre su tienda, lo malo es que no puede pasar mucho tiempo con sus hijos, como ella quisiera.
Lucia quiere que sus hijos estudien y puedan migrar a una ciudad grande, donde puedan tener un mejor porvenir. 
Con el dinero del préstamo implementará su tienda con más mercadería, y que en el futuro mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucia is 36 years old, a single mother of two children; Maribel, who is 18, and Yubiley, who is 7 years old. Both are still students. She works full-time serving in her food store. Since she migrated from the town where she was born to the city, she decided to open this business in order to support her two children, and to cover school, food and healthcare expenses. She has had her business for seven years, in which time Lucia has gained experience and carried out her work very happily. She likes everything about her shop, the only bad thing is that she cannot spend as much time with her children as she would like to. Lucia wants her children to study and to move to a big city, where they can have a better future. With the money from the loan she will fill her store with more merchandise, so that she can increase her future income.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise in her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 37 años, es soltera, vive con sus cuatro hijos; Rubén de 17 años, Huber de 12, Annabel de 10 y Yuliana de 2.
Al partir de su natural pueblo de Imata, con tan solo haber acabado la primaria, Beatriz decidió dedicarse a trabajar, lo cual hizo desde su juventud, hasta que hace tres años al haber juntado un poco de capital económico, le alcanzó para poner una tienda de comestibles en su domicilio, desde donde atiende a sus hijos y gana dinero para mantenerlos.A Beatriz le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede compartir con sus vecinos, con los cuales ya hizo amistad y siempre son fieles a su tienda, por otra parte el tener que atender durante todo el día hace que le resulte cansado, pero ella sigue y continuará trabajando hasta lograr todas sus metas.
Beatriz con mucha fe y persistencia trabaja para sus cuatro hijos, con el fin de apoyarlos económicamente para salir adelante, puedan estudiar, ganar dinero y formar sus propias familias.
Con el dinero del préstamo podrá surtir su tienda, para vender mucho más, ganar más dinero y poner con el tiempo una librería.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 37 years old, single, and lives with her four children; Ruben, who is 17 years old, Huber, 12, Annabel, 10, and Yuliana who is 2. On leaving her native town of Imata, having only finished her primary education, Beatriz decided to work, which she has done since her youth. Three years ago, she saved up a little capital and managed to open a food store in her home, from which she looked after her children and earned money to support them. Beatriz enjoys her work, as she can share with her neighbours, with whom she is friendly and who are always loyal to her store. On the other hand, having to serve in the store all day long makes her tired, but she will continue working until she achieves all her goals. Beatriz works with faith and persistence for her four children, with the aim of supporting them economically so they can get ahead, study, earn money and start their own families. With the money from the loan she would stock up her store, in order to sell much more, earn more money and, in time, open a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with more merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 21 años, es natural de Puno, madre soltera de una niña de 4 años, llamada Katerine, con la que vive.
Hace dos años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos de belleza, negocio con el cual paga los gastos diarios de su hogar, la venta la realiza de forma ambulatoria, por las diferentes calles y casas de la ciudad de Juliaca, caminando durante todo el día, siendo esta la parte más difícil de su labor.Por otro lado, el tener un negocio independiente le permite a Roxana decidir los horarios en los cuales trabaja y su pequeña Katerine, la puede acompañar a todas partes.
Esta madre, tiene a su hija, su razón de ser y a la cual quiere ver feliz y realizada. 
Con el dinero que solicita, quiere comprar más productos de belleza, para ganar más dinero y con el tiempo, poner un stand en alguna galería comercial.
texts.en:
Roxana is 21 years old and is a native of Puno. She is a single mother and lives with her four-year-old daughter, Katerine. Two years ago she began selling beauty products, a business that helps her pay for household expenses. Roxana works as a walking saleswoman, offering her products in different streets and houses in the city of Juliaca. She walks all day, and that is the most difficult part of her job. On the other hand, having her own business allows Roxana to determine her own hours. It also allows her young daughter Katerine to accompany her. This mother sees her daughter as a reason for being, and Roxana wants to see Katerine become happy and successful. With the money that she is requesting, Roxana wants to buy more beauty products in order to earn more money. In time, she would like to open a stand in a commercial center.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her supply of beauty products in order to increase her walking sales

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en:
Abiola A. is 42 years old and married with a child. She lives in Egbeda, Lagos State.

Ms. A. makes and sell beads to her customers. She's very industrious; she also sells bags and shoes. She often times organizes training workshops to teach young people how to make beads.

Ms. A. needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more materials for bead-making. She learned how to make beads for six months before setting up her own bead-making business in the year 2000. She says thank you

loans.use: To buy more materials for bead-making

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Greetings from Nelson in Gisenyi, Rwanda! Nelson is 35 years old, married with seven children.

Nelson runs his own forex bureau in Gisenyi town because it's very close to the border of Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo. He makes about US$ 77 per month from money exchanging.

He is looking for a loan worth 502 265 frws to increase his working capital.

loans.use: Increase his working capital

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta tiene 54 años, es divorciada, vive con tres de sus cuatro hijos, Denis de 21, Wilson de 17 y Fredy de 11, su hijo Santos de 28 ya está independizado y en planes de formar su propia  familia.
Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de productos andinos, como la papa, el chuño, entre otros, realiza esta actividad para mantener a sus hijos y poder darles una buena educación.Ella vende de forma ambulatoria por los diferentes mercados y calles de su distrito, durante las mañanas, que es cuando hay más venta. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es una labor tranquila, donde se siente cómoda, lo difícil es transportar los tubérculos por diferentes lugares, ya que son pesados.
Benedicta al ver a sus cuatro hijos, desea que sean profesionales y con un buen futuro.
Comprara con el dinero que se le facilite, más tubérculos y así aumentar la venta, en el futuro ella quiere poner otro tipo de negocio como una tienda de abarrotes o una ferretería.
texts.en:
Benedicta is 54 years old, divorced, and lives with three of her four children: Denis is 21 years old, Wilson 17, and Fredy 11. Her oldest son Santos is 28 years old, already lives on his own, and has plans to begin his own family. For the past 20 years Benedicta has worked selling products of the Andes such as potatoes and potato flour, among other items. She works in order to maintain her children and to give them a good education. She sells her products as a walking saleswoman in different markets and streets in her district. Benedicta works in the mornings, since that is when sales are good. She likes that her job offers calm work in locations where she feels comfortable. The difficulty involves transporting the tubers to different places, since the potatoes are heavy. When Benedicta looks at her four children, she hopes that they will become professionals and have a good future. With the money she receives she will purchase more tubers and thus increase her sales.
