In the future she would like to open a different type of business such as a grocery or hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more tubers to sell in various markets.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is married and has one child. Mercy sells a variety of clothing on the Cape Coast, which she has done since 2008. She is a hairdresser by profession and she owns a salon. Her husband is a driver. Mercy uses her income to provide for her children's education. Mercy will use the loan to increase the stock for sale and also purchase hair products for her salon. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to help her husband to build a family house.

loans.use: To increase stock and purchase hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es soltera, vive sola, ya que no tiene esposo, ni hijos. Desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado al negocio de la venta de golosinas, tiene un pequeño puesto por la carretera panamericana donde ofrece sus deliciosas golosinas.Usualmente, trabaja todo el día, ya que si no lo hace no alcanzaría a ganar el dinero suficiente para costear sus gastos. Lo bueno de su trabajo y lo que más le gusta es que ella es su propio jefe y nadie le tiene que decir que es lo que debe de hacer, por otro lado el mantenerse todo el día en su puesto con el frió inclemente de esta zona del país, hace que su trabajo se le haga más difícil.
Quiere forjarse un mejor porvenir, para poder formar una familia en el futuro.
Con el dinero solicitado quiere tener un puesto más grande y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos para en el futuro tener una tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Nancy is single. She lives alone as she has neither spouse nor children. For the past 15 years she has been selling candy. She has a small stand by the Panamerican Highway where she offers her delicious candies. Usually she works all day as on the contrary she would not have enough money to cover her expenses. The good thing about her job, and what she likes the most, is to be her own boss and have nobody to tell her what to do. On the other hand staying at the stand all day in the harsh cold of that area of the country makes her job more difficult.

She wishes to create a better future to be able to form a family.

With the loan requested she wishes to extend her stand and thus improve her income in order to set up a grocery store in the future.


Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Extend candy stand and increase the variety of products.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta tiene 35 años, vive con sus hijas Deysi de 13 y Favia de 11, quienes estudian en el la escuela secundaria.
Es natural de Juliaca, reside en el distrito llamado, Santa Lucía, dese hace 11 años, terminó sus estudios secundarios y abrió una tienda de comestibles para poder subsistir económicamente y sacar adelante a sus hijas.El trabajo es duro, pero felizmente tiene el apoyo de sus dos hijas, quienes cuando no están en la escuela la ayudan en la atención de la tienda, que es lo que más le gusta a Modesta, ya que esos momentos son los únicos en los cuales puede compartir al lado de sus dos pequeñas hijas.
Modesta no quiere que hijas repitan su suerte, desea que tengan mejores posibilidades de triunfar en la vida, por eso se esfuerza trabajando diariamente.
Con el dinero que solicita, abastecerá su tienda de más productos, para hacer de su negocio el más concurrido de su zona.
texts.en:
Modesta is 35 years old. She lives with her daughters Deysi, 13 and Favia, 11years old who attend middle school. She was born in Juliaca but has been living in the Santa Lucía district for 11 years. She finished her middle school studies and opened a grocery store to make a living and provide for her daughters. It is hard work but fortunately she has the support of her two daughters who help out at the store when not in school, and Modesta is very pleased with this arrangement as those are the only moments she can share with her two young daughters.

Modesta does not want her daughters to repeat her luck, she wishes for them to have better opportunities to succeed in life, and therefore she makes an effort with her daily work.

With the requested loan she will buy more supplies for her store to make her business the most popular one in the area.


Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more supplies for grocery store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is married and has 2 children. Elizabeth sells groceries such as biscuits, milk, and other canned products in Cape Coast, which she has done since early 2008. Her husband is an administrator.

Elizabeth uses her income to support her children's education. Elizabeth will use this loan to purchase groceries for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to help her husband in putting up a family house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for sale

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Greetings from Elias in Gisenyi town in Rwanda! Elias is a 25-year-old entrepreneur, married with one child, and he and his wife have adopted one orphan.

Elias buys goats, sheep, and chickens from rural areas and sells them to different restaurants in Gisenyi for meat. He earns about US$ 108.  He employs one person to help him to look after the goats after he buys them in the villages and brings them to Gisenyi town.

He is requesting a loan worth 502,265 frws to buy more animals to sell in local markets and restaurants in Gisenyi town. This loan will be repaid monthly over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more animals to sell in local markets

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
This is Issa S.. He is 38 years of age and married with four children. He is an agriculturist. He plants vegetables and has been in this business for the past ten years now.

Issa has never received a loan from SMT but he heard about SMT`s products and low interest rate from a friend and colleague. He thus approached SMT for a loan of Le 8,000,000.00 to buy tools, seeds, fertilizers, and employ labourers to assist him in carrying out his job.

loans.use: To buy tools, seeds, fertilizers, and employ labourers.

loans.name: Solidarios Group

texts.en:
The Solidarios ("Solidarity") group bank consists of 14 partners who meet every two weeks in the Virgen de Cotoca zone on Santa Cruz Street in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. Their first loan having gone well, the group now wants to take out a second one, confident that they will continue to work well together. The group says that both the responsibility and the desire to work hard are helping them to develop their small businesses and support their families. Several of the women are teachers who have businesses on the side providing additional income to improve the lives of their families.

The group members are involved in a variety of businesses: Noel, Luis and Julio all drive taxis or motorcycle taxis; Raquel owns a copy shop; Teresa, Lucia, Liliana and Celia sell clothing and underwear; Cecilia sells bread; Nancy and Celia sell prepared meals, while Maria Noemi sells Yambal cosmetic products and Rodolfo runs a body shop. Most of the group members plan to use their Kiva loan to purchase more merchandise to sell, supplies for their businesses, or ingredients to make meals.

The group's president, Rosmeri B., is thankful for the support that AgroCapital has offered the group. She is committed to ensuring that all member obligations are met.

loans.use: To purchase bulk merchandise to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana O. sells food items such as maize, beans, and ground nuts, as well as roofing sheets, at Asebu on the Cape Coast. She has been in this business since 1995. Diana has received a junior high school education, is married, and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. She is responsible for helping to pay the utility bills and her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more ground nuts, beans, maize, and roofing sheets. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more ground nuts, beans, maize, and roofing sheet.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine T.. She is 28 and married with three children. She is a business woman in Makeni City, where she works as a petty-trader selling market food. She has been in this business for the past five years now.

Josephine realized that with a loan her business would grow at a faster rate because she wouldn't depend on the little profit she makes. She thus approached SMT to solicit a loan for her from Kiva for Le 3,000,000.00.

loans.use: To expand her business selling market food.

loans.name: 27 De Agosto Group

texts.en:
The 27 D. Agosto (August 27th) group bank is a very dynamic group that holds its meetings in the neighborhood of the same name. The group has worked with AgroCapital for a good period of time now; they are currently on their third loan cycle and have not had any problems with late payments.

Most of the group members have small commercial operations and sell their wares in the Villa VerD. Market. Most sell food (fruit, vegetables, potatoes, prepared meals, bread, and sweets), though several sell clothing for adults and children, and one sells handicrafts. All of the group members have at least two years of experience with their respective businesses. Most plan to use their Kiva loans to expand their inventory.

27 D. Agosto's success has been thanks to the collaboration of all 14 of the group members, who are responsible people who know how to work in a team. The group knows what the group guarantee is, and never misses a payment at any of its meetings.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

El grupo 27 D. agosto, este es un grupo muy dinámico, que se encuentra en el barrio 27 D. agosto, es un grupo que viene trabajando bastante tiempo con agrocapital con su tercer siclo sin problemas D. retraso. La mayoría son comerciantes menoristas del mercado Villa VerD., Gracias a la colaboración D. todas las socias del grupo que son un número D. 14 personas que se responsabilizan y saben trabajar en grupo conociendo que es la garantía en grupo y no dejando atrasarse en ninguna D. sus reuniones

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Greetings from Hussein in Gisenyi town in the north of Rwanda! Hussein is 35 years old, married with three children.

Hussein earns his living by driving a motorcycle-taxi. He transports people on the motorbike around Gisenyi town. He also transports luggage to and from local markets. Besides his transportation business, his wife operates a small shop in town where she sells various home use items. He earns about US$ 135 from transporting people on his motorbike.

Hussein is looking for a loan worth 502,265 frw to buy a new motorbike because the one he owns is getting old. He will be repaying this loan on monthly basis over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to use for his business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica J. has been selling bags of rice, flour, and other foodstuffs at Asebu on the Cape Coast since 2000. Veronica has received a primary education, is married, and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. She is responsible for paying the utility bills and her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice and flour for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to assist her husband in building a family house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and flour for resale

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is Adama F.. She was born in Makeni 25 years ago. Adama is single with no children. She is a petty trader who has been in business for over five years now. She has never received a loan from SMT but has seen others make headway due to SMT loans and thus seeks a loan of Le 3,000,000.00.

With her loan, Adama is expecting to increase the size of her business. This will enable her to increase sales, make more profit, and improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To expand on her business as a petty trader.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Greetings from Marie Claire in Gisenyi town. Claire is 34 years old, married with 5 children and 1 adopted child. 

Claire sells second-hand clothes in Gisenyi market. She buys the clothes in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, and sells them in local markets in Gisenyi. She earns about US$ 125 per month. She employs one person to help her run the business.

She is looking for a loan worth 502,265 Frws to increase her stock.

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Cheveres Group

texts.en:
The Chéveres group bank is maD. up of 13 members who live in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. The group's president is Sra. Liliana P. A., who sells dry goods in the Saavedra market. 

The rest of the group is involved in a variety of occupations and businesses: Mercedes, Estela and Maribel are domestic employees; Abel is a contractor; Maricela runs her home; Santa sells dry goods; Marcela is a housekeeper; Ana Maria and Suleidy work as nannies; and Bernarda offers cleaning services.

This group is new, and is determined to get ahead with their respective businesses. Most of the group plans to use this loan to improve and expand their businesses for the good of their families and to be able to have a stable life. They are very grateful to AgroCapital for trusting them with this loan.

loans.use: Expand businesses

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina C. is married and has one child. Her husband is a carpenter. Even so, Georgina is the one who is responsible for feeding their family. Georgina proudly states that she completed her studies through senior high.

Georgina makes a local fabric known as batik and tye dye, which she sells at Asebu in the Cape Coast region. Notably, Georgina has been in this line of business since 2001. With the loan proceeds, she plans to buy more materials to make her tye dye products. In turn, she hopes to use the expected increase in profits to expand her business to reach a bigger market of customers.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional input materials in order to make her tye dye products

loans.name: Dina

texts.fr: Dina A. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse depuis 3 ans en gros et détail des sacs du charbon de bois à Apéyémé, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter de nouveaux  sacs  de charbon, afin d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce et faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer
texts.en:
Dina A. is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. For three years, she has sold coal wholesale and retail in Apéyémé, a village about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. With this loan, she hopes to buy new sacks of coal in order to increase the size of her business and meet her clients' needs. The profits she earns in this way will allow her to help meet the financial needs of her household.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of coal

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame M. is in the taxi transportation business and he also sells lobsters at Asebu in Cape Coast, Ghana. Kwame has received no education. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a trader. He is responsible for the payment of school fees, utility bills, and the feeding of his family. 

Kwame has been selling lobsters since 2006. He wants to increase his sales of lobsters. His loan will be used to buy more lobsters from Tema to resell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and to build a family house.

loans.use: To buy more lobsters to sell

loans.name: Sheika A. T.

texts.en:
This is Sheika A. T. S.. Sheika is 51. He was born is Makeni and is married with four children. He is a businessman here in Makeni, selling provisions for the past four years.

Sheika is seeking a loan of Le 3,000,000.00 from SMT for the first time. He wants to use the loan to buy more provisions to add to his shop, which will enable him to make more profit. The increased profit will improve his family's wellbeing, allowing him to feed his children well and give them a better education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is Mariama K.. She is a 32 year old business woman in Makeni, where she was born. She is married with three children. Mariama has been a petty-trader for the past seven years now.

She is seeking a loan of Le 3,000,000.00 to help her improve her business. Mariama is certain that with a loan, her business will improve a great deal and thus also her livelihood.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Abu T.. Abu was born in Makeni and is married with 5 children. Abu has sold second-hand clothes (called "junks" here) for the past 15 years now. He is seeking a loan of Le. 3,000,000 to enable him to buy more bundles of “junks” clothes. With a variety of  “junks” clothes in his shop, Abu will make more sales, increase the profit he makes, and consequently improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: Buy more bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.en:
The Girasol ("Sunflower") group bank is maD. up of 14 partners who meet in the Los Mangales neighborhood in the center of the city of Montero. Most of the group members have small businesses that they run out of their homes in order to support their families. For example, the group's president, Sra. Nelva S., is a teacher, but she also sells dry goods from her home as a second source of income.

The group members are involved in a wiD. variety of businesses. To illustrate, Reinaldo and Alexander operate motorcycle taxis; Maria Manuela is the radio operator for a taxi company; Clementina and Lizeth sell Herbalife products; MatilD., Nelva, Pabla, Fernando and Gaby all sell food (e.g., prepared meals, bread, hamburgers and dry goods); Pabla is a domestic employee; and Elia sells straw mats.

Sra. S. says that group loans are an important source of economic support for people who cannot access individual loans at other institutions because those types of loans require guarantees. Two male members of the group, who operate motorcycle taxis, agree and say that they are grateful for AgroCapital's support.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

EL BANCO COMUNAL GIRASOL conformado por 14 socios, este grupo se reúne por la zona central D. la ciudad D. Montero en el barrio los mangales, la mayoría D. sus socios tienen pequeños negocios en sus hogares como apoyo para la familia, como el caso D. la Sra presidenta Nelva S. que tiene una venta D. abarrotes en su hogar como negocio alternativo pues ella es profesora e indica que estos créditos son un apoyo económico para los sectores que no tiene acceso fácilmente a los créditos por las garantías que exigen otras entidades, D. l misma manera los socios varones que trabajan con moto taxis indican que están agradecidos por el apoyo que les brinda AGROCAPITAL.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise/materials for businesses

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela is mother of 7 children, all of whom are now independent and are the reason why she is working so hard to make something of herself now. She has been selling cold drinks (beer and fizzy drinks) for 6 years. Her business has made her feel useful again, given that she has always been so busy being an active mother. She has sold a variety of products ever since she was a much younger girl and it makes her very happy to now have her own business. Furthermore, she is owner of a tuk-tuk (motocarro), which is run by her partner. She sells cold drinks all day and enjoys her job and the satisfaction of generating an income. With the money she is requesting, she hopes to build a kiosk and offer a greater range of drinks, given that she has so many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Ángela es madre de 7 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes y son quienes la incentivan a seguir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas), desde hace 6 años. Su negocio la hace sentir una persona útil, ya que siempre se identifica como una mujer activa. Anteriormente, y desde muy joven se dedicó a la venta de distintos productos, ahora se siente muy feliz al tener un negocio propio. Además es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que es manejado por su conviviente, la venta de sus bebidas heladas la realiza todo el día, le gusta de su trabajo y la satisfacción de ver sus ingresos diarios. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a construir un kiosco e implementarse de más bebidas, ya que tiene muchos clientes.

loans.use: To increase the amount of drinks she sells and build a kiosk for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 55 years old, mother to 4 grown children, lives with her husband Santos, who supports her in everything. For 2 years she has worked growing flowers and ornamental indoor and outdoor plants and selling chicken. Her plants are purchased by different government institutions and she sells her chicken to various chicken processors. She does this work over various hours of the day. What she likes about her work is socializing with others and being able to keep the support of the institutions. What is difficult is not having adequate land for her plants, which she grows inside of her home. Rosa asks for this loan because she wants to increase the quantity of seeks, of different varieties of plants and flowers. In the future she would like to become an exporter.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa, de 55 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos, quienes son ya independientes, vive con su esposo Santos, quien la apoya en todo. Desde hace 2 años se dedica al cultivo de flores y plantas ornamentales para interiores y exteriores, y la venta de carne de pollo. Sus plantas son compradas por diferentes instituciones del gobierno y la carne de pollo las vende a diversas pollerías, esta labor le toma solo algunas horas del día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se socializa y poder conservar el apoyo de las instituciones. Lo difícil es no contar con un terreno adecuado para sus plantas, lo hace en el interior de su vivienda. Rosa solicita este préstamo porque quiere incrementar la cantidad de semillas, de distintas variedades de plantas y flores, posteriormente le gustaría ser exportadora.

loans.use: Buy seeds for different types of plants and flowers

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is 53 years old and a former teacher. Her one daughter is now an independent adult. Mercedes lives with her husband Pedro, who is also an active teacher and farmer. She now gives reinforcement classes, as well has helping her husband with the farming duties, scattering corn or different grains depending on the season. When their product is ready, Pedro gives it to Mercedes, and she is then in charge of contacting a buyer. They have been doing this for 2 years, and enjoy it! It gives them to the chance to gain experience and socialise with others. With the loan money, she wants to buy more grain to scatter, as well as build a shelter (with a roof made of branches and sticks to block out the sun) for her small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Mercedes, de 53 años, es profesora cesada, madre de una hija mayor e independiente, ahora vive con su esposo Pedro, quien es también profesor (activo) y agricultor. Ahora ella se dedica al dictado clases de reforzamiento, adicionalmente ayuda a su esposo en las tareas agrícolas, siembran de maíz o diferentes granos de acuerdo a la temporada. Cuando el producto está lista, Pedro se lo entrega a Mercedes, ella es la encargada de contactar a un comprador. Esto lo vienen realizando desde hace 2 años, lo que le gusta, es ganar experiencia y socializar con otras personas. Con el dinero del préstamo, quiere comprar granos para sembrar, como también mandar a construir una ramada (techo hecho a base de ramas y palos para protegerse del sol) en su chacra.

loans.use: To buy grain and to build a shelter made of branches to protect their land from the sun.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica, 34 years old, is a mother to three children who study in primary and secondary school. She, together with her husband Daniel, who is a mechanic, have set out to help their family get ahead. Her business is selling groceries and basic necessities. She is a woman who has fought to get ahead, she began her business 2 years ago and thanks to her good attention and above all her management, it has grown day after day. Her store is inside her home, she attends to her store almost all day long, which she enjoys as she learns a lot and above all she socializes with her neighbors, which is difficult because her space is so small. Verónica works to meet her family’s expenses and for her children’s education. With the money from the loan, she wants to implement and expand her business and later remodel her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Verónica, de 34 años, es madre de 3 hijos que cursan estudios primarios y secundarios. Ella junto a su esposo Daniel, quien es mecánico se han propuesto salir adelante. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Ella es una mujer que lucha por salir adelante, empezó con este negocio hace 2 años atrás y gracias a su buena atención y sobre todo administración, crece día a día. Su tienda está dentro de su vivienda, atiende casi todo el día, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que aprende muchas cosas y sobre todo se socializa con sus vecino, lo difícil es que su espacio es muy pequeño. Verónica trabaja para los gastos del mercado familiar y para la educación de su hijos. Con el dinero del préstamo, quiere implementar y ampliar su negocio y más adelante remodelar los ambientes de su casa.

loans.use: Expand and implement the space for her store

loans.name: Lilliam Mayela

texts.es:
Lilliam lives in the San Judas neighborhood, is 40 years old, single, and has three beautiful children ages 10, 15, and 20 years old. She has had to be successful for her children and that is why she had the initiative to open a small snack shop to support her children. She began with only selling soda pop and refreshments now she also sells cosmetics to her customers. She sells quite a few of these products as she stocks a variety at reasonable prices. She has been selling for 20 years, with little difficulty because she keeps her prices low. Her oldest son supports her not only with work but with moral support. With the money she is seeking she will invest in the purchase of cosmetics as she has various orders and she wishes to serve her customers well.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Lilliam habita en el barrio San Judas, tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hermosos hijos de 10,15 y 20 años de edad, ella ha tenido que salir adelante por sus hijos y es por eso que tuvo la iniciativa de poner un cafetín para poder sustentar a sus hijos, comenzó sólo con venta de gaseosa y refrescos ahora vende también cosmético a sus clientes, este producto se vende bastante ya que son de mucha variedad y de costos accesibles, tiene veinte años de experiencias en las ventas, con un poco de dificultad por que las ventas se ponen bajas. Su hijo mayor la apoya bastante por que ya trabaja tanto económico como moralmente. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en la compra de cosméticos ya que tiene varios encargos y desea darles un buen servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to invest in her business

loans.name: Cruz Del Pilar

texts.es: Cruz del Pilar habita en el barrio El Recreo, se casó desde muy joven, tiene cinco hijos los cuales son mayores de edad. Cruz tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, junto a su esposo se apoya para cubrir los gastos del hogar, Cruz del Pilar estudió corte y confección, y con el tiempo se ha ido perfeccionando, tiene treinta años de estar cociendo para sus clientes. Ella comenzó con la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo y a sus hijos, empezó con un negocio pequeño luego se dio a conocer con sus trabajos de buena calidad. Ha sido difícil, pero ella ha salido adelante, con muchos esfuerzos. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para comprar material de costura ya que viene la temporada del mes de Septiembre y se vende bastante por las fiestas patrias de nuestro país, ya que los estudiantes compran bastante ropa de uniformes o trajes para el baile. Sus planes son seguir ampliándose en el mercado, captar clientes, así como seguir mejorando los servicios hacia los clientes.
texts.en:
Cruz del Pilar lives in the El Recreo neighborhood. She married very young and has five children. Cruz is 53 years old and married. Along with her husband, she is responsible for the household expenses. Cruz studied tailoring and manufacturing, which she has perfected over time. She has been sewing for her clients for thirty years. She started her business as a necessity to support her husband and children. She started with a small business and later became known for her high-quality workwomanship. It has been difficult, but she has been able to get ahead with great sacrifice. With this loan she will purchase sewing material in anticipation of the arrival of September. This season is when her sales increase due to the national festivals of her country when students purchase a large number of uniforms and party clothes. Her plans are to continue expanding in the market and increasing her client base, as well as to continue improving her services.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing material to invest in the upcoming national celebrations

loans.name: Ileana Matilde

texts.es: La Sra. Ileana tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad que están estudiando la primaria, actualmente habita en el barrio San Pablo, su esposo trabaja en un supermercado desempeñándose como supervisor de productos. El negocio de doña Lilliam es un pequeño pulpería, también vende ropa y otras variedades como cosméticos, comenzó vendiendo carne de cerdo y golosinas en su casa por que eso le permitía cuidar a sus hijos, desde horas tempranas se levanta a preparar el desayuno a su esposo y a sus hijos que van a clase y después se queda atendiendo el negocio. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de cosméticos, ya que cuenta con poco inventario de este producto y quiere abastecerse ya que son muy pedidos por sus clientes. Sus planes son poder ampliar su pulpería para así poder mejorar la atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Ileana is 27 years old, married and has two young children in elementary school. She lives in the neighborhood of San Pablo. Her husband works in a supermarket as a product supervisor. Ileana's business is a small grocery store that also sells clothes and a variety of goods like cosmetics. She started off selling pork and snacks from her house because that allowed her to watch over her children. She wakes up early in the morning to prepare her husband's and children's breakfast, then her children go off to school and she stays to attend the business. The money she solicits will be for buying cosmetics. She has little inventory left in that product and wants to stock up since it is highly requested by her clients. Her plans are to expand her store and that way improving the service offered to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for her store.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome is 32 years old, a mother of 4 children all of whom are currently studying. She lives with her husband Alfredo, who she loves and together they have many business plans. For 10 years, she has been selling a variety of icepops from home, which she does all day long. Currently, her freezer is in a poor condition, preventing her from working. And so she is now selling grains (beans and corn), selling her new products all day as she desperately wants to fix her freezer. Salome works hard and is determined to cover the cost of her children's education. With the loan money, she want to fix her freezer so that she can continue her business and at the same time continue selling grain.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Salome tiene 32 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos estudiantes. Vive junto a su esposo Alfredo, con quien se lleva muy bien y tienen juntos, muchos planes de negocio. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la venta de variedades de helados de hielo, en su vivienda, atiende durante todo el día. En la actualidad, tiene en mal estado su refrigeradora, esto no es motivo para seguir trabajando, entonces por ahora está vendiendo granos (fríjol y maíz) al por menor, trabaja vendiendo estos nuevos productos todo el día porque quiere reparar su refrigeradora. Salome trabaja y se esfuerza para solventar los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. Con el dinero del préstamo, quiere reparar su refrigeradora para continuar con su negocio y a la par seguir vendiendo sus granos.

loans.use: To repair her freezer which she uses to sell icepops.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 37 años, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando y son su razón de ser. 
Por las mañanas trabaja en un hospedaje como personal de limpieza, y desde hace 8 años, vende comida por las noches, ya que su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar, el cual es muy transitado. Lo  que le gusta de su trabajo es que se socializa y conoce a mucha gente.
Sonia trabaja para los gastos permanentes de su hogar y sobre todo, para la educación de sus hijos, para  ella lo más importante, es salir adelante.
Con el dinero prestado se implementará con utensilios de cocina (ollas, platos, tazas, cubiertos, entre otras.) para posteriormente, poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old and she is a single mother to three children. They are currently in school and they are her reason for living.

In the mornings she works in a home provinding cleaning services. And for the last 8 years she has been seling foods in the evenings, especially good is that her home is in a well-visited location. What she loves about her work is that she gets to socialize and meet lots of people.

Sonia works to cover the household expenses but above all, she works to pay for her kids' education. For her that is the most important thing.

With the loan she will purchase kitchen wares (pots, plates, cups, cutlery, etc.), so that she can later on set up a small restaurant.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchen wares to improve her business of selling foods.

loans.name: Frieda

texts.es:
Frieda tiene 29 años, es madre de dos preciosas hijas, que son su mayor satisfacción en la vida. Vive junto a su esposo Willer.
Se dedica a la venta de cerveza al por mayor (170 cajas semanales), las lleva a vender por diferentes caseríos de Contamana que está a un día de viaje, por río, desde su localidad. Trabaja junto con su esposo, con quien lleva en esta actividad hace 2 años, demoran casi todo el día en  acabar de vender todo su producto. A Frieda le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque así conoce muchos lugares y comparte ideas con muchas personas. En estos meses no puede acompañar a su esposo a la venta porque se encuentra esperando otro hijo. 
Esta pareja trabaja junta para solventar los gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.
Lo indispensable para Frieda ahora, y por lo que solicita este préstamo, es mandar a construir un bote a motor para el transporte de sus productos esto le evitará seguir estar pagando peajes, además de comprar mayor cantidad de cerveza.
texts.en:
Frieda is 29 years old, and the mother of two precious daughters who are the greatest satisfaction in her life. She lives with her husband Willer.

She dedicates herself to vending beer at wholesale (170 cases per week) which she sells throughout the various towns of Contamana -- a day’s travel away, by river, from her location. She works together with her husbad, with whom she has carried out this activity for two years. It takes them nearly a full day to complete selling their product. Frieda likes her work very much, because it allows her to get to know different areas and share ideas with many people. In most recent months she hasn’t been able to accompany her husband because she is expecting another child.

This couple works together to help meet their daily household expenses and provide an education for their children.

What Frieda finds to be indispensable now, and the reason she is seeking this loan, is to order a motor boat built so they can transport their products and avoid paying others for passage. Also, she would like to purchase additional beer to sell.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Order a motor boat built to help transport the cases of beverages that she sells.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.es:
Asteria tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que cursan estudios universitarios, vive junto a su esposo. 
Desde hace 12 años, se dedica a la venta de medicinas, negocio en el que le va muy bien y atiende casi durante todo el día, recibiendo el apoyo de su esposo Mariano, quien es médico. . Gracias a este negocio está solventando los gastos de la universidad de sus hijos, le gusta su trabajo porque puede tratar con muchas personas, sobre todo darles una buena atención y acogida. Como para toda madre, para Asteria es difícil tener lejos a sus hijos (por la universidad) y no verlos a diario. 
Con el dinero del préstamo quiere ampliar e implementar su negocio, posteriormente, junto a su esposo, tener un consultorio médico.
texts.en:
Asteria is 47 years old, and she has two children that are currently attending college. For the past 12 years she has been selling medicines, a business that she attends most of the day and in which she gets the support from her husband, Mariano, who is a doctor . Thanks to this business she is able to provide for her sons' education. She likes her work because she gets to talk to people, and she is able to provide them good attention and care. For Asteria it is very difficult (like for any mother) to be apart from her children, and to not see them daily. With the money that she will get from the loan she would like to expand her business so that later on she can open a medical practice with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount and variety  of the medicines that she sells, and in the future open a medical practice.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi, de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, que es su mas grande razón para salir adelante. 
Es de profesión profesora de educación primaria (activa), además, en su domicilio dicta clases de reforzamiento, atiende a niños de 6 a 12 años. Por su buen desenvolvimiento y metodología, cuenta con varios alumnos, atiende solo por las tardes, actividad que realiza hace 3 años y le está yendo muy bien. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es estar con los niños a quienes enseña, y que sus padres se sientan satisfechos de ver el progreso de ellos, y que puedan aplicar sus avances en su centro de estudios.
Daysi trabaja para los gastos diarios y la educación de su hijo.
Con el dinero que solicita quiere alquilar un local para el dictado de sus clases de reforzamiento y así, brindar una mejor comodidad a sus alumnos.
texts.en:
Daysi, 44 years old, is a single mother. She has one son and he is her main reason for wanting to get ahead. She is a school teacher, and she gives reinforcement lessons at her place to kids between 6 and 12 years old. Because of the methodology that she uses and her good work she has several students. She teaches them in the afternoon, and she has been doing that for the past 3 years, and she is really getting ahead. The thing that she likes more about her job is that she gets to spend time with the kids that she tutors, that the kids can apply what they learn in their class, and that their parents are very satisfied with the progress their kids are making. Daysi works in order to cover her daily expenses and provide for her son's education. With the loan that she is requesting she would like to rent a space so that she can give classes there and therefore bring more comfort to her students.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a place where she can tutor and make her students more comfortable.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, D. 56 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes, en la actualidad, viven con su esposo Mario quien la apoya en todo. 
Hace 3 años compró un motocarro, junto a su esposo, quien lo conduce y tiene muchos años D. experiencia en este rubro, trabajan brindando servicio D. transporte público, durante todo el día. Teresa administra las ganancias D. su motocarro, así como también es la encargada D. llevar a repararlo cuando tiene desperfecto. Lo que le gusta D. este trabajo, es que le genera buenos ingresos, por ello, piensa comprarse otro, para dar trabajo a un chofer que lo necesite. 
Ahora, con el dinero que solicita, quiere mandar a reparar su vehículo, para que puedan continuar con el servicio que prestan, además D. ahorrar para poder comprar otro.
texts.en:
Teresa D. Jesús, age 56, has 5 grown-up children who are all independent. She currently lives with her husband, Mario, who supports her in everything she does. Three years ago, she purchased a motorcycle taxi with her husband, who drives it with many years of experience in this field. Their job is to offer public transportation services all day. Teresa manages the finances and is also in charge of having the motorcycle taxi repaired when it is having problems. What she likes about this job is that it generates good profits, which is why she is thinking about purchasing another motorcycle taxi. This way, she can give a job to a driver in need of employment. Now, with the loan she is requesting, she wants to have her vehicle repaired so that they can continue to offer their services, as well as save money to purchase another motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motorcycle taxi for public transportation services

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria, 48, has 3 children, who are all independent and have families. Currently, she lives with her husband Noe, who is farmer. For 3 years, she has worked hard to sell fruits (oranges, mangos, lemon, amongst others) that grow in the region at wholesale. She wakes up very early to buy fruit directly from the cart stands and trucks that come from farms. Later, she sells the fruit at the market. The latest time she finishes selling the fruits is 6 pm. What she likes about her work is the fact that she works with many demanding customers, who have taught her much about running the business. With this loan, she will buy another stand in the market, so she can start a business selling vegetables, which she will look after with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Ana Maria, D. 48 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes y con familia, en la actualidad vive junto a su esposo Noe, que es agricultor. DesD. hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta D. frutas regionales al por mayor (naranja, mango, limón, entre otros). Se levanta muy temprano para ir a comprar la fruta directamente D. los carros y camiones que vienen desD. los campos D. los agricultores, luego lleva a vender la fruta en su puesto del mercado, a mas tardar acaba D. vender las 6 D. la tarD.. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que trabaja con clientes muy exigentes, eso le enseña mucho y aprenD. cada día más sobre negocio. Con el dinero del préstamo, comprará otro puesto en el mercado, para abrir un negocio D. venta D. verduras, del cual se encargará su esposo.

loans.use: to buy a stand in the market to sell vegetables

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Mrs. Kung S. is a villager in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is a cow breeder who is raising two cows. She is a 43-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a garment factory worker while the other is attending school. 

Since her first child's workplace is far from home, and Mrs. Kung S. usually spends a lot of money on travel, Mrs. Kung S. is asking for a loan to to buy a motorbike for her child. She hopes to increase her income and savings in this way.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng B. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and grows mango trees in Preak Takeo Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Khin Saron, is a cow and poultry breeder. 

Mrs. Heng B. now faces an obstacle because her mango trees have been damaged by insects. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more pesticides to kill all types of insects. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more fertilizers to support her farm. 

Mrs. Heng B. is 56 years old and the mother of seven children, three of whom are married and they live separate from their parents, while another one is a Cambodia government officer. The fifth is employed by a private company and the remaining two attend high school. 

Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo S. was born in 1984 and she now lives in Khsom Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She owns a small restaurant where she sells food to passengers. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Keo S. wants to expand it, so she is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for the delicious food that she cooks for her customers.

Her husband, Mr. Touch Sophal, is a construction worker who earms a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Keo S. is 24 years old and the mother of two children who are all too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the food she sells

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhum S. is a 47-year-old widow with a child who is attending school. Mrs. S. is asking for a second loan to improve her business. Previously, Mrs. Chhum S. obtained a loan to buy sticky rice to make cakes and she has paid it back.

Mrs. Chhum S. is a Khmer cake maker in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She now faces a small problem because she does not have the milling tool that mills flour for the cakes. To improve her business, Mrs. Chhum S. is asking for a loan to buy the milling tool.

loans.use: To buy powder milling to make more cakes for her customers

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Mr. Khoem B. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Mr. Khoem B. is a 43-year-old widower with five children who are all attending the local school.

He is also a farmer who works hard on his small piece of land growing rice. He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to produce a better crop. Mr. Khoem B. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve his rice crop

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
This is the second time that Mrs. Vann C. has asked for a loan to improve her business activity. She is a rice wine maker who uses rice to make wine in Preak Tanop Village in Kandal Province. Previously, Mrs. Vann C. obtained a loan of US$ 150 to buy rice to start her business. She has fully paid it back.

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Vann C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to make rice wine. She is a 28-year-old widow without any children. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. The place which Mrs. Vann C. makes rice wine is in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more rice to make rice wine

loans.name: Oeut

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeut K., who is 45 years old, sells groceries from her house; her husband, Mr. Lam Ron, is construction worker who typically earns around US $5 per day. Oeut sells a variety of products and has been selling groceries since 2007; she earns around US $4 per day. She lives with her husband and three children in the Kantreang Commune in the Siem Reap Province. One of her children is employed in a hotel and earns US $100 per month; with this, he can help support the family. The two other children live at home.

Oeut needs capital to expand her grocery inventory in order to increase her family's income. Hence, she decided to request a loan of US $1000 to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries for sale

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry R., who is 36 years old, sells sweet potatoes in her local market. Her husband grows the sweet potatoes on farmland behind their house; Mrs. Ry is responsible for selling them at the market. Ry and her husband earn around US $5 per day, and it is the main income for their family.

Now Mrs. Ry is finding it difficult to transport her potatoes to the market so she needs a motorcycle to take them. Hence, Ry decided to request a loan, which, combined with her savings, will allow her to purchase a motorcycle. Ry's husband is pictured because Ry is unavailable.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle

loans.name: Ong

texts.en:
Ong P., age 37, is married and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a farmer and works raising animals as well. On average, she makes $1.00 profit per day. Her husband has a business catching fish from the river. He sells his catch to earn a living in the market and is able to make $3.50 per day. This couple together has seven children, one of whom is a construction worker building houses. Mrs. Ong is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a motor-taxi whenever he is free from fishing. This will provide the family an extra profit. In the future, she also wants her children to operate a motor-taxi business.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a motor-taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mrs. Leak Lim's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank which consists of twenty-eight people is located in Khsach Village in Kandal Province. Most of the members are married and they plan to use the loan in different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Leak L. is the village bank president and a vegetable seller in the local market. She will use her share of the loan to buy different kinds of vegetables to re-sell since this business activity is going well. Mrs. Leak L. is a widow with three children who are all employed in Naga Club which is a famous casino in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

This is a village bank loan consisting partly of end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Three members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Key

texts.en:
Key M. is 32 years old and is one of the farmers who live in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works on a plot of land growing rice to earn a living and is able to make $1.00 per day. Her husband works at the irrigation department in Kampong Cham province. Normally, he makes $3.00 per day. This couple together has four children, and all of them are students. Mrs. Key would like a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for the next season which is coming very soon.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for the next season which is coming very soon

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry C., age 26, is a rice farmer who lives with two of her children. Living in Kampong Cham province, she typically makes US$2.00 per day. Her husband, Kun Keo, makes approximately US$2.00 growing cucumbers. The Kampong Cham area has not had favorable weather conditions for farming this past year. Along with increased inflation, it has been a difficult year economically in much of Cambodia. As a farmer, Ry C. is taking a lot of the brunt of the economic downturn. That is why she has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan. Ry C. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to increase her income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Min K., 55, is a rice farmer who lives with two of her seven children in Kampong Cham. She normally makes US$2.00 per day and is aided by two of her children who work in a garment factory and a car garage. Her husband, Mach Veang, 58, works collecting palm juice and boiling it into palm sugar. He earns approximately US$3.00 profit per day. Mrs. Min would like a loan from Kiva of US$500 to purchase more tools to increase the amount of palm sugar her family is able to produce.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more tools to increase palm sugar production

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mrs. Phorn Lai's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-eight people have formed a Village Bank which is located in Tuol Meas Village in Kandal Province. Most of these group members are married and they have children as shown in the picture. Mrs. Phorn L., 58, is the village bank president who has been selected by the group members.

Mrs. Phorn L. owns a small store on the street where she sells dried fish. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Phorn L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more dried fish to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Pot Nor, is a cow breeder who is raising only one cow. Aside from this business, he is the vice-village chief who can make $31 per month to support his family.

Mrs. Phorn L. hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living with this loan. In the picture, Mrs. Eith O. is not shown because she was busy with her work but her husband came instead of her so he is shown in the picture. This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Nine members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to re-sell

loans.name: Yueo

texts.en:
Yueo P., 25, is married and lives with three of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1997, she has been a rice farmer and makes around US$1.50 per day. Her husband, Sorn Lim, earns approximately US$2.00 raising ducks. Yueo said that farming requires a lot of labor and energy, but that she does not earn enough to support the family. Also, inflation has been difficult in the past year. Every single thing has increased in price since last year, fertilizer and insecticide included.

Yueo would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, of US$1000 to purchase a truck to provide services for extra profit. She sees this purchase as a good opportunity to increase her income.


CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a truck to provide services for extra profit

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
Chhoun C., 43, is married and lives with four of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1997, she has been selling fish in the market to earn a living and is able to make US$ 2.50 in profit per day. She is aided by one of her children who works as a car driver. Her husband, Bun Tha, 41, makes approximately US$ 2 per day as a construction worker building houses. Chhoun would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, US$ 400 to purchase a motorbike to transport the fish. This will reduce the cost that she spends on a motor-taxi every day.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her fish

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Moeung

texts.en:
Moeung S. H. is 56 years old and sells fruits and vegetables in the market to earn approximately $4.00 profit per day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of US$600 to make two investments. She would like to  invest US$100 in her fruit business, and also use US$500 to purchase a grinding mill to service for extra profit. She sees these investments as opportunities to increase her daily income. (Mrs. Moeung is pictured with her daughter.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: $100 in fruit business and $500 to purchase a grinding mill to service for extra profit

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim P., 35, is married and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2004, she has been selling clothes, CD's, VCD's (videocassettes), and soup from her home to earn a living. She is able to make $6 of profit per day. Her husband is employed as a tractor driver. He typically makes $4 a day. Mrs. Yim would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, US$1000 to add to her clothes inventory and purchase more CD's and VCD's. ( Mrs. Yim P. is pictured with her husband inside her house).

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To add to her clothes inventory and purchase more CD's and VCD's.

loans.name: Ul

texts.en:
Ul K., 38, is married and lives with three of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2007, she has been selling eggs in the market to earn a living and is able to make $3 per day. Her husband, Chean Sophal, 38, work as carpenter and makes approximately $6 a day. Mrs. Ul would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase carpentry tools for her husband.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon U., 56, is married and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works as a rice farmer and makes $1.50 per day. Her husband is a palm tree climber, collecting palm juice. Every morning he goes to collect the palm juice and boil it into palm sugar to earn approximately $2.50 profit per day. Mrs. Suon lives with two of her nine children, and normally she is aided by two of her children who work as garment workers. Mrs. Suon would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, of $800 to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed to grow for the next season. The price of rice is good in the market so if she can collect more profit, her family’s standard of living will improve.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed to grow for the next season

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Thoeung

texts.en:
Thoeung N., 42, is a fish vendor who lives with six of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes about US$4 each day, and her husband, Chhun Pich, makes about US$6 each day as a cow dealer. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have created a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. This couple together also got support from two of their children who work as a garment worker and a sculptor. Thoeung N. is asking for a loan of US$700 to make two investments. She would like to invest US$400 in her husband’s business and also put US$300 into her own business, increasing the number of fish to sell. She sees these investments as opportunities that will increase her daily income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To increase the number of fish to sell and also to invest on her husband's business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Mrs. Thon T. sells groceries. She sells a variety of products in her village; her husband, Mr. Hun Hoeurn, sells used clothes. She is married with seven children, three of whom are married and four of whom stay home, living in Chubtatrav Commune, Siem Reap Province. One of her children repairs radios and televisions in the local market; another owns a battery sales business.

To increase her family's income, she needs to expand her business through increasing grocery inventory. Hence, now she decided to request a loan to purchase more grocery inventory; she plans to use any leftover money to purchase a pump machine to use in her family's home.

loans.use: Purchasing more groceries

loans.name: Ul

texts.en:
Ul S., 37, is a fish seller and lives with two of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1998, she has been selling fish and is able to make around $5 profit per day. Her husband owns a pond that raises a few kinds of fish. Her husband always provides fish to her and also distributes fish to other venders in the market to earn approximately $7 in revenue per day. Mrs. Ul is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase feed for fish in bulk. The rest of the loan is to raise more fish.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase feed for fish in bulk and to raise more fish

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Pon B., 29, is a fried banana seller who lives with three small children. Living in the Kampong Cham province, she typically makes about US$5 each day and her husband, Shek Kosal, makes about US$7 each day as well, as a fish breeder. Mrs. Pon still lives with her mother, who has a business selling various kinds of dessert. On average, her mother makes $5 of profit per day.

Mrs. Pon would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to purchase fish feed for her husband. The leftover money will be used to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi as well. The fish will be ready for sale four months later. The rest of the loan will be used to purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase feed for fish and a motorbike.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Four people in Preak Daung Village in Kandal Province have formed a loan group and Mrs. Chan T. is the group leader. She and her husband, Mr. Loth Chhaing, are fishermen from the local village. They have six children, five of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is three years old.

In the village, most of the houses are connected to electricity but Mrs. Chan T.'s is disconnected because she does not have enough money to afford to pay the fee every month. In order to light her house, Mrs. Chan T. wants to use the old system which uses a battery that generates electricity. Thus, Mrs. Chan T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a battery and a lamp for this purpose. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Two members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a battery and a lamp in order to light the household

loans.name: La

texts.en: Mrs. La I., who is 59 years old, is a farmer growing rice. Additionally, she makes and sells mats from her home, earning around US $2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Cheap Choeurn, who is 58 years old, is a construction worker and earns typically US $2 per day. La has three children, two of whom are married and another of whom is studying and stays home. To increase her rice yield, La would like to request a loan of US $100 to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Chi Chhunheang's Group

texts.en:
This group of six made up a loan group. They are located in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Chi C., 46, is the group leader. She and her husband, Mr. Huot Bunly, are fisher folk in the local lake which is next to the village. Since their business is going well, they plan to gather more fish to sell in order to support their family.

Thus, Mrs. Chi C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish nets in order to catch more fish. Mrs. Chi C. has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school. One of her children who is attending school has free time from studying, so that child works as a construction worker in order to help support the family.

loans.use: to buy more fish nets in order to catch more fish

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom L., 27, is a rice farmer who lives with two children. Living in the Kampong Cham province, she typically makes about US$1 each day and her husband typically earns US$2 of profit as a motor-taxi driver. Previously this couple used to raise fish together, but they were unsuccessful. The fish died because they have no skill in raising fish. This time they want to raise fish again because they now have an idea from their neighbors who raise fish successfully. Mrs. Mom is asking for a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to raise fish to double the family income. The loan will also help to purchase feed for the fish as well.

loans.use: To raise fish to double the family income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to reach her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen C., 35, is a farmer who lives with four of her children.

Living in the Kampong Cham province, she typically makes about US$1 each day and her husband, Hong Ros, 38, has a business selling lottery tickets to earn approximately US$3 of profit per day since 1992. This couple has four children, three are students.

Mrs. Pen would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of US$500 to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her farm.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Kosar M. Akram Group

texts.en:
Kosar Baji is the wife of M. Akram and lives in a city named Pakpattan, which is famous for its historical and pious places. Kosar Baji has been living in this city for the last 10 years. Kosar Baji completed her education to the 8th standard. She is the mother of five children: one son and four daughters. Her son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Kosar Baji's husband drives a tractor for loading and earns a profit. Her husband has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Kosar Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah and now she is applying for a loan to change the wheels on her husband's tractor.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. ZulaiK. Baji wants a loan to buy rice to resell. Nooran Baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw. Hanifan Baji wants a loan to buy wheels for a tractor. Rani Baji wants a loan to buy a rope machine to make cots.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To change the wheels of a tractor

loans.name: Mr. Thaong Phanna's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people in Ruessei Srok Village in Kandal Province have formed a loan group, and Mr. Thaong P. is the group leader. He is a cow breeder who buys cows to raise and re-sell later at a better price. In his business, Mr. Thaong P. is now raising six cows.

Since his business is going well, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy more cows to raise in order to re-sell later. His wife, Mrs. Chum Sreytouch, is a farmer who grows jasmine and potatoes. Mr. Thaong P. is 34 years old and the father of five children who are all attending school.

loans.use: to buy more cows to raise

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima baji is a wife of M. S. and lives in a city named Pakpattan. Pakpattan is famous for its historical and pious places. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 30 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Ghulam Fatima baji’s husband is a daily wage laborer. She has a business of making cots from rope. She has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Presently, she is out of stock. This is the season for selling cots because, in the summer season, lots of people go outside from their rooms to sleep in an open space. For that it’s very difficult to lift heavy furniture. She requires a loan to buy rope to make more cots to sell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Keena baji wants a loan to buy more fruits to resell. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy a rope machine to make cots.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy rope to make cots

loans.name: Mrs. Hai Hean's Group

texts.en:
This loan group which consists of six members is located in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. All the members are married and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Hai H. is the group leader and is a Khmer noodle maker.

In her business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase sticky rice in order to make Khmer noodles. Thus, Mrs. Hai H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more sticky rice for her business. Mrs. Hai H. is a 31-year-old widow with a child who is too young to work or study because that child is just two.

loans.use: to buy more sticky rice to make Khmer noodles to sell

loans.name: Siddiqan's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqan baji is a wife of M. H. and lives in a city named Pakpattan. Pakpattan is famous for its historical and holy places. She has been living in this city for the last 30 years. She has no children. Siddiqan baji and her husband live with her brother. Her husband neither has a job nor has his own business. Her brother has a grocery shop with experience of 1 year. Siddiqan baji successfuly completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a seond loan to buy groceries for her brother's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Meena baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Siddiqan baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Waziran baji and Mairaj baji each want a loan to buy a rope machine for making cots.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to re-sell

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan D., who is 60 years old and widowed, makes mats. She has been making mats since 2001, earning approximately US $1 per day. She lives with one daughter in Lvea Commune in the Siem Reap Province. Her daughter, who is 21 years old, is a hairdresser near the house. Because of increasing traveling expenses, Yan would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to reduce expenses. The loan will be improving her family's living conditions. Yan's daughter is pictured becuase Yan is unavailable.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is the wife of M. H. and lives in a city named Pakpattan. Pakpattan is famous for its historical and holy places. She has been living in this city for the last 2 years. She has one daughter who is 2 years old. Shamim baji's husband is a loader by profession. He loads the luggage on his donkey cart and moves it to the customer's desired place. He has been in this job for the last 5 years. Shamim baji has a business of making cots from rope. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy rope to make more cots to sell.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Iqbal baji wants a loan to buy a grinder machine to grind wheat. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy utensils for her food business. Noor baji wants a loan to buy leather to make shoes. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy a rope machine to make cots.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy rope to make cots

loans.name: Riaz M.zafar Group

texts.en:
Riaz baji is the wife of M. Z. and lives in a city named Pakpattan. Pakpattan is famous for its historical and holy places. She has one daughter who is 1 year old. Her husband has a spare parts shop. He sells specifically motorbike spare parts. Riaz baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy motorbike spare parts to re-sell.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Ashra baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Sarwar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to re-sell. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna is 36 years old. She is married with 4 children, ages 14, 11, 9, and 5. She has been a clothing seller since 2004. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales.

Husna now requests a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Time

texts.en:
Time is married with 2 children, ages 4 and 1. She has been a fruit seller since 1998. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business.

Time is now looking for a loan to buy more fruit for re-sale.
