Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mtumwa, Asma, Mwanahawa, and Asha J. .

loans.use: To buy more food items to expand her business

loans.name: Mayassa

texts.en:
Mayassa is 46 years old. She is married with 1 child 15 years old. She has been a charcoal seller since 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Mayassa now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Amina's Tusisahau Kwetu Group

texts.en:
Amina is 32 years old. She is married with 2 children, 6 and 9 years old. She has been a clothes and juice seller since 2007. She works everyday from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and juice for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Salhina.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and juice for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 28 years old. She is married with twin children aged 7 months. She has owned and run her own shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Riziki is now requesting a loan to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 35 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 8, 5, and 2 years old. She has owned and run her own shop since 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Safia is now looking for a loan to buy more items to increase her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her current stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline O. is a widow and she is struggling to raise her five children alone. She sells tomatoes and peppers and she also has a grinding machine for grinding tomatoes and other food items. She also sells frozen foods.

Roseline is 44 years old and has five children. She needs the loan amount of $450 to purchase more tomatoes and peppers for sale.

loans.use: To buy more peppers and tomatoes for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose U. is 50 years old and married to Mr. U. and they have five children.  She and her family live in Egbeda, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and rice, both wholesale and retail; she has been in this business for the past ten years. Rose needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more drinks and bags of rice for sale.

loans.use: To buy more rice and drinks for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: David

texts.en: David N. lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 46 years old and married with 2 children. He owns a motorcycle that he uses for commercial purposes. He is a LAPO client. He is requesting the loan amount of US$ 600 to buy one motorcycle to enable him take his customers from one location to another. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for commercial purpose

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 28 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 9 and 2 years old. She has been a charcoal and juice seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Asha is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal and juice to increase her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and juice to increase her current stock

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 35 years old. She is married with 6 children between 18 and 3 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 1998. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys O. is thirty years old and married with 4 children. She is a tailor who sews clothes of different styles for people in her community. She has been in business since 2001. She lives in Uromi Edo State. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy a sewing machine for her business. This, she says, will help her serve her customers better. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy one sewing machine.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Née le 14 novembre 1994 à Mission Tové dans la préfecture de Zio, dame D. Akouvi s’est mariée à un cultivateur et a quatre (4) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits de premières nécessités à coté du cafeteria le secret. Elle aide beaucoup son mari dans les dépenses de la famille telles que le loyer, les frais de scolarités etc. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de 6 sacs de sucre, 5  sacs de riz, 4 bidons d’huile et 5 cartons de savons.
texts.en:
Born November 14, 1994, in Mission Tové in the prefecture of Zio, Mrs. Akouvi D. is married to a farmer and has four children. She sells products of daily necessity next to the cafeteria Le Secret. She helps her husband a lot with family expenses, such as the rent, school costs, etc.

This first loan that she seeks will allow her to stock up by purchasing 6 bags of sugar, 5 bags of rice, 4 cans of oil, and 5 boxes of soap.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy daily necessity products

loans.name: Ushiobo

texts.en: Ushiobo M. is married with nine children. He is fifty-five years old and he lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells both men's and women's shoes. He has been in this business a long time. He needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more footwear for re-sale. He expresses his gratitude to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Janeffer Christiana

texts.en: O. Christiana Janeffer is 49 years old married with eight children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She owns a patent store for the sale of medicine. She is a LAPO client. She sells this medicine to people in her community. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more medicine for sale to her customers. This will help her to serve her customers better. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for sale

loans.name: Arastun

texts.en: Arastun was born in 1983. He lives in Baku city. This young man has been in the consulting business for a year. He is single. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy a new computer so he can provide his clients with the best service.

loans.use: to buy a new computer

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is 45 years old and married, with seven children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past four years. She needs the loan amount of $1025 to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Lluvia De Oro Group

texts.es:
The Lluvia D. Oro (“Gold Rain”) group is maD. up of thirteen members. The group was founded in 2007 by Sra. Noemi H., who also gave the group the name Lluvia D. Oro. Of the 13 group members, eight of them are original members from the first loan cycle, and the remaining five members joined in the second cycle.

The group is involved in various businesses: Rodrigo, Alejandra and Martha sell clothing, Damaso sells livestock, Silveria sells cosmetics, Arely works as household help, Florencia, Maria Elena, and Karen sell food (salchipapas (French fries with hot dog slices), sweets, dry goods and meat), and the other Silveria knits sweaters. Most of the group members plan to use their Kiva loans to buy more merchandise or supplies for their respective businesses.

All of the group members are committed to repaying this loan on time, so that they can continue to work with AgroCapital in the future.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

CONFORMADO POR 13 PERSONAS QUE SE ESTABLECIERON DESD. EL PRIMER CICLO, EL GRUPO LLUVIA D. ORO EMPIEZA EN EL AÑO 2007 DOND. LA SRA NOEMI H. CONFORMO EL GRUPO Y DONDOLE EL NOMBRE D. LLUVIA D. ORO.

LAS TRECE PERSONAS QUE CONFORMAN EL GRUPO, SON YA 8 PERSONAS QUE SE MANTIENEN DESD. EL PRIMER CICLO Y LAS DEMAS RETORNAN DEL SEGUNDO CICLO.

TODAS COMPROMETIENDOSE A LA CANCELACION D. SU DEUDA, PARA PODER SEGUIR TRABAJANDO CON LA INSTITUCION.
texts.en:
...

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise/supplies for various businesses

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: IF. Emmanuel is 43 years old and is married with four children. He lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been in the business of making furniture for a long time. He requests a loan amount of $700 to buy more furniture materials. He says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy furniture materials

loans.name: Karam

texts.en: Karam is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan and he has settled in Khirdalan town. Ten years ago he started this business. He is married and has 3 children. He was born in 1956. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 33 years old. She is divorced with 3 children aged 15, 12, and 10 years old. She is a soup, potatoes, and clothes seller. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwanahamis is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock

loans.name: Siti's Tuwe Na Moyo Group

texts.en:
Siti is 36 years. She is married with two children aged seven and two years old. She has been a perfumes and clothes seller since 2003. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Siti now hopes for a loan to buy more perfumes and clothes to expand her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Amina.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes and clothes for re-sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Although Celestina P. owns her home in the district of Villa San Juan in the city of La Paz, she had to move to a room on calle Inca Roca, a place nearby, because the walls of her home were completely deteriorated. The home is old and made from adobe, an unstable building material. At her current residence, Celestina has a stall where she makes sweets, french fies, and toasted corn pouches for young children/students. The loan she requests will be used to buy supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Aunque Celestina P. tiene domicilio propio en la zona de Villa San Juan de la ciudad de La Paz, tuvo que trasladarse a un cuarto en la calle Inca Roca (cerca de su casa debido a que las paredes de esta están completamente deterioradas (el domicilio es de adobe, viejo e inestable material de construcción). En su actual residencia, Celestina tiene un taller donde elabora dulces, papas fritas, también embolsa maiz tostado para colegiales. Por lo tanto, el crédito será usado para la compra de insumos.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel O. is fifty-four years old. He is married with six children and hails from Uromi town, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells  second-hand computers and other electrical items like bulbs, conduit, pipe, etc. He has been in this business since 1980 selling his goods to people in his community. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy more second-hand computers for sale.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand computers for sale

loans.name: Branka

texts.en:
Branka is from Osječani, a small place near the town of Doboj. She is married and her husband works with trucks and boulders. He earns about 800 KM monthly. Branka works in agriculture: she plants and sells potatoes and corn.

With this loan in the amount of 1 000 KM she wants to prepare her land and to buy compost for the winter. She wants to clean the land and to have it ready for spring. Her wish is to continue with these activities because they can earn enough money for their household.

loans.use: To buy compost and to prepare the land

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en: Dragana is divorced woman form the town Doboj. She has one child. She works in a hairdressing salon and her monthly salary is 400 KM. She works as a hairdresser at home, too, and she wants to use this loan in the amount of 1000 KM to buy preparations she needs at home and to buy a dryer and hood. She wants to improve her monthly income by giving good services to her clients.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing preparations, a dryer and hood.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael E. sells clothes and provisions. She is married with 6 children. Rachael sells her clothes and provisions at home and in the market. She is determined to lift her family above poverty.

Rachael is requesting the loan amount of $450 to buy more provisions and clothes for sale. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy  more clothes and provisions for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan and has settled in Baku city, in the settlement of Keshle. She was born in 1982. She has run a consulting business for 2 years. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy a computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her business

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir has been in the concrete transportation business for 15 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Fuzuli region in Azerbaijan, and he settled in Baku city, in the settlement of Buzovna. Tahir is married, and has 4 children. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: Buy the spare parts for his truck

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Zarema

texts.en:
Zarema is an entrepreneur from Simferopol, Ukraine who is very successful in her business. She operates a bustling little kiosk where she sells an attractive array of retail items, like slippers, socks, underwear, etc. Zarema started her business as an open air market vendor. Currently, she has been in business for 18 years. With her new kiosk her net profit has increased to $700 per month.

Zarema understands the value of customer service - a quality which sets her apart from many other business owners. She is attentive and polite to her customers and tries to give them each her individual attention and this is why she has many loyal patrons. 

Zarema has requested a loan for two purposes. She'd like to use some of the money as working capital to buy necessary inventory, but her primary goal is to use some funds to help open new vending kiosks in the future. With her history thus far as an entrepreneur, it will be exciting to watch how her business will grow and prosper.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with two grown daughters, 17 and 21 years old. Together with her daughters, she sells children's clothing in the central market of Simferopol, Crimea. Alla has been in this business for 5 years. Currently, she gets about $5000 of gross income each month. Her net profit is over $400 a month.

Alla's business is constantly growing. Two of the advantages she has in the competitive market are affordable prices and regular additions to her inventory. Her little vending kiosks are very popular in the marketplace where she works. Alla realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business, as loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and expand her business. She would like to make it easier for parents to find comfortable and good quality clothing for their kids, which is why she is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas. One of Alla's further plans is to continue expanding her trade and eventually generate enough profit to finish remodeling her house and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To open a new children's clothing vending facility

loans.name: Amir

texts.en: Amir is 31 years old and married. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Khodjali region in Azerbaijan, and he settled in Baku city. Six years ago he started the taxi business. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for his taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two children, Olena who is 10 and Vladislav who is 8. She is an entrepreneur from Novyi Rozdyl. Nataliya sells women's clothing items in a local market which is the only big marketplace in her small home town.

Nataliya has had rich experience working in the sphere of sales because she started as a salesperson. She decided to take a chance and launch her own enterprise one year ago and has enjoyed every second of being self-employed. Presently, Nataliya has about US$ 1800 of gross income each month.

Nataliya is seeking a 3000 Grivna loan to purchase additional merchandise, e.g., T-shirts and sweaters, for this fall season. She is hoping to purchase a vending kiosk to run her business more efficiently and facilitate her sales. Nataliya is very responsible and perseverant. We believe her strategic planning and prudence will help her achieve her business goals as well as her individual goals in life.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Bazira Women's Group

texts.en:
Madina N. is a widow with 10 children of whom 4 are still at school under her care. She is also looking after 2 grand-daughters whose father (her son) developed a mental illness and their mother had to leave them to her care.

Madina has been a farmer all her life, having bean, sweet potato, cassava, and matooke plantations. The produce she gets she has been selling on the local market in her village.

About 5 to 6 years ago, she started up a retail shop to complement her earnings and it has been of great help for her and her family. She is so grateful for the loans given her which she mostly uses to buy high-quality seeds and fertilizers plus employing some labour on the land that that her husband left her, especially when her children are at school.

Madina has an immediate plan of buying eggs from poultry farmers for re-sale but would very much want to keep layers herself if she had the capital, as this would bring in more profit. Madina has a dream of one day being able to transport her produce to Kampala where the prices are a bit more favorable, so as to earn increased income and have savings.

Madina has been chairperson for her lending group of Bazira for 9 years and she says that all her group members are farmers, mostly growing the mairungi plant that is used as tea leaves and is a delicacy for most people in the city centres. Thanks to their fertile soil, their farming is more possible.

loans.use: to help with buying seeds for her farm and sugar, soap, salt, and parrafin for her shop

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. repairs refrigerators. With the additional funds from Kiva lenders he was able to learn how to install satellite dishes. He is happy with Kiva lenders because he now has an additional business. He lives in Uromi, Edo state, Nigeria. John is single and he is a LAPO client. He hopes for the loan amount of  $1200 to purchase materials for the installation of satellite dishes. He thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: Repairs of refrigerator and installation of satellite dishes

loans.name: Confort

texts.fr:
Madame KWADZO Essimé est née le 22 août 1967 à Lomé. Elle est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des fournitures scolaires dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis le décès de son mari. 
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 50 cartons de cahiers et 10 cartons de livres. Ainsi avec le nouveau stock qu’elle aura à constituer, elle pourra mieux vendre à l’approche de cette nouvelle rentrée.
texts.en:
Mrs. Confort T. was born August 23, 1974, in Mango in the prefecture of Oti. She is divorced and responsible for three children. She currently lives in Agoè and sells wood coal and firewood. She stocks up in the village of Amou. This first loan that she seeks will allow her to buy 25 bags of wood coal and 6 bundles of firewood.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy firewood and wood coal

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela tiene 46 años, es soltera, vive con sus hijos; Luis Alberto de 13, Rocío estela de 11 y Flor de Maria de 8. Se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de hoja de coca, en su pequeño puesto de un jirón de su localidad, la hoja de coca se comercializa en esta zona del país, para hacer mates, para la lectura de la suerte, lo cual es muy común y también para consumo personal, a lo que le llaman “Pijchar” que no es otra cosa que masticar las hojas de coca.Por todo esto la venta de hoja de coca es rentable, pero hay ciertos problemas en su compra, ya que en algunos lugares no ingresa con mucha facilidad, pero Estela es perseverante y muy trabajadora.
Ella quiere que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro con estudios y actividades diferentes al comercio.
Con el dinero del préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería, y con el tiempo tener algún tipo de negocio adicional, como por ejemplo una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Estela is a 46 years old single mother of three; Luis Alberto 13, Rocio Estela 11 and Flor de Maria 8. She has a street business selling Coca Leaf at a little stand in Jiron, her hometown. In this zone of her country they use the Coca Leaf for mates (similar to tea), fortune telling, which is very common, and also for personal consumption, what they call “Pijchar” which is nothing else than chewing the leaf. This is why selling this leaf it’s a good source of income, it’s not always easy to acquire it, due that it’s produce in places that are hard to get to, but Estela is persevering and hard working.

She wants her sons to have a good future, go to school and learn different businesses. With the loan she wants to buy more products and with time have another business, for example a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 59 años, está separada D. su esposo y vive con su hijo Dante D. 25 años.
Se dedica al negocio D. moler cereales en su propio molino, ella convierte en harina; el trigo, la quinua, el chuño, el morón, etc. Lo más difícil es moler el chuño (papa seca) que es muy duro y requiere mucho más esfuerzo, pero a pesar D. las pequeñas dificultades Juana es feliz haciendo su trabajo.Independientemente a su molino tiene una tienda D. comestibles, en la cual también ofrece los productos que muele en el molino.Se ocupa la mayor parte del día en sus dos negocios, a los cuales ya le ha dedicado 17 años D. su vida.
Juana quiere que su hijo Dante, tenga en sus negocios una seguridad y estabilidad económica.
Con el dinero del préstamo comprara más cereales, tubérculos, etc. para moler, así como también productos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old; she is separated from her husband and lives with her son, Dante, who is 25. Her business is that of grinding cereals, and does so using her own mill. She converts flour, wheat, 'quinua', 'chuño', 'morón', etc. The hardest to grind is 'chuño' (dried potato), which is very hard and requires more effort. However, despite the small difficulties, Juana is happy doing her job. In addition to her mill, she has a grocery store, where she also offers products that she grinds at her mill. She spends most of her day tending to these two businesses, which she's devoted 17 years of her life to. Juana wants her son, Dante, to maintain job security and financial stability in these businesses. With the loan money, she will purchase more cereals, tubers, etc. to grind in addition to more products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire necessary tubers to convert into flour, in addition to stocking her store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y su última hija de 15 años.
Es una mujer trabajadora que realiza su actividad como agricultora para poder ayudar a su pareja en los gastos familiares, desde muy de temprano sale a regar sus terrenos de cultivos, esta labor la viene realizando por más de 40 años, ya que desde su niñez ayudó a sus padres en ello. El agricultor tiene varios meses de espera y sacrificio antes de poder ver el fruto de su trabajo, para Irma esto no la desanima a seguir trabajando, ya que le agrada cultivar sus productos y cosecharlos. Lo que la limita son los precios de los abonos y fertilizantes que necesitan para mejorar su producción y tener una muy buena cosecha.
Irma tiene el anhelo de poder  ayudar a su hija  en sus estudios, esto es lo que la motiva a seguir  trabajando.
Invertirá en la compra de semillas para así tener la posibilidad de incrementar su producción para el próximo año, con el fin de ser una gran productora y trasladar sus productos a  las ciudades más cercanas.
texts.en:
Irma is 45 years old; she lives with her husband and her last daughter, who is 15. She is a hard working woman who practices agriculture for a living in order to help her partner with family expenses. As of very early in the morning, she goes out to water her farmland. She has been in the business for more than 40 years, since she helped her parents with the same kind of labor. A farmer has to wait several months before seeing the fruits of his/her labor. This does not discourage Irma, since she enjoys cultivating and harvesting her products. What limits her are the prices of fertilizers that she needs to improve her production and have a good harvest. Irma hopes to be able to help her daughter with an education, which motivates her to continue working. She will invest in the purchase of seeds, so she can possibly increase her production for next year. Her goal is to be a great farmer and transport her products to closer cities.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds to increase next year's production.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, actividad con la cual apoya en los gastos del hogar. Debe salir de su casa a horas muy tempranas, luego de preparar los alimentos para su familia, para ir rumbo a sus terrenos de cultivo donde se ocupa todo un día.Sin embargo, en su trabajo disfruta mucho de la compañía de sus hijos, quienes después de estudiar van a la chacra para ayudar a su mamá y retornar pronto al hogar. Lo que es preocupante, es la baja de los costos de los productos agrícolas, esto amenaza a que su inversión sea un fracaso.
Sin embargo, tiene en sus tres hijos el motivo más importante para seguir trabajando y ofrecer a sus hijos una educación que les sirva en el futuro.
Nilda está esperando la temporada de la siembra de maíz y de gladiolos (flores) para invertir en ello y tener sus ganancias dentro de 6 meses y con ello la posibilidad de crecer como agricultora.
texts.en:
Nilda is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children.

For the last five years she has been working in farming, an activity with which she helps with the expenses of her home. She has to leave her house very early, after preparing the meals for her family, to go towards her farm fields where she works all day. Nonetheless, she enjoys very much the company of her children in her work, who go to the small farm after school to help their mother and quickly return to their home. What does worry her is the drop in the prices of agricultural goods, this threatens that her investment could fail.

However, her three children give her the reason to continue working and be able to give them the education that will provide for them in the future.

Nilda is waiting for the planting season for corn and gladiolas (flowers) to invest in this and see her profits in 6 months and with them the chance to grow as a farmer.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the planting of corn and gladiolas.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y su último hijo de 15 años.  Es agricultora y su actividad la obliga a trabajar en lugares alejados de su hogar, porque sus terrenos están en zonas muy difíciles de llegar, pero el dedicarse a esto por más de 20 años le ha dado la experiencia necesaria y la agilidad suficiente para desenvolverse en esta actividad.De la misma forma, a pesar de tener copado gran parte del día en esta labor trata de disfrutarlo, ya que desde siempre le agradó cultivar flores, hacerlo no le parece difícil, lo que sí la preocupa es el costo de los productos que ayudan que su producción se mantenga adecuadamente.
Olinda tiene un gran amor por su esposo y su hijo de 15 años, quien es su principal motor en su vida. Ella está dispuesta a seguir creciendo, para ello requiere de dinero para adquirir semillas y  abonos para sus terrenos, con el fin de poder incrementar sus ingresos, su producción y sus pedidos en los mercados de flores.
texts.en:
Olinda is 38 years old and lives with her husband and her youngest son of 15 years of age. She is a farmer and her work obligates her to work in places away from her home because her fields are located in areas that are very difficult to reach. Having dedicated more than 20 years to this activity has given her the necessary experience and adaptability to develop in this trade. In the same way, in spite of having the major part of her day taken up by this work, she tries to enjoy it, especially since she has always liked to grow flowers. The work does not appear hard for her, what does worry her, however, is the cost of the products that help her keep an adequate production level.

Olinda has a great love for her husband and her 15 year old son, which is the main driver in her life. She is ready to continue growing, for which she needs money to buy seeds and fertilizers for her fields, with the purpose of increasing her income, her production and her orders in the flower markets.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of gladiola seeds and fertilizers for her fields.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es:
Priscila is 52 and lives with her husband, who is a teacher, and their 14-year-old son.

For mO. than 30 years, she has been dedicated to agriculture. Now she is dedicated to growing corn, which she carries out starting very early in the morning after preparing food and fulfilling her role as a mother. She then goes to her farm to irrigate and fertilize adequately. She finishes her work at night fall when she returns home very tired. It pleases Priscila to be active, which is reflected in her production. The difficult part of her job is paying the elevated costs of fertilizer.

Priscila hopes to make her son a worthy person and, above all, a professional.

Now she has to invest in fertilizer so her production will be favorable and to obtain income that will help her expand her farmland and her plantings of new products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Priscila tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, y con su hijo de 14 años.

Por más de 30 años, se dedica a la agricultura, ahora está dedicada a la producción de maíz, que la realiza desde temprano en la mañana, después de preparar los alimentos y cumplir con su rol de madre, para luego ir rumbo a sus chacras, regar y abonar adecuadamente, esta labor la termina al atardecer, donde retorna a su hogar, muy cansada.A Priscila le agrada sentirse activa, lo que se refleja en su producción, lo difícil en su trabajo es pagar los costos elevados de los abonos y fertilizantes.

Priscila tiene el deseo de hacer de su hijo una persona de bien, y sobre todo, profesional.

Ahora, tiene que invertir en abonos para que su producción sea favorable, y así obtener ingresos que la ayuden a la ampliación de sus terrenos y la siembra de nuevos productos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertliizer and expansion of her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr: At the borrower's request, this information has been removed.

loans.use: to buy a taxi motor

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio is 56 and lives by himself. He is dedicated to agriculture and grows different products, mainly corn and potatoes. He has done this for more than 40 years. His experience in this field has helped him produce adequately, and over all, support and satisfy the needs of his children, who are now adults and have their own families. Artemio separated from his wife 20 years ago, which is why he lives alone. But agriculture has helped him with his lack of family: it keeps him busy all day in his fields and keeps him from feeling lonely. He has enjoyed this activity since he was very young. He used to help his father with his plowing. The difficult part of his job is battling the cold climate of the region, and the rainy season is even worse.

Artemio's motivation is to keep helping his children with what they need, and above all, his small grandchildren.

Now he hopes to expand his farmland and acquire more hectares to expand his production. When he no longer has the strength to farm, he hopes to just manage his farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Artemio tiene 56 años, vive solo. Se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando diversos productos, sobre todo el maíz y la papá, actividad que la realiza hace más de 40 años, su experiencia en este campo le ayudó a producir adecuadamente, sobre todo, sostener y satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos, quienes ahora ya son adultos y con sus propias familias, Artemio hace 20 años se separó de su esposa, por ello es que vive solo en su casa.Pero la agricultura a sabido cubrir la falta de su familia, ocuparse todo el día en sus terrenos evita que se sienta solo, además que esta actividad le agradó desde muy niño, le ayudaba a su padre en el arado, lo difícil es batallar con el clima frío del lugar, y peor aún en tiempos de lluvia.

Artemio tiene su motivador en seguir ayudando a sus hijos en lo que puedan necesitar y sobre todo a sus nietos pequeños.

Ahora, tiene deseos de ampliar sus terrenos, adquiriendo algunas hectáreas más y así aumentar su producción, con el tiempo cuando las fuerzas ya no le alcancen quiere ser solo el administrador de sus terrenos.

loans.use: Purchase of more hectares to expand his farmland

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es:
Maria Lorena lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, is married, and has 2 beautiful children who are 12 and 16. They are studying, one in primary school and one in secondary school. Her husband works on a farm in a rural area. Maria Lorena sells food and works hard to provide her children with what they need so they don't lack anything. She has sold food for four years. She started with her own funds and with help from her husband. She has an established clientele who like the delicious dishes she prepares. She dedicates a lot of time to this since there is a variety of food and the dishes are different every day. The money she is requesting is to improve the infrastructure on her home by purchasing rafters and metal to replace her roof, which is in bad shape.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Maria Lorena habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es casada y tiene dos hermosos hijos de 12 y 16 años de edad. Ellos están estudiando, uno en la primaria y el otro en secundaria, su esposo trabaja en una finca en una zona rural. Maria Lorena vende comida y trabaja duro para proveerles a sus hijos lo que necesiten y que no les falte nada, tiene cuatro años en las ventas de comida, e inicio con fondos propios y con ayuda de su esposo. Ya tiene su clientela establecida que gustan de los deliciosos platos que prepara, para eso dedica mucho tiempo ya que la comida es variada y son diferentes platillos todos los días. Con el dinero que esta solicitando es para mejoras de infraestructura en la compra de perlines y zinc para reparar el techo ya que esta en mal estado.

loans.use: To replace the roof on her house

loans.name: Young Tourists Group

texts.en: Amidu K. is the leader of the Young Tourists, a microfinance borrowing group, who are now applying for their fourth loan from Kiva.  Amidu and the other group members, Adamsay S., Alie K. and Mohammed K., all found that their previous loans helped them expand their businesses and improve their quality of life.  As the leader of this group, Amidu has ensured past loans were paid off and that extra capital was shared with other members of the community.  He was born in Makeni City and is 32 years old, married to a local slipper seller, and has three children.  He sells a variety of products, such as powders, tooth brushes, pastes, and soaps, within his community.  Amidu is anticipating that he can successfully expand his business.  Therefore, the Young Tourists are now requesting a loan of $1375, which will be used to purchase a wider variety of products to sell to the members of his community.

loans.use: Expand on their businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is 37 and lives with her husband and 2 children. She has been dedicated to agriculture since she was very young, since she used to help her parents with different activities related to farming. Since she got married, this is the activity that has helped her support her home together with her husband. Since this work is an enormous sacrifice, not only because of putting up with the rain, but also because of the arduous work involved in it, it takes her all day to carry it out. But this doesn't stop her wanting to plant because what she enjoys most is harvesting her products and selling them at market. Nevertheless, what limits her is the expensive prices of insecticides and fertilizers that help protect her crops.

This woman bases her strength on the well-being of her home and educating her two teenage children.

Because she is projecting an increase in production, she wants to invest the money she is requesting in her farmland so she can grow as a farmer and a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Delia tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde muy pequeña está dedicada a la agricultura, ya que ayudaba a sus padres en las diversas actividades concernientes a la actividad del agricultor. Desde que contrajo matrimonio esta es la actividad que le ayuda a mantener su hogar junto a su esposo.Debido a que esta labor es de enorme sacrificio, no solo por soportar las lluvias, sino por el trabajo arduo que se emplea en él, le toma todo un día en realizarlo, pero esto no le quita las ganas de sembrar, ya que lo que más le agrada es cosechar sus productos y venderlos en los mercados.Sin embargo, lo que la limita son los costosos precios de los insecticidas y fertilizantes que ayudan a proteger sus sembríos.

Esta mujer basa su esfuerzo en el bienestar de su hogar y en la educación de sus dos hijos adolescentes.

Proyectándose al aumento de su producción, quiere invertir el dinero que solicita en sus campos de cultivo, y así crecer como agricultora y comerciante.

loans.use: Investment capital to prepare and improve her farmland

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Olivia del Carmen R. L., tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el barrio Ermita de Dolores, tiene tres hijos con edades compredndidas entre los 8 años, 14 y 18 años respectivamente, todos estudian en colegio publico cursando el mayor el cuarto año de secundaria, el otro cursa el tercer año de sucndaria y el menor en cuatro grado de primaria, la actividad economica de la señora es la venta de ropa nueva y perfumes actividad que tiene seis años de desarrolllar producto de la necesidad de un empleo por consiguiente obtener ingresoso para el nucleo familiar, es soltera su compañero de vida trabaja como guarda de seguridad, por lo que sus ingresos no son lo suficientemente buenos para poder suplir las necesidades del hogar, uno de sus mayores sueños es poder ayudar a sus hijos a que se formen profesionalmente, otro de sus deseos es poder instalar d manera fija su negocio de esta manera poder pasar mas tiempo con su familia y al mismo tiempo tener su propia tienda, siendo esta la razon por la cual ttrabaja con creditos, y superarse dia a dia.
texts.en:
Olivia del Carmen R. L. is 43 years old and lives in Ermita De Dolores. She has 3 children 8, 14 and 18 years old. They all study in public school. The oldest one is in his 4th year in high school, the 14 year old is in his 3rd year in high school and the smallest one is in 4th grade. Olivia has been earning a living for the past 6 years by selling new clothes and perfumes. She started this business due to her financial needs. She is not married but her companion works as a security gard. His income isn't enough to be able to meet their household expenses. One of her biggest dreams is to help her kids obtain an education. She would also like to establish her own clothing store to be able to dedicate more time to her family. Her family is the reason why she works so hard to further advance in life.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Hope Sisters Group

texts.en:
These people are Fatu J., Saidu B., Bilkisu K. and Alimatu B.. They named their group Hope Sisters and they made Fatu J. (right) their leader. They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni City. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000 to enable them to buy more goods to sell. With more goods at their disposal, they will be able to make more profit and thus improve their livelihoods.

Their leader is 48 years old. She is a widow with 7 children. Three of them are already grown, while the other 4 are still school-going children. Madam Fatu pays for the school fees for these children and other related charges out of the proceeds she gets from previous loans. She also feeds and clothes them all as a result of previous loans from Kiva through SMT.

Fatu has sold market food at the town’s main lorry park (truck stop) for the past 20 years now. She buys her goods from Freetown. She will invest this new loan in the same business as she is now used to selling these types of items and can do better with them. Madam Fatu told me that accessing these loans makes her life happy because she will be able to invest this money in her business, repay the loan, keep the capital, and then get access to another new loan.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Lenuel

texts.es: Don Lenuel P. H., tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos con edades comprendidas entre los 18 y 19 años de edad ambas estudian el primer años de la universidad, su esposa es empleada domestica, la actividad eocnomica del señor es un taller de torno y soldadura en su casa de habtacion, su proposito es mejorar las condicones de infraestructura del neogico ya que es su herramienta principal y con la cual mantiene a su familia, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos coronen una carrera profesional o mas adelante sus hijos se interesen en el negocio que ahora desarrolla y lo equipen con la tecnologia mas moderna ya que actualmente parte de sus equipos son bastante obsoletos,en esta actividad el señor tiene mas de trece años de dedicarse habiendo poco a poco adquirido sus herramientas ya que el trabajo como ayudante de torno. Sus ceditos han sido para capital de trabajo para la compra de Bronce, Aluminio, Hierro Colado o chatarra con la cual él elabora partes de repuestos tambien para vehiculos.
texts.en:
Mr. Lenuel P. H. is 57 years old and married. He has two children, who are 18 and 19 years old. Both children are in their first year of university. Lenuel's wife works as a domestic servant, and he runs a welding business from his home. Lenuel's goal is to improve the infrastructure of his business, because his shop is the main source of income for the family. Lenuel's greatest dream is for his children to complete their professional education. He hopes that they will take interest in the welding business, and that they'll equip it with more modern technology. At the moment, some of Lenuel's tools are obsolete. Lenuel has been working as a welder for more than thirteen years, including time as an assistant, and over the years he has slowly accumulated tools. Lenuel's loans have been used as working capital to buy bronze, aluminum, and strained iron or scrap iron, which he uses to make replacement parts for vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela, 52, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has a son, 15, in high school. Her husband is a supervisor for an industrial company and contributes to the family's living expenses. Angela has operated a small general store for a year, a business that she started with help from her husband and her own hard work. She gets up early to make breakfast for her husband and son so that she can open the store each morning in time for students on their way to school to stop and buy what they need from her. The loan will be used to stock the store with basic grains because they're costly now and it's become difficult to buy them in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman

Ángela habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad, que actualmente esta estudiando la secundaria, su esposo es supervisor industrial, y le apoya económicamente en los gastos del hogar. Doña Ángela tiene una pulpería que comenzó con esfuerzo propio y con ayuda de su esposo, ya tiene un año de tenerla, ella se levanta temprano a preparar el desayuno para su esposo y su hijo para luego abrir la venta en la mañana ya que aprovecha a los estudiantes que van hacia la escuela y que muchas veces requieren de sus servicios. El crédito será usado para la compra de granos básicos para surtir la pulpería, ya que actualmente éstos tiene precios elevados y se la hace más difícil adquirir en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maryuri Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maryuri, 23, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has two children, 4 and 5. Her husband works for a company that markets vehicles and used to be the only income-earner for the family. However, Maryuri decided 2 years ago that she would help him with the household expenses so that his burden wouldn't be so great. She started a business selling gold and silver jewelry. She's a hard-working woman, selling at her house and away, offering various pieces which she sells in easy-to-pay installments. The requested loan is for buying silver jewelry so that she can meet the demand coming from her customers. In the future, Maryuri would like to set up a shop and legally establish her business. She also wants to ensure that can provide for her children's schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Maryuri habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de de 4 y 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa que comercializa vehículos, y anteriormente era el único que se encargaba del sustento del hogar, pero hace 2 años Maryuri decidió apoyarlo para que la carga no fuera tan pesada, se dedica al negocio de las ventas de prendas de oro y plata, Maryuri es una mujer activa, vende en su casa y visita las instituciones para ofrecer sus productos en variadas prendas que las da en cuotas accesibles. La solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en compra de prendas de plata, y así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. A futuro es establecer una boutique para formalizar su negocio y obtener más seguridad con las ventas, poder dar estudios a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Three Sisters Group

texts.en: Fatmata L. is the leader of her microfinance borrowing group, which is called the "Three Sisters," and includes her friends Mariama K. and Edaline B..  Fatmata is 42 years old, married to a police officer, and has five children, all of whom go to school.  While her husband usually pays their children's school fees, Fatmata is usually responsible for their well-being and therefore works hard to take care of them and provide for them through her business.  Together the women in the Three Sisters borrowing group sell "gara lappers," or locally dyed clothes with fabricated designs, in Makeni City.  They started their business with previous loans by purchasing 150 yards of plain cotton, which they dyed and sold in their community.  The Three Sisters  are now finding that added capital would allow them to expand their capacity by purchasing another 90 yards of cotton, and are therefore requesting a loan of $1050.

loans.use: Expand on their businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sorbeh Group. Its members include Musa S. Bangura, Abu K. and Adamsay Conteh. They are petty-traders in Makump Banna village. This is their eighth loan from SMT. SMT has enabled these entrepreneurs to gain continuous access to loans. This opportunity has enabled them to continue in business, and they are very grateful for this opportunity.

Musa S. Bangura (left) is the leader of this group. Musa was born in Makump village about seven miles from Makeni, some 35 years ago. He is married with four children. Musa's wife sells bowls. Musa sells jeans and women's clothes. He has been doing this for the past seven years. With Musa's previous loans from Kiva through SMT he was able to solve all of his family's problems. He can send his children to school, feed and clothe them all out of the loans he gets from SMT.

Musa will invest this new loan in the same clothing business, as he is used to doing this business and has made a lot of customers over the years.

loans.use: To expand their existing businesses.

texts.es: Camila habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, ha sido una mujer luchadora y ha logrado salir a delante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera, a sus 56 años de edad, sigue con su negocio que son ventas de electrodoméstico, ropa y cosméticos. Tiene tres hijos que ya son independiente los cuales siempre la han apoyado en las ventas, ya son quince años de experiencia. Comenzó con dinero propio, salía a vender ropa  a los departamentos lo cual le generaba alguna ganancia y eso le permitió poner el negocio en su vivienda, aunque las ventas algunas veces las realiza de forma ambulante. La solicitud de préstamo es para invertirla en capital en la compra de electrodomésticos, ropa variada y cosméticos para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. Su sueño siempre fue luchar por su familia y ahora que sus hijos ya son independientes espera que la familia se mantenga siempre unida porque para ella sus hijos son todo en esta vida
texts.en:
Camila lives in the neighborhood of Villa Venezuela. She has been a fighter, getting through life with her sons while being a single mother. She is 56 years old and continues with her business of selling electric appliances, clothing and cosmetics. She has three children who are now independent. They have always helped with her sales, with which she now has 15 years of experience. She started with her own money, to sell clothes door to door. That generated the profits which allowed her to set up the business from her house, although she still occasionally sells in the streets. Camila's loan will be used as capital to buy electric appliances, clothing and cosmetics, in order to offer her clients a wide variety of products. Her dream has always been to take care of and defend her family, and now that her children are now independent she hopes her family stays united because for Camila, her children are everything.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of clothes, cosmetics and electric appliances.

loans.name: Ileana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ileana, 44, operates a business selling and repairing home appliances. She lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has a daughter, 17, in college. At first, she sold food in Managua's Mayoreo market but because she is always on the look-out for for something better, she sold her stand with all its accessories and bought glass cases and electronic parts that she and husband were able to use in a shop that he already operated. That's how they came to work together. With the requested loan, Ileana will buy spare parts to meet the demands of her customers and ensure that they will always do business with her. Her dream, like any mother, is to be able to see her daughter settled in a professional career. That's why she's working very hard, so that she can pay the very expensive university fees.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Ileana a sus 44 años de edad, tiene un taller de electrodoméstico y venta de repuestos, actualmente habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua, es casada y tiene una hija de 17 años que está cursando la universidad, cuando comenzó vendía comida en el mercado del mayoreo, pero por razones de buscar siempre estar mejor vendió el tramo con todo sus accesorio y comenzó a invertir en compra vitrinas y repuestos electrónicos ya que le resultaba por que su esposo se encargaba del taller, y fue así como comenzó a trabajar en sociedad con su esposo. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en repuestos de electrónica para satisfacer los servicios que demandan sus clientes y poder retenerlos para que siempre trabajen con ellos. Su sueño como cualquier madre es poder ver a su hija convertida en una profesional, y por eso es que ahora trabaja más duro para poder pagar los estudios universitarios que son más caros.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for appliance store.

loans.name: Esmelda Maria

texts.es:
Esmelda, 44, lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has two children, 8 and 13, both in school. Her husband works for a taxi cooperative. Esmelda gets up very early each morning to dive into selling her products--fish and various kinds of delicious shellfish. They're expensive products but products that sell well because they are an important part of a healthy diet. She's been operating the business for four years. Sales are slow sometimes but very good at other times, Semana Santa (the week before Easter), for example, which was the time she began her business with money she had saved. She didn't have a place to sell her products before, but with good advice and hard work, she managed to establish herself. The requested loan is to buy a range of seafood so that Esmelda can continue to grow her small business and develop her business skills. In the future, she hopes to improve her little shop so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Esmelda tiene 44 años de edad, habita en Villa Reconciliación, es casada y con dos hijos de 8 y 13 años de edad que están estudiando, su esposo es cadete de una unidad de taxi. Doña Esmelda se levanta muy temprano por las mañanas para hincar las ventas de pecados, chacalines y mucho mas variedad en ricos mariscos, son productos caros pero se venden por su alimentación que es comida saludables. En las ventas lleva ya cuatro años, en ocasiones las ventas son bajas, aunque hay otras en que la temporada es muy buena como la Semana Santa, cuando comenzó lo hizo con dinero ahorrado y una señora le daba donde vender sus mariscos, por que no tenia un lugar especifico. Pero con mucho esfuerzo logró poner su tramo. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de variedad de mariscos y así seguir creciendo en su pequeño negocio, y desarrollarse como una microempresaria futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su tramo, para seguir brindando dando buen servicio a sus clientes

loans.use: Buy seafood for resale.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: La señora Marianela M. H., tiene  29 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo de cuatro meses de nacido, su esposo trabaja como gestor de cobro en la empresa de acueductos y alcantarillados ENACAL, la actividad economica de la señora es una pequeña tienda de ropa para niños, cosmeticos y calzado para niños, actividad que tiene ocho años de desarrollar, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion, teniendo como proposito invertir mas capital  a su negocio, su deseo ahora que tiene un hijo, es poder adquirir una casa propia, su sueño es poder visitar a su ama en los estados unidos, dicho negocio da inicio como una idea de su esposo en poder obtener otros ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. Marianela M. H. is 29 years old and married. She has a four-month old son, and her husband works as an agent for ENACAL, selling irrigation and sewer systems. Marianela has a small store where she sells children's clothes and shoes, and cosmetics. Her husband suggested creating the business as a means of earning extra income and improving their standard of living. Marianela's store is located in her home, and she has managed it for eight years. Now that she has a child, Marianela would like to invest more capital into her business, so that she can buy a house of her own. Marianela's dream is to visit her childhood nanny in the U.S.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Blanca Del Socorro

texts.es:
Blanca, 45, lives in the Villa Fraternidad neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has two children, 2 and 4. Her husband works as a bookkepper. Blanca has sold clothing and cosmetics for nine years. She started the business with her savings and help from her husband. She has managed to push forward and hold on to her business even when her customers have failed to pay and left her holding the bag. Nonethess, her products sell because they're attractive and accessible. The loan will be used to buy construction materials to improve the porch on the family house, something that will make the house more comfortable and beautiful. Blanca's short-term hopes are to be able to build a shop for her business and improve the service that she provides.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Blanca habita en el barrio Villa Fraternidad, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y con dos niños de 2 y 4 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como contador, la Sra. Blanca vende prendas y cosméticos tiene nueve años en las ventas, inició con capital propio con la ayuda de su esposo, ha logrado salir adelante y ha mantenido su pequeño negocio por que algunas veces los clientes le quedan mal y no le pagana. Pero es un producto que se vende ya que son buenos y accesibles. El préstamo será usado en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar el porche de su vivienda y así ir invirtiendo en su vivienda para tener una casa más cómoda y bonita. Sus planes a corto plazo son poder construir un local para ahí tener su negocio y poder mejorar el servicio que ofrece

loans.use: Buy construction materials to improve the porch on the family house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María is 63, is divorced, and lives with her daughter Lourdes, who is 23. Her other children, Nancy, AyD., Hedí, and Berta have their own families and jobs.

She sells food in the small store that she has in her home. With 2 years of much effort, she managed to strengthen her business to generate income and to support her extended family. Since she separated from her husband, she has worked all day in her store, an activity that she likes a lot and that alieves some of the pain of the separation. On the other hand, it is difficult to work alone. With the help of her daughter Lourdes and the unconditional support of her other children, María moves forward day after day.

With the money from the loan, she wants to expand her store by purchasing more products and with time convert her store into a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

María tiene 63 años, está divorciada, vive con su hija Lourdes D. 23 años, ya que sus demás hijos Nancy, AyD., Hedí y Berta ya tienen sus respectivas familias y trabajos.

Se dedica a la venta D. comestibles en la pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa, con 2 años D. mucho esfuerzo logré consolidar su negocio para generar ingresos y poder mantener a su extensa familia.DesD. que se separó D. su esposo se ha dedicado durante todo el día a su tienda, actividad que le gusta mucho, ya que en cierta medida aliviana la pena D. su separación, por otro lado, lo más difícil es sentirse trabajando sola. Con la ayuda D. su hija Lourdes, y el apoyo incondicional D. sus otros hijos María sale adelante día a día.

Con el dinero del préstamo quiere expandir su tienda comprando más productos, con el tiempo implementar su tienda y así llegar a ser pronto un bazar.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of products in her store

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia is 49 years old, single, she lives in her parent’s hom with her 20-year old son Ramiro who is studying at the university. She was born in Juliaca, and with the support of her parents she opened an auto parts store. The work is difficult and Lucrecia had to learn everything associated with auto repair. Now, with 19 years of experience, she has become an expert. What she most enjoys about her job is that she is the manager and her own boss. She works on behalf of her son Ramiro, who as her only child is her sole focus, and she wants to see him become a professional and have a beautiful family. With the money from the loan Lucrecia wants to buy some parts that her customers have asked for and until now she has not been able to acquire them. In the future she wants her business to grow in earnings in order to have a bigger locale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Lucrecia tiene 49 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con su hijo Ramiro de 20 años, el cual cursa estudios superiores. Es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, con el apoyo de sus padres puso una tienda de repuestos para motor de autos. El trabajo es difícil y Lucrecia tuvo que aprender todo lo relacionado con la mecánica de autos, ahora, ya con 19 años de experiencia se ha convertido en toda una experta, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que ella lo administra y es su propia jefa. Trabaja a favor de su hijo Ramiro, quien al ser su único hijo es su adoración, quiere verlo profesional y que conforme una linda familia. Con el dinero del préstamo Lucrecia quiere comprar algunos repuestos que le solicitaron y que hasta ahora no había podido conseguir.En el futuro quiere que su negocio incremente sus ganancias para tener un local más grande.

loans.use: Buy auto parts that her customers have asked for

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 9 y 7 años. Se dedica a la venta de muebles, su esposo trabaja en la mina La Rinconada y por lo tanto no se queda mucho tiempo en casa, es así, que para ayudar a los gastos familiares, Violeta decidió dedicarse a la venta de muebles, eso desde hace ya 6 meses.Tiene un local alquilado en una cuadra de su localidad donde se venden muebles de toda clase, ella atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la pasada la tarde, entretanto, se las arregla para mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y prepararles sus alimentos, esta es la parte difícil de su trabajo, pero Violeta ya está acostumbrada y le gusta poder ganar su propio dinero.
Violeta quiere que sus dos hijos sean profesionales, para que no tengan que dedicarse solo al comercio, sino a estudiar y trabajar en otros ámbitos.
Con el dinero del préstamo, quiere comprar más muebles para aumentar su venta y con el tiempo poner otro negocio, que le permita solventar sus gastos económicos y mantener a su familia unida.
texts.en:
Violeta is 31 years old and she lives with her husband and siblings of age 9 and 7. She sells furniture for a living and her husband works at a mine called La Rinconada and he hardly spends time at home. This is the reason why Violeta 6 months ago decided to sell furniture to help the family. She rented a place in her neigborhood where all kinds of furniture are on sale. She works from 8am until late in the afternoon while she also sends her kids to school and prepare them meals which is precisely what makes her work more difficult but Violeta is already use to this and she enjoys being able to work to earn a living. Violeta wants her two kids to become professionals. She would like her kids to study and work in something other than sales.

With the loan money she wants to buy more furniture to increase her sales and in time be able to buy another business to be able to further support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her sales with the purchase of new furniture

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is single, she is 28 years old, she lives alone with her 4 year old daughter. She is a hardworking woman with great dreams of improving her economic situation to meet the expenses of her small daughter and of her parents, who 40 years ago gave her the gift of life. Yolanda is originally from the city of Cuzco. Lack of opportunities for work made her leave her city of birth and relocate to Juliaca. Since then, she has been selling a variety of mattresses, a business that in the beginning didn’t appear to be profitable, but with effort, dedication and a lot of hard work she was able to grow her business. Today she has a sales stand on one of the busiest commercial streets in Juliaca. The wish of this diligent woman is to increase capital to invest in her business, and she is sure that with your help she will be able to do so, so that in the near future she can expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Yolanda es soltera, tiene 28 años, vive sola con su pequeña de 4 años. Es una mujer emprendedora con grandes ilusiones de mejorar su situación económica para solventar los gastos de su pequeña hija y la de sus queridos padres, quienes hace más de 40 años le concedieron el regalo de brindarle la vida.Yolanda es natural de la ciudad del Cuzco, la falta de oportunidades de trabajo la obligó a abandonar su ciudad natal y radicar en Juliaca, desde entonces, se dedica a la venta de variedad de colchones, negocio que en un principio no parecía resultarle rentable, pero con esfuerzo, dedicación y mucho empeño logró crecer con su negocio, actualmente tiene un puesto de venta en una de las avenidas más comerciales de dicha ciudad. El deseo de esta diligente mujer es aumentar el monto de inversión de su negocio, está segura que con tu apoyo podrá hacerlo, para que en un futuro cercano pueda expandir su negocio.

loans.use: Increase capital to invest in her business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma R. is a cheerful person, always with a big smile and happy in spite of the fact that since 2005, she has been encarcerated in the women´s jail, the Centro Preventivo Santa Teresa, and that her husband abandoned her because of her problems with the law.

In spite of her situation, she did not give up and learned how to make crafts. In this way, she is using her time for something productive. When she first arrived at the Centro Preventivo she was not able to do crafts and now she can make a wiD. variety of articles using raffia and styrofoam. These sell very well, mainly on the days that visitors come to the jail.

With a loan she would like to buy a larger quantity of supplies at better prices. In this way she can produce and sell more of her products.

Her dream is to get out of jail and together with her daughter, start up a gift store to earn and save money. She thinks that she should now take care of herself and not be a burden to her family. Irma R. is a great woman and a good role model insiD. the women´s jail.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Irma R. es una persona muy alegre, siempre esta con una gran sonrisa, y contenta a pesar D. que desD. el año 2005, ella se encuentra en la cárcel D. mujeres, en el Centro Preventivo Santa Teresa, y su esposo la abandono por su problema con Ley.

Ella a pesar D. su situación, nunca se dio por vencida y aprendió a trabajar manualidades, D. esta forma aprovechar su tiempo en algo útil y productivo, cuando ella llego al Centro Preventivo ella no podía hacerlas, y ahora pueD. hacer una gran variedad D. artículos en materiales D. rafia y fomi, los cuales se venden muy bien, principalmente los días que reciben visitas en dicho centro.

Con su préstamo ella quiere comprar materiales por mayor cantidad y a mejor precio, D. esta forma ella podrá producir y vender más sus productos.

Su sueño es salir D. la cárcel y poner una tienda D. regalos en compañía D. su hija, ganar dinero y ahorrar. Ella piensa que ya tiene una edad en la cual tiene que luchar por ella misma, para no ser una carga para su familia. Irma R. es una gran mujer, un ejemplo dentro D. la cárcel D. mujeres.

loans.use: Buy supplies for making crafts.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina is 35 years old, single, and lives alone in a rented house. More than 2 years ago she decided to generate her own income, so she started a small mattress factory, and in her factory she also employs two other hardworking young people with great desire to be successful, and in this way she is helping to reduce the unemployment rate in her city. Her wish is to set up her shop, she is sure with your help she will be able to solidify her project in converting her factory into a great place of employment. Agustin wants to create a better economic future and have a family. With the loan she will be able to buy more raw material to make her mattresses and make her business more productive so in the future she can be the most sought after business in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Agustina tiene 35 años, es soltera, vive sola en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 2 años decidió ser generadora de sus propios ingresos económicos, por ello, que implementó su pequeña fábrica de colchones, fábrica en la que también ofrece trabajo a otros dos jóvenes hacendosos con grandes deseos de superación, de esa manera colabora en reducir la tasa de desempleados de su ciudad.Su deseo es implementar su taller, está segura que con vuestro apoyo podrá concretar su proyecto de convertir su fabrica en una gran fuente generadora de empleo. Agustina quiere forjarse un mejor futuro económico y formar una familia. Con el dinero del préstamo podrá comprar más materia prima para confeccionar sus colchones y hacer más productiva su empresa, para que en el futuro sea la más cotizada de la región.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make mattresses that she sells

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María is 40 years old, she lives with her two sons, Yeison, age 16, and Jafel, age 7. Since she was a small girl she was drawn to cosmetology. She likes to bring out the beauty of the whole person, so she decided to invest the savings she has gathered over the years working in opening her own beauty salon. She has been a beautician for over 15 years, during which time her two beautiful sons were born, and they are the motivation and what drive her to persevere in her work. She wants her sons to be successful and have a better future for their families. Today, she has plans to implement and expand her business, therefore, with the hope of receiving your help with a loan, she will be able to pursue her dream of having a bigger salon, and this way meet her children’s education expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

María tiene 40 años, vive con sus dos hijos, Yeison de 16 y Jafel de 7. Desde niña tuvo gran inclinación hacia el trabajo de la cosmetología, le gusta resaltar la belleza de toda persona, por ello que decidió invertir sus ahorros de largos años de trabajo para abrir su propio salón de belleza.Viene dedicándose a esta labor hace más de 15 años, tiempo en que nacieron sus dos adorables hijos, quienes son el motivo que la impulsa a perseverar con su trabajo. Quiere que sus dos hijos sean personas de éxito y tengan un mejor futuro familiar y económico. Actualmente, tiene planes de ampliar e implementar su negocio, por ello, con la esperanza de recibir respuesta favorable a su pedido de préstamo, seguirá con su anhelo de tener un salón más grande, de esa manera, cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Implementation and expansion of her beauty salon

loans.name: Filadelfo José

texts.es:
Filadelfo, 43, lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. He has two children, 7 and 14, who are both in school. He has worked two years as a driver for a private company. He has had a difficult time building his house because his income is so low. His wife, consequently, is working as a maid for another family so that she can help her husband and together they can apply for a loan. With the requested loan, they will build a wall, 12 meters along the outside and 5 meters along the house. For this, they will buy stone, cement, sand and iron bar. Filadelfo and his wife hope that with both of them now working, they can improve their house and provide the life that their family deserves.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Filadelfo tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah. Tiene dos hijos de 7 y 14 años de edad, que están en el colegio. Trabaja como conductor, tiene dos años de estar laborando en una empresa privada, ha tenido muchas dificultades para construir su casa debido a los bajos ingresos que tiene, es por esa razón que su esposa está trabajando en una casa particular de servicios domésticos, para poder apoyar a su esposo, y juntos poder optar a un crédito. Con el préstamo solicitado construirá 12 mts lineales de muro y 5 mts de pared. Para esto se va a comprar piedra, cemento, arena y hierro. Esperan que ahora que ambos están trabajando puedan mejorar su casa y optar a una vida más digna para su familia.

loans.use: Build a wall around house.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mercedes lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. She is 36 years old, married, with 4 daughters and 2 sons, all of whom study. Her husband receives a pension but he works as a security guard in order to provide additional income and support the children and their studies. Mercedes has been selling food for 5 years, and she also sells cosmetics. Previously she only sold food but the seeing need to ensure her family’s future, she decided to enter cosmetic sales. The loan she seeks is to buy construction materials to build a bathroom because they presently have a latrine and would like to buy a toilet as it is more hygienic and comfortable for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Mercedes habita en el barrio Hialeah de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, con cuatro hijos dos mujeres y dos hombres, todos estudian, su esposo recibe una pensión, pero él trabaja como guarda de seguridad para tener más ingreso y apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios. Doña Mercedes tiene cinco años de vender comida, y también vende cosméticos, anteriormente solo vendía comida pero ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, decidió incursionar en la venta de cosméticos. El préstamo lo requiere para comprar material de construcción y construir un baño por que actualmente tiene una letrina y ahora quiere comprar su inodoro ya que es más higiénico y más cómodo para su familia.

loans.use: Buy materials to construct a bathroom

loans.name: Guillermo Nicanor

texts.es:
Guillermo, 56, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua. He's married and has a daughter, 15, who is in high school. His wife works at home. Guillermo makes a living selling wood and also has a cart and a cart horse. His wife often helps him with the wood-selling business when he's at work hauling loads in his cart. The loan application is for buying materials to install a toilet because Guillermo and his family only have a latrine now. The addition will be more sanitary and greatly add to the family's comfort. Guillermo hopes to always have work so that he can help his daughter continue her studies and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Guillermo tiene 56 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado y le tienen una hija de 15 años de edad, que esta estudiando en la secundaria, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Guillermo se dedica a la venta de leña y también tiene un carretón con caballo de acarreo su esposa siempre lo ha apoyado con las venta de leña cuando él está trabajando en el negocio del acarreo. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para instalar y comprar un inodoro ya que no tiene solo letrina y así mismo poner las aguas negras. Para darle a su familia más comodidad y más higiene. Desea tener siempre trabajo para poder ayudar a su hija que se prepare con los estudios para que tenga un nivel de vida mejor.

loans.use: Add a toilet and waste water system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to keep producing fried food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of bedsheets and introducing window curtains to her small business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita is 23 years old and lives with her 33 year old husband Maguin, a teacher in one of the city’s schools. She is a young businesswoman who has been selling pelts for the past 5 years in her furrier business, with the help of her husband Maguin they have made this business a success. Jovita devotes her time to the furrier business, devoting all morning and part of the afternoon, as she doesn’t yet have children that she has to take care of, this business is her sole focus and she is happy to do the work.
