She works hard to be able to create a stable family with her husband Maguin, they plan to have children and she hopes to be able to meet their needs. With the loan she plans to buy more pelts to increase her sales and make some improvements to her locale. In the future Jovita wants to create another business, she is still analyzing the area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Jovita tiene 23 años, vive con su pareja Maguin de 33 años, quien es maestro en una escuela de la ciudad. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de la peletería (venta de pieles de animales), con la ayuda de su pareja Maguin sacan adelante este negocio. Jovita solo se dedica a atender su peletería, a la cual le dedica toda la mañana y parte de la tarde, como aun no tiene hijos que cuidar, este negocio significa para ella su única fuente de distracción, es feliz al realizar su trabajo. Trabaja duro para poder conformar una familia estable con su pareja Maguin, tener hijos, y a los cuales les pueda brindar todas las comodidades. Con el dinero del préstamo piensa adquirir más pieles para aumentar la venta de su peletería, y hacer algunas refacciones de su local, en el futuro Jovita quiere conformar otro negocio, aún está analizando el rubro.

loans.use: increase the number of pelts in her furrier store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase many goods and drinks for a mini-market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in fresh vegetables and meat to produce fried food for her customers.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria is 54 years old and lives in the second section of the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. Her husband works in construction and she has is responsible for a 5 year old granddaughter. She has worked as a cook in a private school for 21 years, providing delicious dishes. When she started at the school she was a helper, now she is in charge of the kitchen. She is asking for a loan to build a wall on the front of her home, so she needs to buy stone, cement, sand and steel. In the future she would like to add her own dining room and be able to sell her delicious dishes and also be able to teach her granddaughter to cook all the dishes she prepares, and that some day she can take over the business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Maria tiene 54 años de edad, habita en la II etapa del barrio de Hialeah de Managua, su esposo trabaja en construcción y tiene una nieta a su cargo que tiene 5 cinco años de edad, ella se desempeña como cocinera de un colegio privado y tiene ya veinte años laborando y dando sus servicios con sus ricos platillos, cuando entró al colegio era ayudante ahora es la responsables de la cocina. La solicitud que esta haciendo es para infraestructura en la construcción de un muro en la parte frontal de su vivienda, para eso necesita comprar piedra, cemento, arena y hierro. A largo plazo le gustaría poner su propio comedor y a si poder vender sus ricos platillo y también poder enseñar a su nieta los diversos platillo que ella prepara, y que algún día ella pueda seguir el negocio

loans.use: Construct  a wall in the front part of her home.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Señor Oscar Antonio M. is 54, is married, and has 3 children. For more than 8 years, he has traveled to the capital of Managua to purchase different products that some businesses in the city of Bluefields order from him. He obtains a profit that has allowed him to pay for his home's expenses. In this business, his main customers are barber shops in the city to whom he brings lotions, hair clippers, and razors, which are used in hair cuts and shaving. Another sector that señor M. supplies are some jewelers, to whom he mainly sells silver and stones to make rings. In the same way, many people like cabinet makers order files, saws, and other products from him to avoid making a trip to the capital themselves.

On every one of these orders, M. makes a small profit that allows him to pay for his basic needs. Nevertheless, he needs financing to be able to fill all of his orders, to make larger profits, and to continue developing his business. He is requesting this loan to purchase 250 grams of silver at $1 per gram, 10 scientific calculators at $7 each, 4 razors at $15 each, and 4 hair clippers at $30 each.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Oscar Antonio M. tiene 54 años de edad, es casado con 3 hijos y desde hace mas de 8 años se dedica a viajar a la capital Managua con el objetivo de comprar diferentes productos que les encargan algunos negocios de esta ciudad de Bluefields y en donde obtiene una ganancia que le a permitido sufragar los gasto de su hogar. En este negocio sus principales clientes son barberos de esta ciudad a quienes les trae lociones, cuchillas de barbero, navajas las cuales utilizan en los cortes de cabellos y afeitadas. Otro sector que abastece el señor M. son algunas joyerías a las cuales les vende principalmente plata y piedras para anillos. De igual manera algunas personas como los ebanistas para evitarse viajar a la capital les hacen encargos de limas, sierras entre otros productos.

En cada uno de estos encargos el comerciante M. obtiene una pequeña ganancia que le permite pagar sus necesidades básicas, sin embargo requiere un financiamiento para poder cumplir con todos sus encargos y poder obtener mayores ganancias e irse desarrollando en este negocio. Por lo que solicita el financiamiento para comprar 250 gramos de plata el cual compra a US$ 1 dólar cada gramo, 10 calculadoras científicas a US$ 7 dólares cada unidad, 4 navajas de afeitar a US$ 15 dólares cada unidad y 4 cuchillas para barbería a US$ 30 dólares cada unidad.

loans.use: To purchase 250 grams of silver, 10 scientific calculators, 4 razors, and 4 hair clippers

loans.name: Martha Angelina

texts.es:
Martha Angelina S. began her own business 4 years ago selling women’s underwear, today she has a business selling ice cream.

She has worked with FAPE but with small loans, which won’t be enough to start this business and expand her business selling ice cream. She is grateful for the support that has been given to her over the past few years.

She is asking for a bigger loan with a longer repayment schedule because she wants to open a tortilla business, which she considers to be a good business.

Her husband helps her economically, but she knows that today her husband’s income isn’t enough, they have three children, all of whom are in school studying.

Her dream is to have two tortilla businesses and have greater income in order to provide the best education possible for her children so that they may become successful people.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Martha Angelina S., inicio su negocio propio hace 4 años vendiendo ropa interior para mujer, en la actualidad tiene una venta de helados.

Ha trabajado con FAPE pero con pequeños prestamos, que no le alcanza para poner ese negocio, y ampliar su negocio de la venta de helados. Esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que se le ha brindado durante varios años.

Ella solicita un préstamo más grande y con un plazo de pago más largo, porque quiere poner un negocio de venta de tortillas, el cual ella considera que es un buen negocio.

Su esposo de ayuda económicamente, pero ella sabe que hoy en día no es suficiente con el ingreso del esposo, tiene tres hijos y todos están estudiando.

Su sueño es tener dos negocios de venta de tortillas, y tener mejores ingresos para darle la mejor educación posible a sus hijos, y que ellos sean personas de éxito.

loans.use: Buy items for her ice cream business and invest in a tortilla business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Zoila Camila S. began her small business selling cleaning and personal hygiene products approximately 2 years ago. She used to sell only to people she knew in her community. With time her business has grown and now she has a bigger clientele of people who buy her products. The products that she sells she buys in southern Mexico. She travels constantly to buy the products, which are of very good quality. She needs the loan to buy more products and thereby have more income and earnings. She has 3 children and they all study, she doesn’t rely on economic help from her husband. Her dream is that her children complete their education and have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Zoila Camila S. inicio su pequeño negocio vendiendo productos de limpieza e higiene personal aproximadamente hace 2 años, vendía solamente a las personas que ella conocía en su comunidad.  Con el tiempo su negocio ha crecido y ahora tiene una clientela más grande de personas que compran sus productos.

Los productos que ella vende los compra en el sur de México, ella viaja constantemente a hacer las compras de esos productos, los cuales son de muy buena calidad.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos y así tener más ingresos y ganancias.

Ella tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian, no cuenta con la ayuda económica de un esposo.  Su sueño es que sus hijos completen su educación, y tengan un mejor futuro en la vida.

loans.use: Invest in purchasing disinfectants and cleaning products.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Mr. Luis Alfredo P. M. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

El señor Pérez ya es una persona grande de edad; en México la gente es jubilada a los 65 años, es por ello que esta persona desea adquirir una casa de infonavit. Al estar jubilado es más difícil adquirir este tipo de créditos que da el gobierno. Luís Alfredo quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad que le otorga una inmobiliaria (lugar que tramita casa de infonavit) ya que si no lo aprovecha en el futuro perderá sus puntos y dinero.Para poder comprar su casa a el le falta la cantidad de $1,050 dólares.

La casa que le ofrece la inmobiliaria queda cerca de la casa de sus hijos, el también consta de una vivienda pero esta es al nombre de su esposa La señora Maria del Carmen Ríos. El Trabaja entre semana en fabrica en esta ciudad y los fines de semana se dedica a vender pulga en Del Rió Texas lugar que queda a unos minutos de la ciudad frontera de Acuña, también la señora lo apoya con los gastos de familiares trabajando de afanadora en una casa y así con estos ingresos van a poder pagar el préstamo recibido.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alfredo P. M. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Mr. P. is an elder person, in Mexico people retire when they are 65 years old and that’s why he wishes to purchase a house through Infonavit. When retired, it’s more difficult to receive these types of loans that the government offers. Luis Alfredo wants to take advantage of this opportunity from the real estate organization (who manages the Infonavit houses), because if he doesn’t, he will loose his qualifying points and money. To be able to purchase the house, he is short $1,050 dollars. The house being offered to him is close to his childrens' house, he also has a home but it is registered under his wife’s name Mrs. Maria del Carmen Rios. He works during the week in a local factory and on weekends he sells different items in the flea market in Del Rio, Texas, a place minutes away from the border city of Acuña, his wife also helps him with the family expenses working in a residence as a housekeeper; with these different incomes they will be able to repay the loan requested.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a house through the Infonavit program

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en: Valeh is married, has two children, and has settled in the town of Khirdalan. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Fuzuli region in Azerbaijan. He started this business 15 years ago. This man was born in 1966. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy food to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy food

Unanani is 28 years old. She is divorced with one eight year old child. Since 2007, she has been running her own beauty salon. She works every day at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en: Elnara is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and has settled in Fuzuli region, in Bala Bahmanli village. She was born in 1983. Elnara has been in the buffalo business for 4 years. She is single. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy a buffalo to expand her business.

loans.name: Djamila

texts.en: Djamila is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and she has settled in the Fuzuli region, in Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. She is married and has 2 children. Five years ago she started this business. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy foodstuffs for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Khanali

texts.en: 8 years ago, Khanali started the butchery business. He was born in 1957. This man is married and has 3 children. Khanali is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town and has settled in the Fizuli region. Now he needs a loan of US$ 750 to buy meat to expand his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy meat for re-sale

loans.name: Vakil

texts.en: Vakil (his wife is pictured) was born in 1963. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. There, he settled in the Fizuli region, in Kayidish village, a village which was built for IDPs. He has 3 children. Vakil and his wife has been in the cattle breeding business for 6 years. Now they need a loan of US$ 1200 to buy 2 calves for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Amil

texts.en: This young man was born in 1983. He is married and has 2 children. Amil is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and he settled in Baku City. Four years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en: Vafa was born in 1990. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan and has settled in the Fizuli region. She has been in cattle breeding for a year. Now she needs a loan of US$ 500 to buy a calf.

loans.use: to buy  a calf

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin is 30 years old, married, and has one child. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and he settled in Baku city. Four years ago he started a taxi business. Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy the spare parts for repairing his taxi.

loans.use: Buy the spare parts to repair his tax

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam started selling the most basic construction materials (cement, gravel, and sand) retail in a room in her house. Today she has constructed a location that is better supplied. She now also sells electrical materials, plumbing such as PVC pipes, and hardware. She now sales wholesale.

Thanks to the profits this has given her, she has been able to expand and have a stable business.

She needs a loan of $400, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy assorted merchandise. She has every hope that with Kiva's support, she can obtain it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Miriam inicio vendiendo solo lo más básico para la construcción (cemento, grava, arena) en menudeo, en un cuarto de su vivienda. Hoy en día ya construyo un local, lo acondiciono, ya tiene mas surtido, ahora también vende material eléctrico, plomería desde tubos pvc hasta tornilleria, y ya vende a mayoreo.

Gracias a las ganancias que esto le ha dejado se ha podido ampliar y tener un negocio ya estable.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara a 6 meses, para la compra de surtido de mercancía, tiene todas las esperanzas que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ayda Luz

texts.es: Ayda Luz tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 16 años de edad. Ella ha logrado superarse en  la vida y tener un trabajo digno para mantener a sus dos hijos. Estudió un curso para maestra, y ahora da clase a los jóvenes de secundaria. Los ingresos que devenga un profesor en Nicaragua son bajos, es por eso que se auxilian de créditos para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, Ayda Luz utilizará el préstamo en la construcción de un servicio higiénico, ya que el que actualmente tiene está en muy mal estado. Espera poder tener siempre su trabajo para terminar de construir su vivienda, y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ayda Luz is 42 years old, she is single, and she lives in the region of Laureles Norte. She has two children aged 10 and 16 years old. She has been able to improve her life circumstances and secure work that is dignified so that she can support her two children. She took a course to be a teacher and she now teaches in secondary school. The income that is earned as a teacher in Nicaragua is small, and that is why she is requesting a loan to renovate her home. Ayda Luz will use this loan to put in a new bathroom because the one they currently use is in a very bad state of disrepair. She hopes to always have her work so that she can finish remodelling her home, and in this way, offer her family a better quality of life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario works in security services, and his wife is a housewife. They have three children who are 3, 5, and 7. They currently live in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He is requesting this loan to improve the infrastructure on his house by improving the roof, which is in bad shape, and putting plaster on the walls. This is so his house will be in better condition, which he still hasn't managed to achieve. With the help of this loan, he hopes to be able to get ahead and to continue with his projects like helping his children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Mario trabaja en servicios de seguridad, su esposa es ama de casa, tienen tres hijos de 3,5 y 7 años de edad, actualmente habitan en el barrio Laureles Sur. Con la solicitud que esta haciendo es para infraestructura en la mejora de su techo ya que esta en mal estado así como también repellar las paredes de su casa. El sueño de Mario es poder terminar de construir su vivienda y así tener mejores condiciones que aun no las ha logrado, y con la facilidad de la solicitud de préstamo espera salir adelante para continuar con sus proyectos así como preparar a sus hijos con los estudios.

loans.use: To replace the roof on his house and to put plaster on the walls of his house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y tiene 47 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa, y tiene dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad,  que están cursando la primaria. Don Víctor tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación y tiene dos años de experiencia en ventas, inició con fondos propios y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante. La solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo para la pulpería, la va a surtir con productos de belleza, para así ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Espera tener la capacidad para seguir prestando y así invertir en su negocio, para poder fortalecerlo y hacerlo más próspero.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the region of Laureles Sur. He is married and is 47 years old. His wife is a homemaker and they have two children aged 3 and 5 years old and they are in primary school. Victor runs a grocery store from his house and he has two years experience in sales. He started out with his own capital and with a great deal of hard work he has seen success.

He is requesting this loan so that he can invest the capital in his grocery store. He wants to stock the shelves with beauty products, just to offer more variety to his clients. He forsees his capacity to keep managing his loans and thereby continue investing in his business, to better stabilize it and to improve it.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products to stock his grocery store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is 40-years-old and lives in the Sabana Grande region in the city of Managua. She is a single mother of two children, who are 12 and 16, whom she fights for every day to be able to take good care of them and above all to give them an education so they can be worthy people in society. Rosa Maria has sold used clothing and phone cards for 18 years. She started this business with her own funds and much effort. This loan will go towards purchasing a package of assorted clothing, since the price of it increased she doesn't have enough capital to acquire it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Rosa Maria tiene 40 años de edad, habita en la comarca Sabana Grande de la ciudad de Managua, es madre soltera de dos niños de 12 y 16 años de edad, por los cuales lucha diariamente para poderlos sacarlos adelante y sobre todo para darles estudios, para que sean personas de bien para la sociedad. Rosa Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tarjetas telefónicas desde hace 18 años y empezó este negocio con fondos propios y con mucho esfuerzo. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una paca de ropa variada, ya el precio de ésta subió y no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder adquirir este producto.

loans.use: Purchase of a package of clothing

loans.name: Rebeca Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Rebeca habita en la colonia Unidad de Propósito, en donde habita con su madre y con su hermano, tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y vende variedad de mercadería como ropa, zapatos cosméticos, tiene seis años de estar en las ventas. La solicitud de préstamos es para invertir en los productos, va a adquirir ropa de niñas y niños para así mantener la variedad que siempre ha ofrecido. Su meta en estos momentos es seguir apoyando a su madre y a su hermano en la manutención del hogar, ya que ella es la única que trabaja. Y para su negocio espera poder mantener las ventas como hasta ahora, y en un futuro experimentar crecimiento para así poder llegar a tener un local formal donde hacer sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rebeca lives in the Unidad de Propósito neighborhood with her mother and her brother. She is 34 years old and is single. She has been selling a variety of products such as clothing, shoes and cosmetics for the past six years.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise, such as children's clothing so that she can maintain the variety she has always offered. Her goal at this time is to continue to financially support her mother and her brother, she is the only one that works in the household. She also hopes to maintain the level of sales she has had up to know and to continue to grow so that in the future she can have an actual store to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

texts.es: Doña Jamileth tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, con una niña de 6 seis años de edad, su esposo trabaja  como bodeguero en una librería, la Sra. Jamileth se levanta temprano para hacer el desayuno a su esposo y los quehaceres del hogar ya que por la tarde sale a ofrecer sus productos a distintas oficinas, su actividad es la venta de cosmético al contado y al crédito, ella trabaja con pedido ya que estos productos vienen en catálogos pero siempre tiene para ofertar a sus clientes. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir  mercadería para la captación de clientes así como hacer más grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Jamileth is 29 years old, she is married and has a 6 year old daughter. Her husband works as a warehouseman in a bookstore. Jamileth wakes up very early to make breakfast for her husband and to do housework. In the afternoon she goes out to sell her products to the offices in the area. She sells cosmetics. She usually takes orders since she has to order the products via catalog. She accepts payments in cash or in installments. Jamileth also likes to keep a stock of products to offer to her clients.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to expand her business.


Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita A. V. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi . Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

She is a secretary, homemaker and single mother. She lives at home with her mother and daughter . They are three women looking for a way to make it, and facing adversities together. Margarita is requesting this loan to waterproof and paint her house, since because of so much rain it has deteriorated. She is looking for a way to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita A. V. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi . Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances. Ella es secretaria, ama de casa y madre soltera, vive en casa con su mama y su hija; son tres mujeres que buscan la manera de salir adelante y enfrentando las adversidades, Margarita esta solicitando este prestamo para poder impermeabilizar y pintar su casa ya que a causa de tanta lluvia se ha ido deteriorando,ella "esta buscando la manera de tener un mejor estilo de vida".

loans.use: waterproofing and painting her house (IMPERMEABILIZAR SU CASA Y PINTURA)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar es casado y tiene tres hijas de edad escolar y el señor se dedica a la venta de barbacoa ambulante, el esta solicitando este prestamo para comprarle los utiles escolares a sus hijas, para ofrecerles a sus hijas una mejor educacion y por lo tanto un mejor futuro.
Cabe mencionar que en la foto no aparece el Sr Julio Cesar ya que el dia que se tomo eran las 8:00 de la mañana y el se encontraba en la calle con la venta de su barbacoa, asi es que solo se pudo localizar a su esposa y sus hijas.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is married and has three daughters that are students. He works selling "barbacoa" (slow cooked meat with spices). He requests a loan to buy school supplies for his daughters, so that they have a better education and therefore a better future. It's important to mention that Julio Cesar does not appear in the picture because the day it was taken, around 8:00 a.m., he was out working and selling barbacoa, thus only his wife and daughters are in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies for his daughters

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Elia has been making earrings and necklaces by hand for 4 years. She used to work making earrings for someone else, but then she decided to become independent. She now sells her products wholesale, to be exported to neighboring countries. Elia has personnel that helps her in her small shop.

The loans she has received have been used to invest in materials she needs to create the earrings and necklaces.

Elia would like to move her shop to a different area, because the competition is very high in the area she works now.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Elia hace aretes y collares a mano desde hace 4 años. Antes trabajaba haciendo aretes para otra persona, sin embargo, luego decidió independizarse. Ahora ella vende por mayor sus productos que son exportados a países vecinos. Elia tiene personal que le ayuda en su pequeño taller.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para invertir en los materiales que necesita en la fabricación de los aretes y collares.

A Elia le gustaría mudar su taller a otra zona, ya que donde ella está ahora hay mucha competencia.

loans.use: to invest in materials she needs to create the earrings and necklaces  (Para invertir en los materiales que necesita en la fabricación de los aretes y collares.)

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
For 2 months, Delia has been working in her home creating ceramics in plaster and clay. She is only in charge of making the mold, then she gives it to her employer for finishing.

Before this, Delia used to sell sandwiches outside of her house. However, since she had to take care of her baby, she has had to stop this activity. This is why she was encouraged to make ceramics, because she knew this trade well. Nonetheless, Delia will only spend some more time making ceramics, since she would like to start selling sandwiches outside of her home again.

The loans she has received have been used to buy the sandwich cart she used to sell sandwiches.

Delia would like to buy a plot of land to build her house and set up a store.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 2 meses, Delia trabaja en su casa elaborando cerámicas en arcilla y yeso. Ella solo se encarga de hacer el molde, luego lo entrega a su empleador para su posterior acabado.

Antes, Delia vendía sanguches afuera de su casa, sin embargo, por tener que cuidar a su bebe, ha tenido que dejar esta actividad. Fue así que se animó a elaborar las cerámicas, ya que ella sabía este oficio. No obstante, Delia solo va a dedicarse un tiempo más a la producción de cerámicas, puesto que desea volver a vender sanguches afuera de su casa.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para comprarse el carrito sanguchero que utilizaba para vender sus sanguches.

A Delia le gustaría comprarse un terreno para construir su casa y poner una tienda.

loans.use: buy the sandwich cart she used to sell sandwiches  (Para comprarse el carrito sanguchero que utilizaba para vender sus sanguches.)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Open small mobile restaurant for school children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more products for their store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  clothes, loincloths and other products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy  clothes, cloth, and other products for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more yam, rice and bean  to make food in her home restaurant

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica tends a newspaper stand that is on the corner of her house for 20 years now.

In addition, Angelica has divided her house into small commercial spaces to be able to rent them out. She has also built several rooms in her second floor, which she rents out. She has been working in this way for 20 years.

The loans she has received have been used to maintain the rooms she rents out.

Angelica would like to build a mini-apartment in her home to be able to rent it out and help her son in his business of motorcycle spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Angélica atiende un quiosco de periódicos que está en la esquina de su casa desde hace 20 años.

Asimismo, Angélica ha dividido su casa en pequeños locales para poder alquilarlos. También ha construido vaR. cuartos en su segundo piso, los cuales son rentados. Ya tiene 20 años trabajando de esta manera.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para el mantenimiento de los cuartos que alquila.

Angélica quisiera construir un minidepartamento en su casa para poder alquilarlo, y ayudar a su hijo en su negocio de venta de repuestos motociclísticos.

loans.use: to maintain the rooms she rents out  (Para el mantenimiento de los cuartos que alquila.)

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda has been selling food in her cart for 9 years. Every night, starting at 7:30 p.m. until 11:30 p.m. she goes out to sell soups and meals outside of a mall.

The loans she has received have been invested in buying ingredients necessary to prepare the food she sells.

Bernarda and some friends would like to buy a commercial space to make a mini-market and offer their products. In addition, Bernarda would like to have a restaurant in a profitable area.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Bernarda vende comida en su carreta desde hace 9 años. Todas las noches, desde las 7.30 p.m. hasta las 11.30 p.m ella sale a vender sopas y comida afuera de un centro comercial.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en la compra de ingredientes que necesita para preparar la comida que vende.

Bernarda y unos amigos quisieran comprarse un local para hacer un mini-mercado y ofrecer sus productos. Asimismo, a Bernarda le gustaría tener un restaurante en una zona rentable.

loans.use: buying ingredients necessary to prepare the food she offers  (Para la compra de ingredientes que necesita en la preparacion de la comida que ofrece.)

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernadina has had a general store in her home for 7 years. She used to have internet booths, however, she was a victim of a robbery and had to start from zero, so she decided to set up a general store. She offers all sorts of basic need products. She also offers phone call services.

The loans received so far have been invested in stocking the products required by her store.

Bernadina would like to buy new display cabinets because the ones she has are very old.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Bernardina tiene una bodega en su casa desde hace 7 años. Antes ella tenía cabinas de Internet, sin embargo, fue víctima de un robo, por lo que tuvo que empezar de cero y decidió tener una bodega. Ella ofrece toda clase de productos de primera necesidad. También presta servicios de llamadas telefónicas.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en el stock de productos que su tienda requiere.

A Bernardina le gustaría poder adquirir vitrinas nuevas, ya que las que tiene son muy antiguas.

loans.use: stocking the products required by her store  (Para el stock de productos que su tienda requiere.)

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder has a printing press in her home for 14 years now. He used to sell paper and printing supplies. He has also worked with metals, and so he felt encouraged to set up his own printing press. Wilder has a workshop in his house made up of small machines. In addition, he has the support of two people who work with him when he has many orders.

The loans he has requested have been invested as capital to buy the materials and supplies necessary to do his printing jobs.

Wilder would like to buy a new printing machine because the one he has is obsolete.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Wilder tiene una imprenta en su casa desde hace 14 años. Él antes vendía papel e insumos de imprenta. También ha trabajado haciendo trabajos con metales, por lo que luego se animó a poner su propia imprenta. Wilder tiene un taller en su casa implementado con pequeñas máquinas. Asimismo, cuenta con el apoyo de dos personas que trabajan con él cuando tiene bastantes pedidos.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha invertido como capital para invertir en los materiales e insumos que necesita para hacer sus trabajos de imprenta.

Wilder quisiera comprarse una máquina nueva de imprenta porque la que tiene es muy obsoleta.

loans.use: buy the materials and supplies necessary to do his printing jobs (Para invertir en los materiales e insumos que necesita para hacer sus trabajos de imprenta.)

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes has been renting out her house as a commercial space for 13 years. She has offered her garage as a space where diverse merchants sell their products to the public of the area. Mercedes was encouraged by these merchants to rent out her garage because her house is strategically located on an avenue. About 15 people pay her rent for the space in her garage.

The loans she has received have been used to improve her house's infrastructure.

Mercedes would like to fix the roof of the garage she rents out to merchants.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes alquila su casa como local de ventas desde hace 13 años. Ella ha brindado su cochera como espacio donde diversos comerciantes venden sus productos al público de la zona. Mercedes fue animada por estos comerciantes a rentar su cochera, puesto que su casa esta ubicada estratégicamente en una avenida. Son alrededor de 15 personas quienes le pagan por la renta de un espacio en su cochera.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.

A Mercedes le gustaría poder arreglar el techo de la cochera donde los comerciantes venden.

loans.use: improve her house's infrastructure (Para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.)

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
For two years now, Roxana has had a restaurant in her house where she offers breakfasts and meals. She opens at 8a.m. and closes at 5 p.m. She also sells beer and sodas.

In the beginning, Roxana opened her restaurant in a rented space, however, for health reasons, she decided to move her restaurant to her home.

In addition, her mother has a small farm where she grows fruits, so Roxana also works distributing fruits wholesale to nearby merchants.

On top of that, Roxana has started selling cosmetics through catalogues two months ago.

The loans she has requested have been invested in furnishing her restaurant and helping her mother to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed to grow fruit.

Roxana would like to expand her restaurant and open a poultry store.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 2 años, Roxana tiene un restaurante en su casa donde ofrece desayunos y menú. Ella abre a las 8 de la mañana y cierra a las 5 de la tarde. También vende cervezas y gaseosas.

En un principio, Roxana abrió su restaurante en un local alquilado, sin embargo por motivos de salud decidió mudar el restaurante a su casa.

Asimismo, su mamá tiene una chacra donde cultiva frutas. Es así que Roxana también reparte las frutas al por mayor a los mercados aledaños.

Por si fuera poco, Roxana ha empezado a vender cosméticos por catálogo desde hace dos meses.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha invertido para amoblar su restaurante y para ayudar a su mamá en la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas que necesita para el cultivo de la fruta.

Roxana quisiera ampliar su restaurante y poner una pollería.

loans.use: furnishing her restaurant and helping her mother to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed to grow fruit (Para amoblar su restaurante y para ayudar a su mamá en la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas que necesita para el cultivo de la fruta.)

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
For 5 years now, Blanca has had a home daycare in her house. She has taken care of up to 7 children, although right now she only has 3.

Blanca greets the children in her home at 7:30 a.m. She takes care of them at night many times, since their parents have night obligations. In addition, for 17 years Blanca has rented out the second and third floors of her house.

The loans she has requested have been invested in buying a DVD player so the children can be entertained.

Blanca has plans to stop caring for children because of her delicate health. However, she would like to finish building the fourth floor of her house to be able to rent it out.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 5 años, Blanca se dedica al cuidado de niños en su casa. Ella ha llegado a cuidar hasta 7 niños, sin embargo en la actualidad solo tiene a 3.

Blanca recibe a los niños en su casa a las 7.30 de la mañana. Muchas veces ha tenido que cuidarlos en la noche, puesto que algunos papás tiene compromisos nocturnos. Asimismo, Blanca alquila el segundo y tercer piso de su casa desde hace 17 años.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en comprarse un DVD para que así los niños puedan entretenerse.

Blanca tiene en sus planes dejar de cuidar niños, ya que se encuentra delicada de salud. Por el contrario, desea terminar de construir el cuarto piso de su casa y así poder alquilarlo.

loans.use: buying a DVD player so the children to entertain the children (Para comprarse un DVD y así los niños puedan entretenerse.)

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario has rented some commercial space close to her house where she has installed calling booths. She also offers photocopying services, phone installations and sells candy she prepares herself. Rosario has two employees that help her tend to their customers.

In addition, every night, Rosario takes out her sandwich cart and sells food outside of her call shop. She used to sell outside of her home, but when she started her shop she moved it there.

The loans she has received have been used to buy display cabinets and to buy new merchandise, since Rosario very soon will start offering office supplies.

Rosario would like to have a restaurant in front of the space she is renting.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Rosario ha alquilado un local cerca de su casa donde ha instalado locutorios. También, ella ofrece servicios de fotocopias, instalación de locutorios y vende dulces que ella mismo prepara. Rosario cuenta con dos empleados que le ayudan en la atención al público.

Asimismo, Rosario todas las noches saca su carrito sanguchero y vende comida afuera de su local. Ella antes vendía en la puerta de su casa, sin embargo, al tener su locutorio, decidió mudarse para allá.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para comprarse vitrinas exhibidoras y para adquirir nueva mercadería, puesto que en unos días Rosario también va a ofrecer artículos de librería.

Rosario quisiera tener un restaurante al frente del local que tiene alquilado.

loans.use: buy display cabinets and to buy new merchandise (Para comprarse vitrinas exhibidoras y adquirir nueva mercadería para su necogio.)

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina is a member of the Kusikuy communal bank. She is 59 years old, married, and has 3 children. Delfina lives in the traditional neighborhood of Calvario, close to the church with the same name. She has a store where she sells groceries, red meat, chicken, vegetables, and drinks. The store is open from 6:00am until 9:00pm, and her children help her at the store because Delfina is in delicate health.

Delfina needs a loan of 2,100 soles ($725) to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles. She dreams of having a better-stocked store, and that all of her children have their own homes and financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy. Delfina es casada, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos, Delfina vive en el barrio tradicional Calvario, cerca D. la iglesia con el mismo nombre, Delfina tiene una tienda en donD. venD. abarrotes, carne, pollo, verduras, bebidas, actividad que realiza D. lunes a domingo desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos, Delfina esta algo delicada D. salud.

Delfina necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos. Delfina sueña con tener una tienda más surtida, que todos sus hijos tengan casa propia y estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Amelia es casada, tiene 41 años y 3 hijos, Amelia vende helados típicos de la región llamado Muyuchi que significa Da Vueltas en quechua, Amelia prepara los helados actividad que aprendió de su abuela, el helado se prepara con leche, ajonjolí, coco rayado, azúcar que se prepara en una olla de acero llamada heladera que se pone al medio de una batea de madera con hielo y se da vueltas constantes (de ahí surge el nombre) hasta que endurezca. Actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Amelia necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, vasos, ajonjolí y hielo. Los sueños de Amelia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the Communal Bank Senor de Luren. She is 41 years old, and married with 3 children. Amelia sells a kind of ice cream called Muyuchi, which means "Two Turns" in the native language of Quechua. She learned how to make this ice cream, which is typical to the region, from her grandmother. It's prepared with milk, grated cocoa, sugar and other special ingredients, which are put into a kind of stainless steel kettle and stirred constantly in a trough of wood and ice until it begins to solidify. She runs her business every weekend in the main plaza of Ayacucho.

Amelia needs the loan to purchase sugar, glasses, ice and other ingredients to prepare and sell her ice cream. Her dream is to continue to grow her business, and to be able to see her children become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Amelia will use the loan to purchase sugar and other ingredients, as well as glasses, for her ice cream business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia is a member of the Ayllu communal bank, which means “Family” in Quechua. She is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. Sonia sells fruit as a street vendor on the main street in her neighborhood, which she does from 8:00am until 2:00pm. She buys the fruit from the supply market in the city three times a week, and on Saturdays Sonia sells fish from the same stall. In addition, Sonia sells different products that are in high demand during the holidays, such as panetones, bread baked with fruit pieces, at Christmas.

Sonia needs a loan of 1,050 soles ($375) to buy apples, oranges, and chirimoyas (a tropical fruit). She dreams of educating her children, building a house and buying a car so her husband can work.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en quechua. Sonia es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Sonia vende frutas de manera ambulatoria en una avenida principal de su distrito, actividad que realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, sus compras lo realiza en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad a donde concurre 3 veces por semana, los días sábados Sonia vende pescados en el mismo puesto. Además Sonia en épocas de fiestas vende diferentes productos de mayor demanda como panetones en navidad.

Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de manzanas, naranjas, chirimoya. Sonia sueña con educar a sus hijos, construir su casa, comprar un carro para que pueda trabajar su esposo.

loans.use: Buy apples, oranges and chirimoyas

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha is a member of the Ayllu communal bank, which means “Family” in Quechua. She is 32 years old and separated, and has 3 children. Martha lives in the Carmen Alto district and is the only person who takes care of her children. Martha travels to the Sachabamba market once a week and stays for two days, where she sells various articles of clothing. At the market she buys cheese and young animals, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. She sells the animals live and sells the cheese door to door.

Martha needs a loan of 1,050 soles ($375), which will be used to buy track suits, sweaters and aprons. Martha’s dreams are to get ahead with her children, have a secure job, and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en quechua. Martha es separada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Martha vive en el distrito de Carmen Alto, siendo ella la única persona que mantiene a sus hijos, Martha viaja a la feria de Sachabamba 1 vez por semana y se queda 2 días, Martha vende ropa variada y de la feria compra quesos, animales menores, que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho, los animales lo vende vivo mientras que los quesos vende de casa en casa.

Martha necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de buzos, chompas y mandiles. Los sueños de Martha son salir adelante con sus hijos, tener un trabajo seguro y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy track suits, sweaters and aprons

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is a member of the Ayllu communal bank, which means “Family” in Quechua. Marina is 44 years old and separated, and has 6 children. She travels to the Ayacuchan jungle every Friday to sell chickens that she buys from farms to people who want to raise them, and when she’s in the jungle she buys fruit and coca leaves. She sells the fruit at the supply market in the city of Ayacucho, and sells the coca leaves in different markets in the region (where the tradition is to chew the leaves for energy).

Marina needs a loan of 1,050 soles ($375), which will be used to buy chickens and coca leaves. Marina dreams of getting ahead with her children and that one day they will be professionals. She would like to have her own capital and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en quechua. Marina es separada, tiene 44 años y 6 hijos, Marina viaja a la selva ayacuchana, sus viajes son los días viernes, vende pollos para criar que compra de las granjas, y de la selva compra frutas y hoja de coca, la fruta lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, mientras que la hoja de coca lo vende en las diferentes ferias de la región (donde existe la tradición de masticar la hoja para energizarse).

Marina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollos y hoja de coca. Marina sueña con salir adelante con sus hijos y que sean profesionales, tener capital propio, mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy chickens and coca leaves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is a member of the Communal Bank of Ayllu, which means "family" in quechua.

Marina is married, is 47 years old and has six children. She owns a small shop in her home, located in the San Juan Bautista area, from which she sells groceries and drinks. In addition, Marina is dedicated to farming potatoes on her land in Alpachaca, located three hours from the city of Ayacucho. She sells the potatoes in the supply market in Ayacucho and uses a small portion of the potatoes to make dried potatoes for which she counts on the help of her children.

Marina needs a loan of 1,500 soles which will be invested in the purchase of cookies, sodas, beer and fruit. Her dreams are to educate her children so that they can get ahead, grow her business and own other businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en quechua.

Marina es casada, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Marina tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa ubicada en el distrito de San Juan Bautista, en donde vende abarrotes, bebidas. Además Marina se dedica a la agricultura de papa en sus tierras de Alpachaca que se ubica a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la papa lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y parte de la papa pequeña hace papa seca, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos.

Marina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, gaseosas, cerveza y frutas. Marina sueña con educar a sus hijos para que salgan adelante, ampliar su negocio y tener otros negocios más.

loans.use: Marina needs a loan of 1,500 soles which will be invested in the purchase of cookies, sodas, beer and fruit.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Eufemia is a member of the Communal Bank of Ayllu which means "family" in quechua.

Eufemia is married, is 48 years old and has four children. She owns a shop in a rented space located on a main street in her area. She also lives in this same building, from which she sells groceries, fruits, vegetables and meats. Eufemia, alongsiD. her husband, owns a shop selling . Currently her husband runs that business with the support of their daughter.

Eufemia needs a loan of 1,500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, oil and milk. Eufemia's dreams are that her daughter becomes a professional, that her business improves and to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Eufemia es socia del Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en quechua.

Eufemia es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Eufemia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida principal D. su distrito, y también vive en esta misma vivienda, en donD. venD. abarrotes, frutas, verduras, carnes. Eufemia junto a su esposo tienen una tienda D. venta D. lubricantes y actualmente su esposo es quien administra este negocio, actividad que realizan con el apoyo D. su hija.

Eufemia necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche. Los sueños D. Eufemia son que su hija sea profesional, que su negocio mejore, construir su casa.

loans.use: Eufemia needs a loan of 1,500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, oil and milk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Daria

texts.es:
Daria is a member of the Communal Bank of Ccatarisum, which means "let's rise" in quechua.

Daria lives with her partner, is 27 years old and has one child. She lives with her in-laws. When she was single, she sold breakfasts on foot. Currently, she sells breads from a small stall in the Mariscal Caceres Market. She purchases the bread for wholesale prices from a bakery and then resells them from her stall from 5:30AM until Noon. Her husband works as a taxi driver with a rented car in the city of Ayacucho.

Daria needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of a glass case so that she can display her bread better. Daria's dream is to start a restaurant, build a house and provide the best to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Daria es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.

Daria es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Daria vive en la casa de sus suegros, Daria cuando era soltera vendía desayunos de manera ambulatoria y actualmente vende panes en un puesto pequeño del Mercado Mariscal Cáceres, los panes los compra de un horno al por mayor y luego lo revende en su puesto desde las 5 y media de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía. Su esposo trabaja con un carro alquilado realizando servicio de taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Daria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una vitrina para exhibir mejor sus panes. Daria sueña con implementar un restaurante, construir una casa y brindarle todo lo mejor a su hijo.

loans.use: Daria needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of a glass case so that she can display her bread better.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is a member of the Communal Bank of Ccatarisum, which means "let's rise" in quechua.

Elena is married and is 73 years old. She sells food from a market stall in the Magdalena market. Her stall is located on a corner. She prepares breakfasts and lunches for which she has two helpers. She also provides pension services to some people, an activity that she undertakes Sunday to Friday. In addition, Magdalena rents out her home from which she earns a monthly income. Moreover, Magdalena purchases defective items from people who bring them to her house and, after collecting, she sells them to wholesalers.

Elena needs a loan of 1,500 soles which she will invest in the purchase of defects. Elena dreams of starting a new business selling lubricants and that her children have everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.

Elena es casada, tiene 73 años, Elena venD. comida en una puesto del mercado Magdalena, su puesto esta ubicado en una esquina, Elena prepara, desayunos, almuerzos para lo cual cuenta con 2 ayudantes, también da servicio D. pensión a algunas personas, actividad que realiza D. domingo a viernes. Además Magdalena alquila su casa del cual tiene también una renta mensual. También Magdalena compra tara en su casa D. personas que le traen y luego D. acopiar lo venD. a los mayoristas.

Elena necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tara. Elena sueña con implementar un nuevo negocio D. venta D. lubricantes y que sus hijos tengan todas las comodidades.

loans.use: Elena needs a loan of 1,500 soles which she will invest in the purchase of defective items.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Elizabeth Elisa

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank of Kusikeu, which means "be happy" in quechua.

Elizabeth lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has three children. She owns a restaurant located in her mother-in-law's house where she sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner and also sells sandwiches, drinks, and desserts. Both her mother and a cook help her. Additionally, Elizabeth sells catalog cosmetics from different brands. She offers them to her friends and family on credit.

Elizabeth needs a loan of 1,500 soles which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, sandwiches, and sodas. Elizabeth's dreams are to grow her business, to own other businesses, provide a good education to her children and to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua.

Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Elizabeth tiene un restaurante en la casa de su suegra en donde vende desayuno, almuerzo, cena, además vende golosinas, bebidas, postres, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá, y también de una cocinera. Además Elizabeth vende cosméticos por catálogos de diferentes líneas que ofrece a amigos, familiares y sus ventas son al crédito.

Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, golosinas, gaseosas. Elizabeth sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener otros negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Elizabeth needs a loan of 1,500 soles which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, sandwiches, and sodas.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a member of the communal bank Kusikuy, which means “Be Happy” in Quechua. Nancy is a single mother, 48 years old, and has two children who are now adults, whom she educated by herself. She makes traditional breads from the region such as chapla, a round bread with a hollow center, and wawa (which means “baby” in Quechua), an infant-shaped bread. She makes her breads in a rented oven and she sells them at a stall in the central market in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Nancy travels to the market in Vinchos on Sundays where she sells assorted groceries as well as bread.

Nancy needs a loan of 1,000 soles ($425), which she will use to purchase sugar, rice and flour. Nancy’s dream is to grow her business, have her own capital, and that her children become financially stable.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua. Nancy es madre soltera, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos ya mayores a quienes educo sola, ella elabora panes típicos de la región como la chapla, Wawa, que elabora en horno alquilado, sus ventas lo realiza en un puesto del mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Nancy los días domingos viaja a la feria del distrito de Vinchos en donde vende abarrotes surtidos y también panes.

Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz y harina. Los sueños de Nancy es que su negocio crezca, tener capital propio y que sus hijos tengan estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice and flour

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao S., 22 years old, is a young man earning around US$1.50 per day raising pigs to sell. He lives in Dan Run Commune in the Siem Reap Province. He lives with his mother, who is a rice farmer. Now Sao lacks money to purchase pig food to fatten his pigs to sell in time to take advantage of the existing high price market. Hence, he would like to request a loan of US$100 to purchase pig food. He hopes the loan will allow him to improve his business, and he thanks Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig food

loans.name: Kimmuy

texts.en:
Mr. Kimmuy L., 24 years old, is an electronics repair person, while his wife, Mrs. Phlak Hanyi, raises pigs. Kimmuy provides repair services in his village, including radio and television repair, and earns around US$ 4.65 per day. His wife earns approximately US$ 3 per day. Kimmuy and his wife do not have children and live in Khna Sanday Commune in the Siem Reap Province.

Because of his growing repair business, Kimmuy lacks materials for making repairs and he also faces the obstacle of lacking money to purchase more material. Hence, he decided to request a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase electronic materials for his repair service. He plans to use any remainder of the loan to purchase more piglets to raise for his wife's business. The loan will allow him to improve their living conditions and cover daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase electronics materials for his repair service

loans.name: Chhoeub

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoeub C., 23 years old, makes charcoal to sell in his area. He has been running his business since 2005 and earns around US$ 4.30 per day. Chhoeun sells the charcoal to his customers and other retailers. He is married but has no children; he and his wife live in Chubkarav Commune in the Siem Reap Province.

To increase the family's income, Chhoeub wants to sell his charcoal by transporting it to customers' homes and needs oxen with a cart for transportation, but he faces the obstacle of lacking money to purchase oxen and a cart. Hence, Chhoeub would like to request a loan to achieve his plan. Chhoeub is in the picture, standing near his charcoal kiln.

loans.use: Purchase oxen and a cart

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is a widow of A. S. and lives in a small city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. Jamila baji completed her education until the 8th standard. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son drives a tractor, but he also has his own tea stall. The next eldest son also drives a tractor. Her eldest daughter knits warm clothes. Her younger daughter is in the 9th standard. Jamila baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her previous four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy supplies (kettle, cups, tea, and milk, sugar) to expand her son's tea business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy supplies and equipment for tea stall, supplies for grocery store, sewing machine, and clothes to resell

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is a wife of Abdul H. and lives in a small city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 30 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her elder son works in a gas station. The next eldest to him works in a factory. Her daughter makes decorative embroided dresses. Her younger son is in kindergarten. Her husband has a livestock business. He buys goats from different areas and sells them in a big market. Her husband has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Sugran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more goats to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy rugs and carpets to resell. Suraiya baji and Noor Jahan baji each want a loan to buy clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy livestock to resell

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living there for 20 years. She has five children: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a tailor by profession. The next two sons work in a factory. Her youngest son is in the 5th standard. Her daughter is in the 3rd standard. Parveen baji's husband works in a gas station. Parveen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine for her eldest son.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Akhtari baji and Rukhsana baji each want a loan to buy bricks from wholesaler to resell. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Safia baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, clothes, sketches) to make decorative embroidered dresses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ruqaiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is the wife of M. Amin and lives in a small city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for 25 years. She has seven children: two sons and five daughters. Her eldest son sews clothes. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband has raised buffalo and sold their milk for the last 5 years. Ruqaiya baji is a housewife and prefers doing household work and taking care of her family. She successfully repaid her previous four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (switches, switch boards, tubes) for her electrical shop. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy a wood-cutting machine. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy material (kettle, milk, tea, and cups) for her tea stall. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy another buffalo to increase milk production and sales

loans.name: Sugran M. Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of M. Sarwar and lives in a small city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She has been living there for the last 25 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her husband and her sons run a dairy business. Sugran baji has a livestock business with buffaloes and goats. Her husband gets milk from the cattle and her sons sell the milk in several shops. Sugran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand the milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy bricks from the wholesaler to resell. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy wooden furniture to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy sugarcane syrup machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a buffalo to increase milk production and sales

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 22 and she is single. She has been a clothes seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ummi

texts.en:
Ummi is 29 years old. She is married with two children, aged four and one years old. Since 2007, Ummi has been selling charcoal and bread. She works from 8am to 9pm daily and earns a monthly profit from her sales of about $35.

Ummi is requesting a loan of $175 to buy additional charcoal to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional charcoal to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
J. Muyassar is 45 years old. She is married with four children. Muyassar is a very courageous woman who endured much so her four children could have a good education. The oldest children are working and can now earn their own living; the others go to school.

Muyassar is a small business owner from Isfara, Tajikistan. She sells women’s shoes at the large Central market in Isfara. Muyassar has been in this business for about 4 years. Her son (pictured here) helps Muyassar with the business. Because the holiday season is coming, she wants to buy more shoes at wholesale prices and sell them in her community. For this reason she requests a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600) for the term of 12 months to purchase a new supply of shoes to sell. This loan will help her continue to operate a successful business so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 42 years old. She is married with three children, aged fourteen, twelve and ten years old. Pili has been selling food since 2005. With her daily work, she earns about $90 a month in profit.

Pili is requesting a loan of $275 to buy more food items to increase expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
K. Furkat is 33 years old. He is married with two children. Furkat uses his car to provide taxi services. He has run this business the last three years. Furkat is trying to provide high-quality services, but at prices attractive to his customers. That is why he replaced the fuel supply system with one using gas as a fuel. However, now he is planning to change the old gas cylinder with the new one made of kapron because this is safer for him and his clients. Thus, Furkat is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable as he is the only bread-winner in his family. He works from early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones.

Furkat's business generates considerable income for his family. Furkat requests a loan of $700 to purchase the kapron gas-cylinder for the fuel supply system for his taxi. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing the kapron gas-cylinder for the fuel supply system for the taxi

loans.name: Odinakhon

texts.en:
Odinakhon S. is 55 years old. She is married with three children.

Odinakhon bakes the national bread which is called “lepeshka”. She is in this business for 10 years already. Her bakery is located in her house.

As a rule Odinakhon bakes about 120 “lepeshkas” per day and sells them the same day. The “lepeshka” of Odinakhon is very popular in her neighborhood, so that this stable business generates the main income for the family.

Now Odinakhon is planning to open another bakery, and she also needs to increase her working capital in order to purchase input materials like flour, salt, and charcoal for baking. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting 1200 US Dollars for a term of 3 months. Odinakhon plans to spend the generated income on improving the living conditions of the family. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Odinakhon would like to express her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing input materials and opening another bakery

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 32 years old. She is married with three children, aged sixteen, twelve, and two years old. Since 2007, Prisca has run a small general store. She works daily, earning a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Prisca is requesting a loan of $325 to increase the stock of her store and expand her business.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her store and expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hach

texts.en:
Mr. Hach R., 23 years old, makes charcoal to sell in his area. He has been running his business since 2005 and earns around US$4.66 per day. Hach sells the charcoal from his home area to his customers, including retailers and wholesalers. He is married to Mrs. Hon Sona, 20 years old. They have one child, who is too young to be in school yet. They live in Khnasanday Commune in the Siem Reap Province.

To increase the family's income Hach wants to sell his charcoal by transporting it to customers' homes. He needs oxen to use as transportation, but he faces the obstacle of lacking the money to purchase two oxen. Hence, Hach would like to request a loan to carry out his plan. Hach's wife is pictured because Hach was unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to transport products to customers

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda U. is 35 years old. She is married and has a son of school age. The difficult living conditions of the family forced her husband to leave for Russia to find a job. For 5 years she has had a small business drying and processing apricots.

Dried fruits, especially dried apricots are very popular in Tajikistan. Besides they are very useful for the health. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, the business of Mavjuda is quite successful and brings in the stable income for the family, allowing Mavjuda to contribute significantly to the household and education of her dearest son.

Today Mavjuda requests 1500 Somoni (450 USD) for a term of 8 months. She is going to spend the loan purchasing apricots with the purpose of drying and processing them in order increase the range of goods she has for sale. Mavjuda expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. Support this woman of much strength and courage so she can keep working!

loans.use: Purchasing apricots in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 33 years old. She is divorced with six children between the ages of seven months and fifteen years old. Since 2000, she has been selling fish and firewood. She works daily from 7am to 5pm and earns a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

In the past, Mwajuma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She is now requesting a loan of $275 to buy more fish and firewood to further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and firewood to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fuel to retail in her community

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a new assortment of clothing to add to her stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 22, 2008)
