loans.name: Muhammadsodik

texts.en:
Muhammadsodik Y. is 24 years old. He lives in Isfara town with his parents. Despite his young age, Muhammadsodik has already become the main bread-winner in his family. Muhammadsodik’s business is drying and processing apricots. He's been in this business for 6 years. His mom helps him too. 

Muhammadsodik offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. At the same time, he raises young cattle and sells them at the local market. All this allows Muhammadsodik to make his business quite successful and it brings in the stable income for the family. 

With money from this business, he paid for his university and graduated. Today Muhammadsodik is requesting 1500 Somoni (450 USD) for the term of 8 months. He is going to spend the loan purchasing half-dried apricots with the purpose of drying and processing them in order to increase the range of goods for selling. Earned money from his business he wants to use for his own wedding. Muhammadsodik expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing half-dried apricots for drying and processing

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo M. is 25 years old. She is married with three children. Since 2007, she has been engaged in bicycle spare parts sales. She has a stall in the local market. She sells spare parts of different types and for various bicycles.

As a result of the success of her business, Shahlo has improved the living conditions of her family and is doing all the best to meet all the needs of her dearest children. But she is not satisfied with the volume of sales and wants to increase her inventory, thus increasing the volume of her sales.

With this purpose in mind, today Shahlo is requesting 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for a term of 9 months. She is planning to spend the loan purchasing spare parts for bicycles thus increasing her range of goods. With your help this will be possible. Be an important part of the growth of Shahlo’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for bicycles for re-sale

loans.name: Alimardon

texts.en:
S. Alimardon is 49 years old. He is married and has three children. Alimardon has had a trying life, but he keeps an optimistic outlook. He remains a strong and persevering person, intent on improving his family’s standard of living. Alimardon sells petrol and diesel fuel near his house. Over the 7 years of selling fuel, he has gained enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him.

Now Alimardon’s children are adults and help their father with the business. (Alimardon's daughter is pictured here.) Alimardon is requesting a loan of $600 to increase the quantity of goods to sell to meet his clients' demand. He promises to return this amount in 6 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Alimardon’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchase more fuel to sell

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana Luz C. lives in the San Salvador department of Arce City with her husband and two children. She owns a mini market in which she sells assorted first need products. Ana has put a lot of work and effort in her small business, creating it out of nothing. Her business growth was propelled by Integral, from which Ana Luz has previously received small loans. Her determination to grow and improve was demonstrated when a couple of months ago, she was on the brink of closing the shop due to a viral infection that left her seriously ill and bed-ridden. With the help of her husband and her children’s support, the C. family bit the bullet. After much hard work and collaboration, they were able to face this tragedy. Despite the difficulty they experienced, they were never behind on their bills.

After overcoming this hardship, Ana Luz looks to the future with hope and faith. She is requesting a loan in order to strengthen her shop by purchasing goods to sell, thus regaining control of both her business and her life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Luz C. vive en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de San Salvador, junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Su negocio es una pequeña abarrotería, donde vende diversos productos básicos. Ana ha puesto mucho trabajo y empeño en su pequeño negocio, haciéndolo nacer de la nada. Esta germinación de su negocio fue impulsada por Integral, con quién Ana Luz ha realizado préstamos anteriores por montos bajos. Su determinación por crecer y mejorar se puso de manifiesto cuando hace un par de meses, estuvo a punto de cerrar la tienda, debido a una infección viral, por la que Ana estuvo grave de salud y tuvo que mantenerse en cama. Con la ayuda de su esposo y el apoyo de sus hijos, la familia C. hizo de tripas corazones, y con trabajo en conjunto hicieron frente a dicha tragedia. A pesar de la dificultad que sufrían, nunca se atrasaron con sus pagos.

Luego de haber superado una situación tan difícil, Ana Luz ve al futuro con esperanza y fe, y solicita un préstamo para fortalecer su tienda comprando insumos para la venta, y así recuperar el control de su negocio y su vida.

loans.use: Purchase goods

location.town: Col.san Carlos 2 poligono 34 numero 3 Ciudad Arce

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Apoyo Integral - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Lom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lom S., 56 years old, is a widowed farmer who alS. sells fish, earning US$2.26 per day. She lives with nine children, five of whom are married. Her 20-year-old son, Ravuy, is a motorcycle taxi driver, earning US$1.66 per day. Lom seeks a loan of US$300 to use for her son to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use instead of his old one. The loan will improve her business and increase her incomes to support her family’s living expenses adequately.

Mrs. Lom is group leader of three members listed as following:

1. Mrs. Seng P., 39, is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables to sell in the market. She requests a loan of US$300 to purchase fertilizer to use for her vegetable crop.

2. Mrs. Kun H., 43, is a farmer and sells vegetables. Kun seeks a loan of US$200 to buy fertilizer to use for her rice crop.

3. Mrs. Rech C., 28, is farmer who grows rice and vegetables to sell. She decided to request a loan of US$300 to purchase fertilizer to use for her growing rice.

They live in Kean Sangkei Commune, Sieam Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Khadija's Hatukati Tamaa. Group

texts.en:
Khadija is married with 3 children aged 14, 7, and 3 years old. She has been a juice and bites seller since 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Khadija is now requesting a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, juice sales, clothes, and firewood sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Shemsa's Charcoala And Firewood Sales Group

texts.en:
Shemsa is married with three children, aged seven, three, and one years old. Since 1999, she has been selling charcoal and firewood. She works daily from 6am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Shemsa is requesting a loan of $525 loan to buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have their own businesses selling tomatoes, vegetables, juice, and ice-cream.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nurat

texts.en: Nurat A. is a Tanzanian woman who runs a salon business in the Vituka area in Dar-es-Salaam. The salon is located near the Kariakoo shopping center, the largest market in Tanzania; most of Nurat's customers to the salon are women. The business is now four years old. Nurat's income from the salon helps her to take care her family and pays school fees for her two primary school children. Nurat is seeking a loan of 750 USD to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand a beauty salon

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Trading And Raising Livestock Group

texts.vi:
chị Nguyễn thị Lan Ms 09020024 năm nay 30 tuổi,chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con. chị là một phụ nữ rất năng động, hàng ngày chị đi chợ thu mua sắt vụn,ngoài ra chị lại chăn nuôi, làm ruộng, bán hàng tạp hoá tại nhà. Còn chồng chị là một nhân viên quản lý chợ, nên thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định từ 200.000 VND đến 250.000 VND / ngày. Chị cùng nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt. Lần này chị tiếp tục đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000 VND để thêm vốn bán hàng, đi chợ và chăn nuôi. Các thành viên trong nhóm của chị :

  • chị Ngô thị Sinh Ms 09020026 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua phụ tùng sửa chữa xe máy
  • chị Lê thị Khánh Ms 09020023 vay mức 2.912.000 VND để mua thóc làm bánh bán
  • chị Nguyễn thị Mận Ms 09020021 vay mức 4.704.000 VND để đi chợ bán hàng khô, mua cám lợn
  • chị D. thị Tú Ms 09020022 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua lợn giống, đi chợ
  • chị Ngô thi Y Ms 09020025 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ bán bánh đa, bán mỳ
texts.en:
Mrs. Lan thi Nguyen, 30 years old, lives with her husband and two children. She is a very proactive and hardworking woman; each day she goes to the market to trade scrap iron, and she also raise livestock, works the fields, and sells general goods out of her home. Her husband is a manager of the market, so the family's income is relatively stable at 200,000 VND to 250,000 VND per day. She and the group has participated in the Fund for a previous funding cycle and very good with making the repayments. In this round of funding she is continuing to request 4,256,000 VND to buy more goods to sell, trade at the market, and raise livestock. The participants in her group are:

  • Mrs. Sinh Thi Ngo, requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy repair equipment for motorscooters.
  • Mrs. Khanh Thi Le, requesting 2,912,000 VND to buy unpeeled rice to process and sell.
  • Mrs. Man Thi Nguyen, requesting 4,704,000 VND to do trading in dry goods and buy pig feed.
  • Mrs. Tu Thi Duong, requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy a breeding pig, and to do trading at the market.
  • Mrs. Y Thi Ngo, requesting 4,256,000 VND to do retail sales of sesame rice crackers and bread.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods and raise livestock

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana baji is the wife of S. A. and lives in Gujranwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 15 years. She has three children, and the two oldest are enrolled in a school in her neighborhood.

Rehana baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). With the first loan, she bought a sewing machine to stitch clothes and her husband started a furniture-making business. At that time, their monthly income was $118. Her husband saved almost $790 from his furniture-making business. He decided to invest this amount to become a partner in his uncle's lathe business. S. A. started earning almost $80 per month from the lathe business.

Rehana baji is a housewife and she continues sewing clothes because her children attend school, and she wants to give her children a better education and a good future. Therefore, she is applying for another loan to buy material (wood, glue, tools) to expand her husband's furniture-making business.

loans.use: Buy materials for furniture-making business

loans.name: Salama's Nia Moja Group

texts.en:
Salama is 33 years old and married. Since 2007, she has been selling charcoal, firewood, and bites (snacks) to make a living. She works daily from 7am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Salama has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to open a new business. Salama is now requesting a loan of $1500 to buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have their own businesses offering tailoring services, as well as selling charcoal, firewood, juice, clothing, shoes and handbags.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema M. is a married Tanzanian business woman. She runs a shop at which a large variety of items are sold. Much of her inventory consists of cereal crop products such as rice and regimes crop  as shown in the photo. She has four children, three of whom are currently in school. The income she receives from the shop is used to pay school fees for her children and meet her family's daily expenses. She requests a loan of 550 USD to purchase inventory for the shop and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for the store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hidaya's Nia Moja Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 38 years old. She is divorced with 2 children aged 19 and 11 years old. She has been a charcoal and soap seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $220 from her sales.

In the past,Hidaya has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Hidaya is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and soap to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with shop ownership, juice, and firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and soap to expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 25 years old and married with two children, aged seven and five years old. Since 2005, Rukia has been selling shoes and khanga (traditional East African cloth worn by women). She works daily from 5am to 4pm and earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Rukia is requesting a loan to buy more shoes and khanga cloth to sell and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and khanga for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rebecca Namyeso's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is a leader of a five-member group. She is a 51-year-old married woman with twelve children aged between seven and 30 years: nine of her children go to school, and the rest are working. She owns and resides in a three-room house in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, living with eight people where she constructed a poultry house. There is no electricity or water, and Rebecca also takes care of three orphans.

The family gets three meals a day. She sells chicken (broilers) to all kinds of people both wholesale and retail, selling to an average of 50 people per day. She buys her feed from Mengo-Kisenyi, a suburb of Kampalahome. Rebecca has been in this business for only six months; she first dealt in second-hand clothes but she found the job so tiresome, spending the whole day just walking looking for customers

Rebecca works seven days a week. Rebecca has been with MCDT for over seven years working with the same group who are now seeking their eighteenth loan. Her major challenges include theft, limited markets for chickens, infections like chicken pox and gumboro, and the increasing price of chicken feed. Rebecca is seeking this loan to provide water and electricity for her poultry farm. .

loans.use: To install water and electricity for poultry farm

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinoun L., 37, who has no children, has been selling vegetables since 2003 in Kok Snul Market, earning approximately $2.00 per day, while her husband, Mr. Chorm Cheun, 44, is a policeman. They live in Teuk Veul Commune in the Siem Reap Province. Sinoun is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase more vegetables to sell. The loan will both expand her business and increase the family's income. Sinoun leads a group of two other women:

1. Mrs. Tiep T., 39, lives in Teuk Veul Commune where she is a vegetable seller. In order to improve her business, she is requesting a loan of $100 to buy a bicycle for the transportation of vegetables.

2. Mrs. Touch P. , 18, lives with her husband in Teuk Veul Commune where she also sells vegetables. She too is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase a bicycle to transport vegetables to market, thereby increasing her family’s income. (The man in the picture is Touch's husband)

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Faridah's Bananas And Charcoal Group

texts.en:
Faridah is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 42 year old and married with 6 children, aged between 22 and 5 years old. Five of her children go to school and the first-born is already working. She owns and resides in a five-roomed house, living with ten people. There is electricity but no water. The family gets three meals a day.

Faridah resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Faridah works seven days a week and operates her business from her home. She deals in bananas and charcoal, selling to all categories of people both wholesale and retail.

Faridah sells to an average of 40 people per day. She buys bananas and charcoal from her home and doesn't incur any extra transport costs. Faridah has been in this business for the last ten years. She first dealt in bananas only but with subsequent loans from MCDT, she was able to supplement her income by investing in the charcoal business.

Faridah has been with MCDT for the last six years and is servicing her sixteenth loan, working all this time with her same group. Her major challenge is defaulters in the charcoal business. She wants to use this loan to invest in farm produce and supply it to various nearby schools. She aspires to constructing rental houses in the free space near her home.

loans.use: to  increase her inventory and also invest in farm produce

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Yoath's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoath O., 40, who both farms and raises pigs, earns around $1.00 per day while her husband, Mr. Clin Heuy, 46, works in construction. They live with their five children, all of whom are students. In order to improve the farming business, Yoath is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase more fertilizer for her rice crop. Yoath is the leader of a group with two other members:

1. Mrs. Thoeup S., 29, raises pigs. She is requesting a loan of $50 to purchase more fertilizer, thereby increasing her family’s income. 2. Mrs. Tha S. , a 31-year-old farmer, lives in Lvear Commune in the Siem Reap Province with her five-member family and is requesting a loan of $50 to purchase fertilizer. The loan will improve her farming business and increase her income to help support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru:
Файзуло один из преуспевающих  предпринимателей города Душанбе. Ему 48 лет, он женат.  Он продает конфеты, сахар, рис, мак в большом ассортименте, оптом и в розницу на рынке "Баракат" г. Душанбе уже 5 лет. Его товар поступает и Ирана, Турции и Китая. У него свои постоянные клиенты, которые закупают и продают в розничном виде. Также в ассортименте его товаров имеются мармелад и финики производства России и Ирана.
Услышав о программе Кива, Файзулло решил участвовать и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони  для расширения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Fayzullo J. is one of the successful entrepreneurs in Dushanbe city. He is 48 years old and married. He has been selling a large variety of candies, sugar, rice, and poppies, wholesale and retail, at the "Barakat" market in Dushanbe city for five years. He purchases his goods from Iran, Turkey, and China. He has regular retail clients who purchase his goods. Also, in his stock, he has jelly-candies and figs from Russia and Iran. Having heard about Kiva's programs, Fayzullo decided to participate and take out a loan of 4100 somoni to expand his commodity turnover.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand commodity turnover

loans.name: Nabiullo

texts.ru:
Нуридинов Набиулло молодой предприниматель лет 34, имеет четырех детей. Его деятельность – продажа мужской одежды и обуви на рынке «Панчшер». У него 7 лет опыта в этой деятельности. В его ассортименте большой выбор джинсовых, шерстяных  и шелковы брюк, для молодежи, футболки, а также сорочек и обуви. 
Он закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая и Турции, иногда в оптовом рынке «Корвон». Набиулло старается, чтоб его товары соответствовали сезону, и каждый сезон обновляет ассортимент продаваемых товаров.
В осенний сезон Набиулло хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа осенних брюк и сорочек.
texts.en:
At age 34, Nabiullo N. is a young entrepreneur and father of four children. He sells men's clothes and footwear at the "Panchsher" market, which he has been doing for the past seven years. In his supply of goods, he has a large assortment of denim, woolen and silk trousers for young people, as well as t-shirts, dress shirts, and shoes. He purchases his stock from Chinese and Turkish suppliers, sometimes from the wholesale market "Korvon." Nabiullo tries to have an in-season supply line, and each season he brings out a new assortment of goods. For the fall season, Nabiullo would like to take out a loan for 4100 somone to purchase fall trousers and shirts.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fall trousers and shirts

loans.name: Elizabeth Nassaka's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the leader of 5-member group. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children aged 7 and 9. Both her children go to school. She owns and resides in a four-roomed house, living with four people. There is both electricity and water. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. The family gets three meals a day.

Elizabeth sells charcoal to all categories of people, both wholesale and retail. She buys it from suppliers who get it from the villages and so she doesn't incur any extra transport cost. Elizabeth operates her business from her home and sells to an average of 10 customers per day.

Elizabeth has been in this business for the last four years. She first had a little restaurant business and then changed to charcoal selling. She has been with MCDT for the last seven years, having successfully paid back thirteen loans with the same group-mates.

Her main challenge is the competition and she is aiming to see her business grow bigger.

loans.use: To roof  and finish her house which she built from profits

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mwajuma's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 40 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of twelve and twenty-two years old. Since February of 2008, she has been in the business of selling firewood and bites (snacks). She works daily from 6am to 8pm and earns a monthly profit of about $185 from her sales.

Mwajuma is requesting a loan of $525 to expand her business by adding to her current stock of firewood and snacks. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have their own businesses selling bites and juice.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock of firewood and snacks.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sharifa's Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is 48 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of five and eighteen years old. She sells coconuts and vegetables to make a living. Sharifa works daily and earns a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Sharifa has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Sharifa now hopes for a loan of $625 to further expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have their own businesses selling milk, charcoal, juice, and bites (snacks).

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Nalubega Eseza`s Group

texts.en:
Eseza N. is the leader of a group of four women. She is 35, married and has three children aged 18, 17, and 15, all of whom are in school. She lives in a semi-urban slum in the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Eseza operates a salon in her town of Bwaise where she has rented space for four years. Eseza rides a matatu (shared van) into Kampala in order to get products for her business. She is open five days a week and primarily sells hair weaves; however, she especially enjoys doing braiding for her female customers.

Eseza is seeking this loan to increase the range of products she offers, specifically hair extensions. She has worked with MCDT for three years and has successfully paid back seven loans. She first decided to work with MCDT because she wanted to grow her business and be able to pay for her children's education. Since her first loan, she has been able to pay school fees and buy food for her family. Eseza hopes to build a house of her own one day, and to teach her children how to invest and save.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi .A. est un commerçant dynamique  âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il tient une boutique de prêt à porter au quartier commercial de Kpalimé une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo à 120 Km de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Kossi est un client fidèle de FECECAV et désire par ce troisième crédit renforcer son  fond de roulement permettant de renouveler à une fréquence régulière son stock. Avec cette chance de Kiva, il pourrait désormais faire face à une clientèle exigeante en tissus de marque, gagner plus d’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi A. is an energetic merchant, 32 years old, married, and the father of two children. He has a shop of ready-to-wear clothing in the commercial district of Kpalimé, a city located in the southwest of Togo and about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Kossi is a loyal client of FECECAV and would like to use this third loan to bolster his working capital. This would allow him to renew his inventory on a regular basis. With this Kiva opportunity, he would then be able to cope with his demanding customer base regarding name-brand fabrics. He would also be able to earn more money and to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Рахмонова Мавлюда родилась 1964 году. По некоторым обстоятельствам она развелась и осталась с тремя детьми. Трудно приходилось ей одной прокормить детей. Она решила заняться предпринимательской деятельностью, чтоб выйти из сложившейся ситуации. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской обуви. Вот уже 15 лет Мавлюда занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. Торгует женскими одеждами и обувью. Местом ее деятельности является торговый центр «Садбарг».  В ее ассортименте можно увидеть летние платья, блузки, юбки, а также разнообразные обуви для милых дам, как вечерние, так и повседневные. Она закупает товар у поставщиков из Турции и Китая 
Мавлюда  хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа осенних туфель.
texts.en:
Mavluda R. was born in 1964. Because of certain circumstances she got divorced and lives with three children. It was very difficult for her to feed all the children alone. She has decided to start her own business to help herself out of her desperate situation. She started a retail business selling children's shoes and it has been fifteen years since Mavluda has started her entrepreneurship. Now she is selling women's clothing and shoes. Her business location is in the Sadbarg trading center. In her inventory stock one can find summer dresses, blouses, skirts, and also a variety of shoes for the ladies such as dress shoes and casual. She buys merchandise from suppliers from Turkey and China. Mavluda wants to take out a loan in the amount of 4100 somoni ($1,200USD) to buy shoes for the fall season.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes

loans.name: Amelamedji

texts.fr: Amelamedji Mawussé est propriétaire et gérante d’un bar-restaurant à Kpalimé, une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo à 120 Km de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Agée de 33 ans, Mawussé est mariée et mère de deux enfants et a acquis une expérience très riche en art de cuisine et de service ce qu’elle pratique depuis une certaine période. Avec cette chance de Kiva et ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, elle désire faire davantage de stock de tubercules, de mais pour les plats de « fufu » et de la pâte, et aussi des boucs pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Elle apprécie cette opportunité qui lui permettra de participer plus à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager.
texts.en:
Amelamedji Mawussé is the proprietor and manager of a pub in Kpalimé, a town situated in the southwest of Togo, 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Mrs. Mawussé, 33, is married and the mother of two children. She has acquired a lot of varied experience in the art of cooking and serving meals which she has been working at for quite some time.

With the chance that Kiva offers and this third loan from FECECAV, she would like to stock more yams, maize to make "fufu", and also some goats to better satisfy the demand of her clientele. She appreciates this opportunity which will allow her to participate more fully in supporting her family through the profit she will earn.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing yams, sacks of maize, and goats

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Пулатова Мавлюда 1959 года рождения, замужем и у них 6 детей. У нее довольно большой опыт в сфере предпринимательской деятельности.  Начала свой бизнес в 1990 году с продажи материй. Мавлюда торгует разными видами поплин, на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. У нее много постоянных  клиентов. Часто покупают швеи и просто любители пошива женской одежды. Ведь ее товар является ходовым в летнее время. Свой товар Мавлюда закупает в оптовых рынках «Корвона». 
Для увеличения товарооборота и закупа сезонных тканей хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони.
texts.en:
Mavluda P. was born in 1959, is married and has six children. She has quiet an extensive experience in running own business. She started her business in 1990 selling fabrics. Mavluda sells different kinds of poplins at the Kovron market in the city of Dushanbe. She has many regular customers who are often seamstresses or who just love making women's clothing. Her merchandise is very popular during summer time. Mavluda buys the merchandise on the wholesale markets of Kovron. She wants to get a loan in the amount of 4100 somoni ($1,200USD) to increase commodity circulation and for buying seasonal fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Mary Najjuka's Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of this five-member group. She is a 50-year-old widow with four children aged between 26 and 16 years. Three of her children go to school and the eldest is working. She owns and resides in a three-roomed house, living with five people. There is no electricity, but it has piped water. Mary has another four rooms for renting. Mary's family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Mary goes to Kampala for shopping three times a week. Her greatest monthly expenses include school fees. She has a retail shop and sells to all categories of people on retail basis. She rents her business premises for 40,000 Ugandan shillings (about $US24) per month.

Mary sells to an average of 10 people per day, not counting the numerous children's requests for sweets and related edibles. She buys her products from Kikuubo one of the busiest places in Kampala City and uses public transport back to her business.

Mary has been in this business for over twenty-six years. Her main challenges include competition and limited capital, but she is well known by the residents, which is her added advantage. She has been working with MCDT since 2002 and servicing her twelfth loan. She wants to use this loan to invest more in beans, flour, sugar and soap. She is aspiring to construct more rental rooms and buy a deep freezer for perishable goods, and wire electricity in her houses.

Mary will share this loan with the other members of her group. .

loans.use: To buy beans, maize flour, sugar and soap.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana was born in 1972 and she is from the town of Doboj. She has two children, 5 and 14 years old. Her husband works as a bus driver and his salary is 600 KM. Ana works in a fast food place and she earns 350 KM monthly.

Ana will use this loan in the amount of 1 000 KM to buy flower seeds, because she already has a small place where she plants flowers and after some time she sells seedlings. That is a good way to earn additional money and it makes her happy to work with flowers. This job is a pleasure for her, especially after a hard working day.

loans.use: To buy flower seeds

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru: Нурова Идигуль проживает в городе Норак. Работает в том же городе. Занимается бизнесом. Торгует продуктами питания уже пять лет. Бизнес приносит доход ,который позволяет ей обеспечивать свою семью. Она одна кормит  и обеспечивает троих детей. Муж ничем не занимается , поэтому она очень много работает. Планирует получить кредит для увеличения товарооборота. Это поможет расширить бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Idigul N. lives in the city of Norak. She works in the same city, running a business. For the last five years she has been selling various foods. The income coming from the business enables her to support her family. She alone raises and provides for her three children. Her husband is jobless, so she works a lot. She decided to apply for a loan to increase sales. It will help her expand the business. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.ru:
Нуридинова Тутинисо родилась 1971 году. Она не замужем,  4 года занимается предпринимательской деятельностью в г. Душанбе, на рынке "Панджшер". Тутинисо достаточно хорошо разбирается в особенностях ворсовой ткани. У нее свои постоянные клиенты из пригородов столицы. В ее ассортименте товара можно найти разнообразные ткани из натурального шелка и легкие шифоны с необыкновенными узорами. Разнообразие и цветовая гамма товаров привлекают клиентов. Закупает она товар с поставщиков из Китая и в оптовом рынке «Корвон».
Хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа ворсовой ткани.
texts.en:
Tutiniso N. was born in 1971. She is married and has been an entrepreneur in Dushanbe at the “Pandzhsher” market for 4 years. Tutiniso has a good grasp on the particulars of woolen fabrics. She has regular customers from the suburbs of the capital. In Tutiniso’s product assortment you can find a variety of fabrics made from natural silk and light chiffons with unique patterns. The variety and color spectrum of her products attract customers. Tutiniso purchase her products from Chinese suppliers at the “Korvon” market. She would like to take out a loan of 4100 somoni ($1200) in order to purchase woolen fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase woolen fabrics

loans.name: Esther

texts.fr: A. Esther est âgé de 28 ans et pharmacienne de profession. Elle est  mariée et mère de deux enfants. Mme Esther tient un dépôt de pharmacie et de produits esthétiques à Kpalimé une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo à 120 Km de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Par cette chance de Kiva ,et ce premier crédit de FECECAV, elle souhaite faire des approvisionnements en produits génériques et de beauté afin de dégager suffisamment de profits ; ce faisant ainsi elle pourra gagner la confiance de soi et prendre en partie les charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esther A., 28, is a pharmacist by profession. She is married and the mother of two children. Esther runs a shop selling pharmaceuticals and beauty products in Kpalimé, a town situated in the southwest of Togo, 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo.

With the chance offered by Kiva and this first loan though FECECAV, she hopes to stock up on generic products and cosmetics in order to make sufficient profit from her shop. This will allow her to gain self-confidence and help support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic pharmaceuticals and cosmetics for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Guldasta.

texts.ru: Рахмонова Гульдаста проживает в городе Норак. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города , где торгует одеждой. Занимается этим бизнесом уже два года. Планирует развивать дело , а для этого , хочет получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев. Кроме развития бизнеса , получив кредит она сможет увеличить прибыльность и привлечь новых клиентов. Ведь товар она привозит из города Душанбе , а реализует у себя. Этим она помогает населению делать покупки у себя не выезжая за приделы  города.
texts.en:
Guldasta R. lives in the city of Norak. She is married, has three children, and has a business selling clothing at her stall in the city market. This business has been her work for the last two years. She wants to expand it, with the help of a 10 month loan. Beside expanding the business, recieving a loan would allow her to increase profits and attract new customers. After all, she brings the goods she sells at the stall from the city Dushanbe, allowing locals to shop nearby, without leaving their city.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Doniyor

texts.ru: Сангинов Дониер житель города Душанбе. Работает юристом. Нуждается в получении кредита для того , чтобы сыграть свадьбу. Поэтому хочет получить кредит в размере 1200 долларов США. Полученный кредит планирует погасить в течении 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Doniyor S. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He works as a lawyer. He needs a loan in order to put on a wedding. To do this he would like a loan of $1200 USD. The loan will be repaid over 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Holding a wedding

loans.name: Lolonu

texts.fr: Lolonu  A. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants.  Elle est une commerçante ambulante de produits génériques qu’elle vend en détail à Kpalimé une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo à 120 Km de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Mme Lolonu est un bon membre puisqu’elle a déjà bénéficié de plus de trois crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers.Avec ce crédit, elle souhaite approvisionner davantage en produits afin d’être plus compétitive sur le marché des particuliers. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Lolonu A. is 40 years old, married, and the mother of five. She is an itinerant merchant of generic pharmaceutical products, which she sells retail in Kpalimé, a city located in the southwest of Togo and about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Ms. Lolonu is a good member, since she has already been the recipient of more than three loans, and the payments have been regular. With this loan, she would like to have more inventory to be more competitive in the private marketplace. The profits that will be derived from her business will enable her to cover the needs of her children and to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals for resale

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.ru: Курбонов Собирджон житель района Рудаки. Возраст  23 года. Женат , но детей пока нет. Около трех лет занимается бизнесом. Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Балх»  района Рудаки , где торгует одеждой. Собирджон живет с родителями и поэтому ему приходится много рабоать для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью. В связи с этим он планирует получить кредит и расширить свою деятельность. Кредит – это не плохое решение , а погасить его он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sobirjon K. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 23 years old and married but does not have any children yet. He has been in business for about three years. He has a stall at the Rudaki district's Balkh Market, where he sells clothing. Sobirjon lives with his parents, so he must work hard to support the family. Because of that he decided to apply for a loan and expand his business. A loan is a good plan, and he will pay it of in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Mohbi

texts.ru: Хочиева Мохби жительница города Яван. Возраст 39 лет,она не замужем. Живет с родителями. Она одна обеспечивает своих родителей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли.Торгует продуктами питания. Бизнесом занимается уже 8 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет ей увеличить ассортимент товара . Ее магазин находится в центре кишлака, поэтому ее дело помогает населению приобретать товар, не выезжая за приделы села.Кроме того она хочет развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Mohbi H. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 39 years old and unmarried. She lives with her parents, and is their sole source of support. Her area of business is sales. She sells groceries, and has been in the business for 8 years already. She decided to take out a loan in order to increase her sales. It will help her expand her inventory selection. Her store is in the center of a village, which is helpful to the residents, as it allows them to purchase goods without needing to leave their town. She also wants to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Nurbibi.

texts.ru: Эшаева Норбиби жительница города Яан. Живет далеко от центра со своей семьей. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Занимается животноводством. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить бычка. Кредит поможет ей увеличить поголовье скота. Она откормит бычка и попозже в сезон сможет продать по более выгодной цене. Это будет дополнительным доходом для ее семьи. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Nurbibi A. is a resident of Yaan. She lives far from the center of the town with her family. She is married and has 4 children. Her main occupation is cattle breeding. She would like to obtain a loan so she could purchase a calf. These funds will help her increase the number of her livestock. She plans to feed the calf and sell it at a better price during the season later on. This will supply additional income for her family. She plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Ruzigul.

texts.ru: Тохирова Рузигуль проживает в городе Яван. Возраст41 год. Замужем и имеет восьмерых детей. Прокормить такую семью не так уж просто. Муж работает один и поэтому Рузигуль помогает мужу. Занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Откормленных бычков продает на рынке. Это помогает немного улучшить жизнь. Сейчас планирует получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ruzigul T. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 41 years old. She is married and has 8 children. It is very hard for her to feed a family of that size. She works together with her husband. They have a small farm where they breed cattle. They sell cattle after feeding it for a period of time. This business helps them to improve their quality of life. They plan to obtain a loan and pay it off in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Zahra's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Zahra is 30 years old. She is divorced with two children, aged eleven and four years old. Since 2005, Zahra has been selling firewood and charcoal. She works daily and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Zahra is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more charcoal and firewood to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Salma and Mtumwa, who have their own businesses selling charcoal, bread, and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Саидов Сухроб занимается необыкновенным делом. Убой скота и продажа мяса. Ему 28 лет, женат, имеет 3 детей. У него высшее образование. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность он начал еще в 2002 году.  Сухроб торгует говяжьим и бараньим мясом. Это семейный бизнес и переходит из покален в поколение. В продаже также имеются говяжий и бараний жир, внутренний жир. Шерсть  животных продает обработчикам кожи. В неделю 2 раза Сухроб покупает скот на убой и продает их мясо в арендуемом помещении. У него свои постоянные клиенты, население покупает для потребления, столовые для приготовления пищи и его продажи. 
Услышав о программе Кива Сухроб решил участвовать и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Suhrob S. works in a unique business, he slaughters livestock and sells meat. He is 28 years old, is married and has 3 children. He has a college education. Suhrob became an entrepreneur in 2002. He sells beef and lamb. This is a family business and has been passed down from generation to generation. Suhrob also sells beef and sheep fat. He sells the animal hair to leather workers. Two times a week Suhrob purchases livestock for slaughter and sells their meat in a rented location. He has regular customers, residents purchase meat for consumption and canteens purchase it for cooking dishes that they sell.

When Suhrob heard about Kiva he decided to participate and to take out a loan of 4100 somoni ($1200) in order to purchase large livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice A. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est coiffeuse et revendeuse de mèches destinées à sa propre clientèle depuis des années à Kpalimé une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo à 120 Km de Lomé la capitale Togo. Avec ce troisième crédit, Mme Béatrice désire acheter plus de produits de beauté, des mèches et un séchoir pour augmenter la capacité de son activité et par là participer davantage à la prise en charge des besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Béatrice A., 39, is married and the mother of four children. She is a hairdresser and has sold hair extensions for use by her own clientele for a number of years. She lives and works in Kpalimé, a town situated in the southwest of Togo, 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo.

With this, her third loan, Béatrice wants to buy more cosmetics, hair extensions, and a hair dryer so as to expand her business and thus to be able to do more to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hair extensions, cosmetics, and a hair dryer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sulemana

texts.en: Sulemana A. is 61 years old. He is married with four kids who are currently in school. Sulemana is a dealer in bicycle parts who also provides repair services for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and gives to his customers at retail prices. Goaso, where he lives and works, is a farming community. Sulemana says the sale of bicycle and parts is very lucrative business since most of the farmers ride on bicycle to their farms. He is seeking a loan to procure bicycle parts to better serve his customers. He hopes the loan will enable him to expand his shop and support his children in school. He belongs to the community group called Ebenezer Trust Group. In this group, members agree to provide guarantees to each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To expand stock of bicycle parts

loans.name: Mgeni's Maendeleo. Group

texts.en:
Mgeni is 45 years old. She is divorced and cares for her fifteen year old child. Since 2002, Mgeni has made a living selling porridge, soup, and bites (snacks). She works daily from 8am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Mgeni is requesting a loan of $500 to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have their own businesses selling snacks and potatoes.

loans.use: To expand her food selling business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda D. is a 31-year-old woman. She is married with three kids. Two of the kids are currently in school. Hilda is a resourceful mother. Her daily dream is to be able to work hard enough to provide her kids with a quality education for better future careers.

Hilda owns and operates grocery shop in one of the busy local markets and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. With this loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock.

Hilda hopes to save more to be able to pay her kids' school fees. She is a member of a community group called Ebenezer Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Momajon

texts.ru:
Сафарова Момаджон  является одной из женщин, у кого большой ассортимент детской одежды. Она   1969 года рождения, разведена, у нее 3 детей. Занимается продажей  одежды от новорожденных до школьного возраста на рынке «Панджшер» города Душанбе. Предпринимательскую деятельность начала в 2003 году. Момаджон старается с каждым годом увеличивать наименование товара. Свой товар она привозит с рынка «Корвон» и иногда закупает у поставщиков из Китая. 
Ассортимент продаваемых ею товаров она хочет пополнить разновидностями детских обуви. В разгар сезона продажи осенней обуви  хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Momajon S. is one of the women who has a large assortment of children’s clothing for sale. She was born in 1969, is divorced and has 3 children. She sells children’s clothing in sizes ranging from newborn to school aged at the “Pandzhsher” market in Dushanbe. Momajon started her business in 2003. She tries to increase the variety of her products every year. Momajon purchases her products at the “Korvon” market and sometimes purchases products from Chinese suppliers.

Momajon would like to increase her product assortment with a selection of children’s shoes as this is the height of the season for autumn footwear. Momajon would like to participate in Kiva and to take out a loan of 4100 somoni ($1200) for the purchase of new products to sell.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi O. is 32 years old. He is married and has one little kid who is currently in school. Kofi sells traveling bags and suitcases in the local market of Goaso, a town where he lives. He buys his supply of bags from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

Kofi is requesting this loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of traveling bags and suitcases. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings to expand his shop, to rent a shop to house his goods. He belongs to the community group called Amofa Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of traveling bags and suitcases

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas A. is 35 years old. He is married and has two kids who are currently in school. He is a retailer of auto parts, which he buys from spare parts dealers and re-sells to his customers. He enjoys his trade very much; however, he does not have adequate funds to support his business, especially with the current price hikes. He therefore needs a loan to remain in business. With this loan, he will purchase new stock of spare parts and scraps to serve his customers. He believes the loan will enable him to save more to finance his kids' education. He is a member of the community group called Anderson Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase stock of auto parts

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.ru:
Сафарова Наргиз родилась в 1983 году. Она замужем и имеет 1 ребенка. Наргиз является одним из преуспевающим бизнесменом в своем городе. Начала бизнес как продавщица у своей знакомой, которая продавала ткани и материалы. Набрав опыта в продажи тканей и материалов, изучая востребованость рынка, решила открыть свой бизнес. И вот уже 4 года  торгует тканями самых разных  видов. Ее ассортимент состоит из ворсовых, шелковых шифоновых тканей. У нее есть постоянные клиенты. Местом ее деятельности является рынок «Сафина» города Рудаки, а закупает она товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе.
Наргиз хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони и увеличить оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Nargiz S. was born in 1983. She is married with one child. Nargiz is one of the most successful businesspeople in the city. She began in business as a saleswoman for an acquaintance who sold fabrics and materials. After she received experience in selling fabric and material and researched demand in the market, she decided to open her own business. Now, she has been trading in different kinds of fabrics for four years. Her inventory consists of velvet, silk, and chiffon. She has regular customers. Her shop is in the Safin market in Rudaki, and she buys her goods in the wholesale market Korvon in Dushanbe. Nargiz wants to receive a loan for 4,100 somoni to increase her working capital.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicolas M. is 36 years old. He is married and has three kids who are currently in school. He is a retailer of auto parts and is also an auto electrician. He buys his spare parts from dealers and re-sells them to his customers. As a result of his rich experience in the field, his numerous clients have a lot of trust and confidence in him and prefer to service their vehicles at his rented shop; he enjoys his business very much. However, he does not have adequate funds to support his business, especially with recent price hikes; therefore, he needs the loan to remain in business. With this loan, he wants to purchase a new stock of spare parts to better serve his customers. He believes the loan will enable him to save more to finance his kids' education and also build his own shop. He is a member of the community group called Anderson Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a larger stock of auto parts

loans.name: Foster

texts.en:
Foster A., 33 years old, is married and the father of two kids who are currently in school. He operates a clothing shop and sells jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, dressing bags, and headscarves. He also has been sewing unisex clothing for the past four years.

Foster is constrained by insufficient funds to run the business. He needs this loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up his business progress. He believes the loan will help him to purchase good quality and larger quantity to upgrade his inventory. He wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, ladies' wear, headscarves, and slippers. He belongs to the community group called Great Provider Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' wear, slippers, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Salma's Hatuchoki Group

texts.en:
Salma is 36 years old. She is married with three children, aged fourteen, sixteen, and eighteen years old. Since 2002, she has been selling clothing. She works daily and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Salma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Salma is now requesting a loan of $1925 to buy more clothing for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have their own businesses selling perfume, juice, bites (snacks), cosmetics, phone vouchers, clothing, shoes, CDs, and DVDs.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Muhamadazim

texts.ru:
Мухамадазим, ему 27 лет, он женат и имеет троих детей. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность начал в 2005 году с продажи  кондитерских изделий в арендуемом магазине. В данный момент у него большой ассортимент товаров. Он торгует конфетами и кондитерскими изделиями производства России на рынке «Саховат» города Душанбе. В его ассортименте также имеются сухофрукты, такие как изюм, миндаль, сушеный абрикос, фисташки и орехи. Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах «Сафар-Центр»-а города Душанбе и у оптовиков из города Худжанда и Исфары. 
Услышав о программе Кива, решил участвовать и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Muhamadazim is 27 years old, married and has three children. He started his entrepreneurship in 2005 selling confectionery products at a leased store. Currently, he has a wide assortment of products. He sells Russian-produced candy and confectionery at the Sahovat market in Dushanbe. Muhamadazim’s product assortment also includes dried fruit and nuts, such as raisins, apricots, almonds and pistachios. He buys his goods at wholesale stores in Dushanbe, Khujand and Isfara. Once he heard about the Kiva program, Muhamadazim decided to participate and obtain a loan of $1200, needed to increase his goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase confectionery products

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 26 years old. She is married and has a two-year-old child. Since 2002, she has been running her own shop and selling phone vouchers. She works daily from 8am to 9pm and earns a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales

In the past, Zainab has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Zainab is now requesting an additional loan to increase the inventory of her store.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ibn Chambas

texts.en:
A., as he is popularly called, is 30 years old. He is single with one child who is currently in school. A. is a dealer in electrical supplies and electric appliances like radio sets, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

A. is requesting this loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of electrical and electronics parts. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include sound systems and television. He would be very grateful for your support.

A. has been in this business for the past eight years and so has a lot of experience with wider market share in his business area. He belongs to the community group called Royal Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of electrical and electronic appliances

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emma as this young man is popularly called is 31 years old. He is single and very hard working. Emmanuel is a dealer in electrical goods like assorted lights, electrical cables, extension plugs, wires, electric lamps, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

Emmanuel is requesting a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators. He would be very grateful for your support.

Emmanuel has been in this business for the past eight years and has a lot of experience with a wider market share in his business area. He belongs to the community group called Great Provider Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of electric appliances

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 32 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 14 and 13. She has been a clothes and bites seller since 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Fatma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Fatma is now seeking a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel A., popularly called Agyengo, is 32 years old. He is married with one kid who is currently in school. Emmanuel is a dealer in hardware such as assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes, etc., in Goaso, the town where he lives with his family.

Emmanuel buys his supplies from importers in Kumasi, the regional capital Ashanti, at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He is requesting this loan to enable him to procure increased stocks of paints, nails, hammers, etc., to accelerate his business progress. With the loan, he hopes to increase his savings so as to expand his shop to include the sale of cement. He would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted paints, nails, sandpaper, hammers, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 40 years old. She is a widow with 3 children aged 23, 16, and 12 years old. She has been a fish and clothes (bedsheets and khanga--traditional Tanzanian wraps) seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Fatma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Fatma now seeks a loan to expand her business by adding more fish and clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish and clothes for the expansion of her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James K. A. operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation six years ago. He is the 55-year-old father of four kids who are currently in school. He sells products like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc.

With the loan, James wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase his stock of goods. He also hopes to increase his savings to provide the kids with quality education. He would appreciate your assistance very much. He is a member of the community group called A. Solidarity Group. Members of this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, etc. for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina was born and raised in Western Ukraine. For nearly 8 years she has successfully operated a business selling quality perfumes and cosmetics. She now has a small sales kiosk in the central market of her home town of Beregovo. Being the entrepreneur that she is, Valentina is always ready to explore new opportunities.  Eventually she would like to diversify her products and in turn, generate more products.

Valentina has built up around $2000 in working capital and has an extensive history of working with Nadiya Ukraine and has successfully repaid all loans with no delinquencies.  She is now requesting a loan for 1,500 Grivnas ($325) to buy more cosmetic supplies. She believes that through her business, and the products she offers at the market, she can help her female customers stay pretty and attractive, and at the same time, she can meet the basic needs of her own family as well.      

Note: this is a short term "express" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase second-hand furniture and household goods, etc. for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis F., 36 year old woman, is married and has three kids. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, and so on. She needs a loan to enable her to re-stock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, and other goods, in order to scale up sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to raise enough income to sponsor her kids' education. She would be thankful for that support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, and cartons of vegetable oil.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine and sells women's clothing and footwear in the local market. Irina has a nice variety of women's clothing and footwear items. She is very cheerful and friendly. Her first goal is to please her customers, which has added a lot to the success of her business. Irina's reasonable pricing policy helps her keep loyal clients and attract new customers.

Irina has been an entrepreneur for 10 years. Loans she has received and repaid from Nadiya Ukraine have also played a big part in the growth of her business. Presently, she has over $4000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $3000. Monthly net profit is about $600.

Today Irina is requesting a loan of 1500 Grivnas to increase assorted inventory. This financial assistance will help her increase her sales and grow her business as a result. Not only will it help Irina get the necessary inventory and attract more customers, but it will help her provide a stable income for her family and meet all their needs.

Note: this is a short term "express" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a successful and consistent entrepreneur from Melitopol in southeastern Ukraine. She works as a traveling vendor selling women's clothing in small markets in the region. Galina launched her business about 10 years ago. Financial assistance in Nadiya Ukraine has been an effective means of stimulating her sales and growing her business throughout those years.

Currently, Galina has about $1600 of gross income each month. Her net profit is about $600. Galina feels secure and peaceful when she sees that her family gets everything they need for normal living. She is happy to generate enough money to cover her son's college fees and pay their bills. She is hoping to continue seeing her business thrive and bring her sufficient income. 

This time she is seeking a loan of 3000 Grivnas ($650 USD) to increase her sales and develop her trade.  

NOTE: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase her sales

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel M. is 34years old. He is married and has a child who is currently in school. "Sammy," as he is well-known, is a dealer in used television. The sale of used television is popular because brand new ones are expensive for many people. He also provides repairs and other services for his customers. He buys his televisions from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He is seeking a loan to enable him to procure an expanded stock of used television to better serve his customers' needs. He hopes to save enough to expand his shop to include the sale of refrigerators and parts. He belongs to the community group called Peace Trust Group. In this group, members provide each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure an expanded stock of used television

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a little daughter Anastasia who is only 2. She is an aspiring entrepreneur from Melitopol. Irina runs a kiosk selling household items in the central marketplace. Her enterprise is well-known for a flexible discount system she offers to her customers. Irina has always wanted to be self-employed. Her parents have been very supportive of the idea which is why she ventured to make her dream come true about a year ago. Presently, she is already making about $700 in net profit. She has $2000 in inventory.

Irina wants to keep her enterprise running to be able to provide for her family and support her elderly parents, too. She has many bright ideas she is hoping to implement along the way. Irina is a lively optimist and tries to mirror that attitude in her work as well. She is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan for 12 months and is hoping to repay the loan without any delinquencies. One of her personal wishes is to finish remodeling in her private house to make it a more comfortable place to live.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Robinah Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Robinah is a leader of a five-member group. She is 30 years old, married and has two children ages four and eight. Both of her children go to school, and Robinah also takes care of the two children of her late brother. She owns and resides in a three-room house living with six people There is no electricity but it does have running water. The family gets four meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Robinah works six days a week and rents her business space. Her greatest monthly expenses include her rent, school fees, and medication. She is a tailor and also sells new clothes like bitenge and African attire. Robinah sells to an average of five people per day. She uses public transportation to buy her materials from Kampala. Robinah has been in this business for the last eight years.

Robinah has been with MCDT for the last six years and thirteen loans, working all this time with her same groupmates. She wanted to use this loan to invest in a video camera and to add more stock to her retail clothes. She aspires to buy more sewing machines and start a training school.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothes and purchase video camera

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
Kwadwo B. is a 41-year-old man. He is married with four children who are currently in school. He trades in agro-chemicals and sells various kinds of chemicals like weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. Goaso, a town where Kwadwo lives with his family, is a farming community and because of that, many local farmers patronize his shop and buy his products because of the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farmlands.

With the loan, Kwadwo wants to purchase more supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines to serve the needs of his customers. He hopes to raise enough income to pay for his kids' education. He would be very appreciative of your assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her little kiosk

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and has a two-year-old daughter. His family lives in Melitopol where Oleg owns a small business selling cell phones and accessories in one of the local electric appliances stores. His enterprise has a very favorable location as the store is usually packed with customers, especially on weekends. Oleg has been in business for 6 years. Presently, he has about $1400 in inventory and his net profit is approximately $800. 

Oleg is seeking a loan of $1075 (5000 Grivna) to increase the assortment of merchandise at his stand. In this way, he hopes to increase his income and provide a better livelihood for his family. Oleg has promptly repaid all previous loans to Nadiya Ukraine, which will secure a timely repayment of the current loan as well.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Sanela

texts.en:
Sanela is a twenty-six year old divorced woman and mother of one child.  She works as a salesgirl in a shop in Doboj and earns a salary of 500 KM.  

This is Sanela's first loan, in the amount of 1 200 KM ($900), and she will use it to buy compost to prepare her field for the winter.  Her wish is to increase her vegetable production in the spring.

loans.use: To buy compost.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana started her own business in order to have an income rather than having a steady job with low wages. She decided to set up her own food production and sales business.

She needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the ingredients she needs to keep her food sales going.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana inició su negocio por la necesidad de tener una entrada de dinero en vez de tener un trabajo fijo que le de un sueldo bajo, ella decidió tener su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de comida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y así poder continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Angel De  Jesus

texts.es:
Ángel is married and has a one-year-old son. He started his own business as a result of being laid off from his previous job. He decided to start a business that would bring in better earnings for him while at the same time allow him to spend more time with his family since his schedule at his previous job never permitted him to spend much time with them. In shoe sales, he found what he was after, so now he sells shoes for a living.

He is requesting a loan of $500.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and thus be able to fill his customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángel es casado y tiene un pequeño hijo de 1 año. Empezó con el negocio a raíz de que lo desocuparon del trabajo, es por ello que decidió dedicarse a una actividad que le redituar mejores ingresos y que le permitiera pasar mas tiempo con su familia, ya que por los horarios de su anterior trabajo no pasaba mucho tiempo con ellos. En la venta de zapatos encontró lo que buscaba y se dedica a esto.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder cumplir con unos pedidos que tiene que entregar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (footwear)

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is in retail because she has always had a penchant for it and because she does not like to rely 100% on her husband’s income. Furthermore, she wanted to help him out with the family expenses. For this reason, she sells American clothing.

She needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase clothing in bulk. With your support, she will be able to achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina se dedica a las ventas ya que siempre le han llamado la atención y no le gusta depender 100 % del sueldo de su esposo, además de querer ayudarlo con el gasto familiar. Es por eso que se dedica a la venta de ropa americana.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar unas pacas de ropa. Con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Tanja

texts.en:
Tanja was born in 1982 and she is not married.  Her monthly salary is 800 KM.  This is her second  loan from WWI and she is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 KM ($600). 

Her wish is to start making cookies in her home and she will use the loan to buy the materials for this enterprise. From the sale of her baked products she will earn additional money for her household.

loans.use: To buy material for cookies.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru:
Холматов Хабибулло, 1971 года рождения, женат и имеет 3 детей.  Он торгует продуктами питания. У него 15 лет опыта в этой сфере. Ассортимент продаваемого товара состоит из кондитерских изделий, разновидностей консервной продукции, продуктов детского питания, разных сливочных и хлопковых масел, сахара, хлеба, колбасных изделий и т.д. Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах «Сафар-Центр»-а города Душанбе. Его магазин находится в центре кишлака, и многие жители покупают необходимые продукты у него.  
Хабибулло хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для оптового закупа муки, риса, сахара и растительного масла.
texts.en:
Habibullo H. was born in 1971. He is married and has three children. He trades in foodstuffs. He has fifteen years of experience. His inventory consists of confections, supplies for canning, children's food, butter and cottonseed oil, sugar, bread, sausage, etc. He buys the goods in a wholesale shop called Safar-Center in Dushanbe. His shop is in the village center, and many people buy their necessities there. Habibullo wants to take out a loan for 4,100 somoni to buy flour, rice, sugar and vegetable oil wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour, rice, sugar, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie O. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells yams at New Benin market. She has been in this business since 2002. She is a LAPO client. She sells and supplies yams to yam vendors at New Benin market.

Julie needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more yams for sale. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida was born in 1970 and she lives with her husband and three children in the town of Doboj. Her husband works in construction in Croatia and earns about 1 000 KM monthly. This is Aida's first loan through WWI and she will use it to buy material for making cookies to sell. Her wish is to start to do something for her household, because she has a lot of free time and she likes to make cookies.

loans.use: To buy material for making cookies to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru:
Шамсиддин 1973 года рождения. Женат и имеет 3   детей. Чтобы пополнить семейный бюджет дополнительным доходом решил заняться предпринимательской деятельностью. Он арендовал торговую точку на рынке для продажи детских игрушек. Наращивая свой опыт предпринимателя Шамсиддин вырученные деньги с бизнеса, пускал в оборот. В его ассортименте разные игрушки, начиная от погремушек для новорожденных до конструкторов школьного возраста. Также в продаже имеются игры развивающие интеллектуальное мышление ребенка. 
Свои товары он закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Для увеличения ассортимента хочет участвовать в программе «Кива» и получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони для увеличения товаров.
texts.en:
Shamsiddin was born in 1973. He is married and has 3 children. In order to increase his household income, he decided to start an entrepreneurship. He leased a retail outlet at a market to sell children’s toys. Growing his entrepreneurial experience, Shamsiddin invested his profits back into his business. His goods assortment includes various toys, ranging from rattle toys for infants to construction sets for school-aged kids. He also sells games that foster intellectual development of children. Shamsiddin buys his goods at the Corvon wholesale market in Dushanbe. He would like participate in the Kiva program and obtain a $900 loan in order to increase his goods inventory.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children toys
